description:
I'm gonna go full on with the stars. I mean it is certainly not a fancy restaurant with beautiful decor or excellent services with coûteux beverages and menu. Let's be real. This location is a to go restaurant thus, everything about it is Fast and Furious (*^o^*)

I knew through the review so I didn't come with any high expectation. My aim was 'Canh Chua' coz apparently many reviewers said it was their signature dish. Man, it tastes best with rice. The pineapple (sweet and sour) will drive your tastebud nut! A big disappointment...they stopped carrying the dish. The waitress told me it was too sweet to the majority of customers (perhaps non-Vietnamese duh!). Unfortunately, it is also their main paycheck *sigh*

No way to get out now. I went on ahead and ordered Imperial rolls with lemon grass marinated beef noodle-my go to dish. It was salty. The mixed fish sauce was even saltier. Mediocre tasting.

I gave five stars for the fast, friendly service. The authentic kitchen-plus the staff. Felt like coming back to the HK street food style. My VN coffee was prep once order. I've always found pleasure in watching the black filter coffee drop...slowly into the white condensed milk. Relaxing.
author: Bao V.

description:
Definitely NOT authentic Vietnamese. Big mistake for coming here.
1. The front has a big sign PHO, but they only one item for Pho: combo.
2. NO one speak Vietnamese at this place. 
3. I ordered garlic noodles with BBQ chicken. Def not a Vietnamese dish. The noodle is soggy and the chicken slices were thin as rice paper. And tastes real bad. I couldn't allow myself to finish it .
If you are a REAL Vietnamese food fan. This place WILL disappoint you.
author: P S.

description:
Delicious hole in the wall Vietnamese spot!

I've tried:
Lemongrass chicken noodle bowl
Tofu and vegetable noodle soup
Tofu spring rolls
Imperial Rolls

Never been disappointed. Cheap,quick and friendly service.
author: M V.

description: First time every trying this food and omg SUNFLOWER is still on my brain. The food was mad to order and fast. I've been getting off the Bart everyday I go to SF rite in front of their restaurant and I think I found a diamond in the ruff. It's not that noticeable and they don't stand out but once you taste this food you will fall in love and become a regular!!
author: Corneilius M.

description:
Menu has changed, dropped a lot of Vietnamese dishes :( and added Chinese dishes :( 
Not a fav spot anymore.
author: S R.

description: Sunflower used to be one of my favorite restaurants in the area, but they recently stopped serving most Vietnamese menu items and started serving a Chinese menu. No more imperial rolls (now Chinese egg rolls), no more Vietnamese hot and sour soup (now Chinese hot and sour soup, which is extremely different). One star for the new menu, five stars for the old menu. Don't call yourself a Vietnamese restaurant if you serve Chinese food instead.
author: Mo M.

description:
Very small restaurant right next to the Roxie.  The kitchen area seems bigger than the eating area.  I imagine that most diners go to the larger eponymous Sunflower Vietnamese around the corner, but I kinda like the casual environment here of watching the takeout customers come and go.

Beef Noodle Soup: A no frills pho bo that gets the job done.  No choice of beef parts, just thin slices that are transforming from rare-to-well-done as the bowl travels to your table.  I'm glad there wasn't any chewy tripe or slimy tendon.  But I kinda missed having meatballs.  In addition to the traditional accouterments on the side plate, there was a pleasant amount of herbs and thin onion slices floating on top of the broth.  I love me some cilantro, so that was perfect.  What I really appreciated was the generous amount of broth.  I'll gladly trade some rice noodles if extra soup fills the space.  Their broth wasn't as amazing as Bodega Bistro's, but was pretty tasty.
author: Adam B.

description:
I've lived half a block from this place my entire life and just started going a few months ago! Everything I have tried so far is delicious.

Initially I went in to try a soup. I was not a fan of the hot and sour soup. I then discovered their noodle soups and always go there when I am in the mood for some chicken noodle soup with extra vegetables for about $10 total.

I then heard about their garlic noodles. There is no way I can go there without ordering this. It is a huge portion starting at $8 without chicken or extra vegetables. It is maybe enough for one extremely hungry person, plenty for two, and three can still share this with a  side of something else. Either way, this is my absolutely favorite thing here, and a must try.

If you are looking for some starters, you can't go wrong with their imperial rolls or spring rolls.

So happy I found this gem! Just a heads up, they have a small location on 16th street, between Valencia St. and Albion St., and another bigger location right around the corner on Valencia St. between 16th and 17th. They are literally a 30 second walk from each other. Enjoy!
author: Kassie E.

description:
Dont have any reason to give them less than 5 stars! 
Their foods come fresh and big portion
I do love the chicken salad ,tender no dry and feel healthy 

L
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: My very first build your own Vietnamese spring roll experience! It was super tasty. The garlic noodles with the prawns has to be my favorite dish! Even asked for "extra sauce" cuz I like my noodles extra saucy ;) I also got a coconut to drink and they even opened up the coconut for me to eat the coconut meat as a dessert. It was super tasty. Cute neighborhood with plenty of street parking nearby. Wait was approx 15 mins.
author: Tammy C.

description: Crepe Note!  Sunflower has taken Crepes off the menu! The vegetarian crepes were the best vegan option here.  Without it, I have no reason to order here.  The rest of their menu is so-so to not so good.  So I'll be checking with them to see if they change their mind.  If you like their crepes, please call and let them know that this was a big mistake!  (If they bring them back, I'll update my review.)
author: Ken R.

description: The inside of the restaurant was small but had ample seating for us all. It also helped that it was after the usual lunch hour when people normally sat down for their noon meal. Our waitress was pleasant but had to ask the chef every time we had a question or request. We could not tell whether she was doing that because she did not know the menu well. We could see her approaching the chef over and over with our questions (it was easy to see that because the kitchen area was bigger than the eating area). Anyway, we started with the Tofu Spring Rolls (I think they were bland and boring) and for main course I got the Lemongrass Chicken Noodle Bowl. My entree was amazing! I am pretty familiar with Vietnamese food and I can tell you that this dish wasn't far from extraordinary. I'll definitely come back whenever I crave Vietnamese food or hot noodles or soup.
author: Abel K.

description:
"Hi, can I order vermicelli pork with..."
"Hello! Is this John?"
"... Yes it's me..."

I usually order the same takeout dish every weekend and the entire kitchen recognizes me. Born and raised in San Jose, I always crave a good, authentic, Vietnamese dish. Since moving up to San Francisco 7 (omg 7) years ago from San Jose, Sunflower has been my goto take out place for comfort food. Their pho has helped me recover from so many hangovers and their vermicelli has helped me calm down after those crazy days at work.
author: John L.

description: Woo! An almost obscure hole in the wall in the Mission that serves up great soup with beef and an imperial roll. Can't complain. This place can easily become my go to for affordable soup, plus the randomly wandering millenials apparently haven't discovered this establishment and that's always a good thing.
author: Frank L.

description: Amazing food, friendly wait staff, great prices, warm and welcoming dining atmosphere. Highly recommend. They take reservations and walk ins. Convenient location!
author: Zoe M.

description:
Came here with a few friends to try out the garlic noodles. I also ordered the BBQ beef with vermicelli noodles, but they gave me the BBQ pork. That was okay, I didn't mind too much. 

The portions were great, but I think the food was lacking. The garlic noodles weren't garlic-y, but kind of reminded me of plain chow mein noodles. The egg rolls in the vermicelli were great though!

Decided to try it out again with my boyfriend to give the garlic noodles another go (because I just tried my friends plate the previous time) but it was still pretty tasteless. I added a lot of hot sauce and soy sauce :D it was pretty good after that! 

All and all, the portions were huge but I felt like a bit of the taste and also the service was lacking. The prices are pretty average, not cheap but for the portions reasonable!
author: Melanie T.

description:
The lunch specials here are delightful. We stumbled in today after I finished my haircut near by looking for some spicy, warm food and this really fit the bill. While we initially came in looking for noodle soup or Pho, we saw these amazing lunch specials for $10.95 that included an entree, an imperial roll, a salad and a cup of hot and sour soup. Needless to say, we were sold immediately. 

I ordered the Lemongrass Chicken (#3) lunch special and my boyfriend got the BBQ Pork (#2) lunch special. We were pleasantly surprised when the food arrived 10 minutes later on these huge platters. Both entrees were phenomenal (tasty, well cooked and fresh) and the portions were substantial. I was a huge fan of the hot and sour soup with its distinct taste of pineapple. My boyfriend found the taste a bit overwhelming but was really into the Imperial Roll. The side salad was a refreshing, light slaw. We both were extremely happy with our meals and neither of us finished our plate which for us, is really remarkable.

The only thing I didn't love was how cramped the seating was. We were at a communal table and really felt like we were on top of the group next to us. I believe this is a temporary situation for Sunflower, however, so hopefully their other space is a bit more forgiving.

Overall, I cannot wait to come back and try more on the menu. Reasonable prices, huge portion and good taste always win in my book.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Don't overlook this hold in the wall!!

I honestly don't know why the ratings are low. But I also didn't look at the reviews before coming here because I usually go to the Potrero Hill location (menu was similar enough for me to just go, plus it was open at like 4:15pm).  

PARKING: street (might have to go a few blocks away for non-meter)

SERVICE: super attentive and friendly; the space is pretty small (hole in the wall)

FOOD: The portions were huge and so filling - the five spice chicken vermicelli bowl was super delicious as was the grilled pork vermicelli bowl.
author: Cheri C.

description: I like the other location of sunflower more as it's close to my house, but this one is pretty good also.
author: Michael E.

description:
After working a 10 hour day, i found this location very convenient by 16th st bart and the food delicious at appropriate price and size.
 
I got the beef and imperial rolls vermicelli bowl. The imperial roll was good. The skin used is a little thicker but I found it to be crunchier than other imperial rolls. Beef was delicious and so were the noodles.

The amount they gave is easily split into two meals. Price (including tax) $11

Overall great experience. There doesn't seem to be much seating, enough 15-20 people? 

Oh and yelp lied to me. They said the restaurant isn't open on Mondays at ~7pm but they are.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Lemongrass chicken over rice was plain grilled greasy chicken over rice
My first time...my last
Over price and tips....not worth coming back
Again..City food need Gordon Ramsey to pay a visit
author: Chef C.

description:
This has become my go to spot for garlic noodles - amazing flavor and portions.
They have a great selection of vegetarian options - imperial rolls, vermicelli, pho, and veggie dishes like eggplant and veg curry.

I usually go with the mixed vegetable garlic noodles which is amazing. For the price, portion, taste, and quality - you won't find better in the area. The vegetarian pho is also the best I've had so far - simple soup base but full of flavor - probably from the french fried onion toppings. They don't skimp on the fresh veggies either. 

The veg imperial rolls are excellent - the filling is delicious and it's perfectly crisped on the outside. Also not as greasy as you would expect. Prices are great ($10-12 a dish) for the huge portions you get. 

The place is tiny with an open kitchen - fits at most ~20 ppl so I would not bring a large party here. Parking is tough around valencia/ 16th - I usually find more spots on mission st. They take credit card as well. Overall one of my favorite dinner spots and when I'm feeling garlic noodles or vegetarian.
author: Brenda L.

description: Sad to see this location close, it was by far and away the pho in SF hands down.  Living on the other side of town, the PH location is just too far.  Open then open another one closer
author: Dj S.

description:
Decent Vietnamese restaurant conveniently located in the Mission District of San Francisco. Came here on a Friday night for dinner with a friend.

We ordered a few things to share:
- Imperial rolls: great -- very crisp and tasty.
- BBQ Pork Vermicelli: good -- huge portion of vermicelli, pork was decent
- Five spice chicken: okay -- chicken was tender, though a bit too greasy for my preference

Service was friendly and the food came out very quickly. Recommend a try.
author: Alvin W.

description: The chicken noodle soup was delicious! It hit the spot. The space is small, but it's cute. I would definitely go back!
author: Lauren P.

description:
I wonder how many people come here as a second choice to Mau. Apparently, Mau closes at 3 pm on Sundays, a realization which brought me to Sunflower to satisfy my noodle soup craving on a windy SF afternoon. My boyfriend and I were seated on the inside of a few tables pushed together to form one communal table. During our meal, two couples were seated next to us but asked to sit elsewhere (one at a separate table for two, and the other at the bar). Kind of odd that the staff would offer the seats next to us first. 

The service we received was not rude but it was very impersonal. Our order was taken and food was brought out very quickly - Thai iced teas witching 5 minutes, my soup within 8 minutes and my boyfriend's BBQ chicken noodle dish within the next 5 minutes after mine came out. Weird order, but at least it gave me time to season my pho before my boyfriend got his food. 

Having had Mau two days before eating here and being super pleased with that meal, I'll compare this to that. Sunflower's broth was much less flavorful and the cut of meet was thin and did not melt in my mouth the way Mau's does. 

My boyfriend was not too impressed with the BBQ chicken noodle dish as a whole, but he said the spring rolls that came with his dish were excellent. 

Authenticity note - Sunflower bills itself as pan Asia cuisine but I suspect it is best known for its Vietnamese offerings. Most of the staff appeared to speak Cantonese.
author: Christina G.

description: Tried this in lieu of going to my regular, Mau, down the street. My advice is firmly to avoid. The catfish was perhaps the saltiest thing I've eaten in the mission, and the only thing the garlic noodles had going for them was garlic.
author: James A.

description: My go-to cheap eats spot when I'm craving Vietnamese. I love their shrimp spring rolls so much that I'll often pick up an order on my walk home from work as my late afternoon snack / early dinner. The lunch combos with imperial rolls & lemongrass chicken are also excellent. (The Pho is solid here, but I prefer Mao for pho)
author: C M.

description: This hole-in-the-wall has the best eggplant I've ever had! The service is quick and exceptional. The waitress offered my mom her personal soy milk to use in the Thai iced tea my mom ordered after my mom revealed she could not drink dairy. This restaurant is very vegan friendly, as my mother and I had many options to choose from. The waitress was also happy to accommodate us.
author: Julia A.

description: I love this place.  They have fast service, the food is spot on, and the serving sizes are decent.  The ambience isn't the fanciest but the price is right.  My hubs and I had the egg rolls, banh Zoe, and pho.  The pho is served in authentic Vietnamese fashion, with thinly sliced beef which is to be cooked in the piping hot broth (to maintain the tender texture)... which seems to confuse a few of the reviewers.  I like it this way, not only because that's how we ate it growing up but because it speaks to the quality of the beef.  Yum!!!  My favorite Vietnamese place in the area!!
author: sarah h.

description: I came here for luncn on a weekday and had the Beef Noodle Soup. Two stars because the broth tasted extremely watered down, there is only one cut of beef in the soup, there is no combo option with tripe and meatballs and this underwhelming soup is $10. This does not feel like a traditional vietnamese restaurant, the soup speaks for itself.
author: Alex O.

description:
This place has been consistently great with their food and service. I have been here about 4 times now and each time has been great. 

This time I ordered the beef Pho and their shrimp rolls and it was just as great as the last time. The broth is always at just the right temperature and they provide this more than enough fixins to put in your dish. 

It's aways a good portion, and sometimes I have enough broth for leftovers which I live for. Affordable, tasty, and enough to keep you going the next day is something I can get behind and this place does just that. 

The staff is always so friendly and efficient too whenever I been and even give you little cups to fill up on Sriracha and hoisin sauce In case you don't have any at home. I definitely recommend this place and even if you do have a sit down meal in their small establishment, the staff with get you full enough to feel larger than life (cheesiness insued) :)
author: Jamal P.

description:
SUNFLOWER!!
  Sweet mother of all that is holy and just, this place is guuud.  Best damn Vietnamese food in the western hemisphere cooked with the grace and delicate spicing of an iron chef.  I divulge all the moneys here to savor at their lovely spicey curries, sweet + sour soup, and egg rolls.  This place goes the extra mile and then some.

It's a little cramped inside since they lost their larger location (*tear*) but what's here is terrific, and a great excuse to sit a little closer to your wonderful date :)

I do hope one day they will do delivery.
author: Thomas T.

description:
I love this place.  Vegetarian dishes to delight, and deep flavor on all the food.
They just reopened the formal dining room!
author: Marcus C.

description:
Really enjoyed my meal here at sunflower. I've been here a few times and everytime I've left with my Asian cravings satisfied. In terms of mission area, this is definitely one of the better Asian food and the pricing is very modest. I've had the vermicelli with pork and was a solid 4/5. If you are here for lunch, I would definitely recommend ordering the lunch special. Excellent portion! I was very stuffed and had enough leftovers for dinner after. The soup that came with the lunch combo was probably my favourite part of the meal, very flavourful and tasty. I ordered the five spice chicken, the chicken was in my opinion a bit dry. However, for the price point and the amount of food you're getting, you really can't complain too much. Also tired the Thai milk tea, it was a bit disappointing, was really hoping for more of a tea flavour.

A 4 star for a SF Asian restaurant in the mission **
author: Jessica T.

description: I love this spot. I randomly barge in here when I ravenously hungry this past weekend. The food was really good. The whole ambiance of the place isn't fancy at all.You got a jumble of random tables and chairs with bars on the windows. But the food speaks for itself. I got the mixed vegetables in garlic sauce and the prawn hot and sour soup. Definitely both a favorite. The service was good by that I mean we got our food super fast which is the only thing I care about when I'm hungry. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Love this place. Don't judge a book or restaurant by its cover. Got the lunch special and could not finish it, as they give you soup , a small salad plus your entree with some rice. Yum yum gimme some......
author: Craig C.

description:
Great great great noodles . 


Very awesome recommendation from a friend. Small business , could have a bigger seating area . 

I got the garlic noodles 5 out of 5 

Friend got the seafood pho... 3 out of 5.
author: Matthew K.

description:
I ordered take out :

-chicken pho  ($9.50) with the option of extra veggies($1.50) 

Everything came in separate containers. So if your picking up to take home and put in a big bowl- it's great. However, when your eating at the park it's a no go hassle lol. You have to build your soup and pretty much dump some of the broth out in order for all the other ingredients to fit and not overflow the container, I didn't even try bothering to add the extra veggies and just at them on the side. But I guess that's the thing about pho it's really meant to be eaten at a table out of a big bowl, so I can't complaint too much on that note. 

The broth itself was very plain, but that's good health wise didn't taste any salt at all. When you add all the other ingredients in and perhaps a bit of boysenberry sauce or siracha and let it marinate for a good 5 minutes then you haves yourself decent tasting pho. 

The atmosphere inside is very basic. It's got a few paintings on the wall and room to seat maybe about 15 people. You can see the kitchen and cooks in action from the dinning area. Small hole in the wall spot that isn't bad. You get what you pay for here. I'd go back to try one of the lunch specials. I was just craving pho for some reason today. Not the best, but nonetheless- Craving was met.
author: China D.

description:
I find that Vietnamese restaurants often have a trade-off:
- Authentic restaurants lack presentation and ambiance (unless you are optimistic and embrace shabbiness by passing it off as hole-in-the-wall), plus the menu is sometimes difficult to read unless you know the dishes by their Vietnamese names.  
- Non-authentic restaurants often have far nicer presentation and ambiance plus understandable menus, but they're well, not authentic.  

Finally I come across Sunflower, which has Instagrammable presentation, a clean and modern ambiance, a clear menu with descriptions, and as far as my (disclaimer: non-Vietnamese) self knows, is authentic.  

I got the FIVE SPICE CHICKEN VERMICELLI ($9).  No matter how hard I tried, I failed to detect five spices and it turned out more like a tasty grilled chicken--maybe it was one spice or five spice in minute quantities, but tasty nonetheless.  It went well with the vermicelli, carrots, and lettuce over fish sauce, though I was surprised to find a piece of broccoli stem in the mix.  I also liked the imperial rolls, which usually cost extra at other restaurants.  The style was interestingly similar to Lao fried spring rolls: savory, filling, and with a mild crisp carefully tuned not to be too crunchy but avoiding sogginess.  As a whole, the portions of my vermicelli bowl were huge!  I am not one of those girls who eats half the food and complains about being full, but I actually was full after eating just half of it.  

My friends really liked the CRAB FRIED RICE ($9), which looked good but I was too preoccupied at tackling my giant bowl of vermicelli to try it.  The VIETNAMESE CREPE (banh xeo for those who have been to enough authentic Vietnamese restaurants to understand Vietnamese menus) is listed under appetizers but it's big enough to be an entree.  I liked the slightly burnt crepe and the filling of assorted meats and vinegary bean sprouts.

Most entrees are under $10 except for fancy ones like the flaming beef and prawns.  Overall the inexpensive and tasty food in the cozy comfortable restaurant is worth venturing into the Mission and dealing with the hassles of finding parking.
author: Edna C.

description: My absolute fav Vietnamese restaurant in town! A little hole in the wall but pretty good service and excellent dishes! Tried both the vermicelli and the pho dishes and they did not disappoint.
author: Kerry K.

description: we have eaten here 3 times.  We continue to get the same thing.  Vermicelli with chicken and vermicelli  with beef.  both are extremely flavorful.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I had been trying to get back to this place EVER SINCE my original review in 2012...finnnaaallllyyy had the pleasure at the END of 2016 and I was NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! Good LORD their food is good!!! My friend had some kind of crispy fish...it was like crispy carmelized sweetness on the outside and the fish itself was tender and a little salty...CRACK!!!! FISH CRACK!!!!! TBH I don't even remember what I had but It was effin DELICIOUS!!!!  We ordered like 4 different dishes and every single thing was just outrageously good! 

Not going to be waiting hella years to go back this time!!!
author: Tesia J.

description: The best veggie options for Vietnamese food I've ever seen. Lots of gluten free too! High quality ingredients, fast take out, super inexpensive, always consistent. Thank you Sunflower!
author: denise g.

description:
A small shop with decent food. My friend loves their lemongrass chicken with rice so we've returned a couple times. I always get the cold vermicelli noodle bowl with beef and imperial rolls. The beef is flavorful and the dish as a whole is satisfying, but each time I've found the imperial rolls over fried and bland. Not enough to dissuade me from ordering the dish, as I just view the imperial rolls as an "extra."

Great service both times. Food comes out quickly. Space is sparsely decorated. Prices are reasonable.
author: Nina C.

description: Parents brought home garlic noodles. Pretty good until I found a fly in it. Originally, I thought it was seasoning but it had wings.
author: Ange G.

description:
I'm giving this place 4 stars on their food. 
I've been here twice now to realice that anything you order is much better than what you may think!!

Food is really good. The place works very well for a quik lunch or dinner.

I'll come again to order other items on the menu and get positively surprised :)
author: Maggie J.

description:
Best lunch specials in The Mission. Very fresh and filling for all under $15. 

I have the Lemon Grass Beef which comes with sour soup, white rice, shrimp imperial roll ($1 extra), fresh slaw all for $14 +tip 

Nice fast service. Don't miss out
author: David W.

description: Great tasting food. My number one recommendation is #26 vermicelli. I order that at least once a month. The garlic noodle is just as good. I also suggest trying their fried rice. Small place to dine in but has good food and good pricing.
author: Jocelyn M.

description:
Being a huge fan of Vietnamese cuisine and having eaten it since a very young age - I can guarantee you this place has some of the best in SF. 

Portions are big, food is fresh and delicious. The dishes are indeed authentic with amaizng flavor.

The lunch deals are awesome! Good bang for the buck. The vermicelli here is also great - not too soft, not too hard. Imperial rolls are the super crispy kinds ( diff wrapping than Chinese egg rolls).

They do an amazing basil Chicken + bbq Pork - you won't be disappointed!

So glad I finally got to eat here - can't wait to come back!!
author: Selina W.

description: We needed something savory and warm to heal from NYE; the delicious beef pho and beef vermicelli bowls started the year off right. Tender meat, generous servings, friendly family of servers, incredible broth and prices averaging $10 / entree mean we will be back for more again soon! And oh, the fresh piping hot veggie imperial rolls? Must have more!
author: april r.

description: I have to say that I had quite a delicious meal here. We came by on a weeknight. The place is small but we were seated quickly.  We ordered their signature garlic noodles and added vegetables.  This was really good.  This noodle was stir fried with the vegetables and had a great wok induced light garlic flavor.  It's not the usual garlic noodles that you get from some restaurants that's smothered in garlic and butter. Secondly, we had the lemongrass beef with imperial roll bun (vermicelli noodles). Also a hit. The beef was tender and flavourful and imperial roll was crispy and good.  I want to come back to try other things.
author: Ali F.

description: Came here tonight.  We were seated right away around 8:15 pm. I ordered chicken spring rolls and chicken vermicelli.  My friend had five spiced chicken which was a big dish (a lot of chicken).
author: Manny Y.

description: Fantastic spot for generous bowls of pho and the garlic noodles are heavenly. Large portions so share! Salads are also great and so are the prices. Dining room is very small and can be crowded in the evenings but awesome spot to chow down before a movie at the Roxie or before having drinks. Service is fast and friendly.
author: Sally M.

description: Highly recommend their lunch specials and it's definitely one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants I've ever been. I ordered the lemongrass beef lunch special. It came with a huge portion of food and the price is very reasonable.
author: Jack T.

description: I ordered a beef noodle soup to-go and, upon retuning home, I notice the meat isn't even cooked. It's red raw! I return and mention it to the host and she informs me that "I'm supposed to cook the soup and boil it at home." Oh, silly me...I couldn't believe what I was hearing. Here is a reminder to Sunflower of a general explanation of what a restaurant is: a place where you pay and eat meals that are COOKED! Duh....Never again
author: Ryan E.

description: I was visiting sfo and i was dying for pho. We tried this spot because it was on yelp with good reviews and it was the best. Also only 10 usd p/p
author: Catalina P.

description:
Five-spice chicken lunch special on point. Each item on plate prepared and presented with more care than average restaurant at similar price point.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
This restaurant is in the heart of the Mission.   Maybe I wasn't hungry enough, but the food was just ok.  I ordered the bun (noodles) with bbq beef and fried spring rolls.  The beef was very good and tender, but the spring rolls were very bland.  

It seemed a little pricey for the quality of the dish.  Also, the place is tiny and can only seat about 16 people,

I would probably would not go back with the abundance of great restaurants in the area.
author: Richard T.

description:
I don't know if Valencia is this massive wind tunnel that makes it pretty chilly but it also only accentuates the warm comforting scents of Vietnamese home-cooking from Sunflower Authentic Vietnamese Restaurant whenever you walk by. 

I had my very first Bún here. The "never ending bowl" of Bún to be clearer. We were so stuffed from that big bowl of vermicelli, veggies, BBQ pork, and those delectable Imperial rolls. I really love the Imperial rolls here - just crispy things of yumminess. Most of the dishes here are really yummy too and you can smell it in the restaurant. I will call out the clay pot rice. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RW6XYLXNxLHZFQKc4bczlw?select=GGfl0I6d3mfKKdcrLboD5g#o_HJ_xRrAn55r3r4XxTi7A) It's just so comforting to enjoy this warm pot of chicken, shrimp, chinese sausage, onions, and rice that soaks up all that hoisin sauce - especially the crispy bits by the side of the pot. On chilly SF days, this is just hard to beat.

In the land of tacos and burritos, Sunflower offers a nice change up that is tasty and affordable. Pity it's often so crowded but there's good reason why there is often a line to be seated. It truly is delicious - you can smell it in the air.
author: Jon L.

description: Small place in the Mission serving decently priced Vietnamese food. I got the Imperial Roll and Pork Vermicelli, and it was ready super fast! The Imperial Rolls were nice and crispy, and the pork was tender and flavorful. You get a giant bowl (I didn't even finish mine), and it tastes even better after you let it sit in the sauce for a little and the noodles absorb all that flavor. There are only a few tables available so don't bother coming here with a big group!
author: Grace C.

description:
Two words...Garlic Noodles!!!!  Probably some of the most flavorful noodles I've tasted.  Add on the shrimp or beef and you are set.  Portions are pretty good here so you definitely get your money's worth.

There are 2 locations on the same block.  I actually have always gone to the one ON valencia versus the one on 16th but I believe they work the same kitchen.
author: Spencer Q.

description: This is a serious hidden gem. I've been coming here for some time and swear by it. It's quaint, and welcoming. The food is phenomenal, and the lunch special is a fantastic deal. All the people who work here are attentive without being intrusive. I recommend this spot to everyone, but for sure vegan and vegetarians. Come eat be happy!
author: Antonio A.

description:
Sunflower is one of those quick 'n dirty Vietnamese shops that has authentic pho, noodles, et al. 

The garlic noodles I got were...garlicky, with plenty of cloves amidst the noodles. However, I can't help but feel ripped off. At $9 without any special preparation or meat (that cost extra for five pieces), it seems like I'm getting short-changed. Service is unattentive as well -- a crying shame.
author: Casey S.

description:
Hopefully the hipster hoard of upper Valencia will continue to be flummoxed by the lack of organization at Sunflower so I can continue to have all that delicious food all to myself.  If it were not filled with loud self-proclaimed foodies *shudder* whose bravado spills over into your table, this review would be five stars.

The highlights are the shrimp spring rolls, the vermicelli dishes (bun) and the curry prawn or curry tofu/vegetables.  The hot and sour soup isn't too shabby either.  I've never waited more than five minutes to have delicious food set in front of me.

The service is quick and quirky and the food has stayed very reasonably priced for giant portions despite everything around them getting a noticeable Mission price hike.  Off peak visits are strategically the best.
author: Lily A.

description:
I like the Sunflower in the Mission. Inexpensive pretty good food with really friendly service. 
It's a good place...
author: El B.

description:
The place has great food and has a nice ambiance to it. I only give it a 4 star because it's kind of tight and seating is hard especially at lunch time. Besides that.

Keep up the good food!
author: Ian A.

description: The food was adequate. It's reasonably priced, so I was satisfied with the value. The corkage fee was $8, less than most (more upscale) places I frequent, so that was good. The atmosphere is fine - it's deep in the heart of the Mission, so there are many more upscale options, and many less refined options as well. This was fine. The waiter did not seem to be very attentive, nor concerned with service. It seemed as though he was "just doing his job," and had very little training in customer service. There were no serious problems, but he never ingratiated us to their venue - he added no value to the experience. But we enjoyed our food and it was a nice time with old friends. My vegetarian friends have been eating here for years, so that's something on the positive side. The papaya salad was the best. The garlic noodles were very ordinary. The spicy shrimp was fine - nothing special but surely adequate. One friend got a crispy noodle with veggies dish, but I did not try it.
author: Richard M.

description:
Another 7x7 Big Eats winner. Though by now I'm a little more wary of the items on that list (desserts = fabulous, everything else = awesome to how?). The vermicelli with the 5spice roasted chicken ($9.25) is pretty decent. Rustic and super filling. It's just a pile of rice vermicelli noodles with a few julienned carrots and a handful of lettuce tossed in, then topped with 4 giant pieces of chicken. The whole thing comes with a tiny container of sauce that goes a really long way. 

They don't say this but it's a family style dish that's meant to be shared. I got it to-go and was surprised at how heavy the container was. When I emptied it out at home it was enough to fill up two noodle bowls - 2 big lunches or 3-4 small lunches. Did I mention it comes with 2 imperial rolls as well? 

The chicken was roasted really well and was tender and juicy. The imperial rolls were fried and slightly sweet. I kinda liked them but light and refreshing they were not. The vermicelli (with sauce) takes up a lot of room but isn't very filling - guess that's why you need the big bowl of them.

Well done simple food, great value.
author: Jean K.

description: Came here for a late lunch and then was in the mood for vietnamese cuisine.  We ordered the lemongrass chicken and bbq pork lunch specials.  The food was well done but the meat was a bit too fatty for my taste.
author: Amit P.

description:
The pho bo broth is not good here, I think Thanh Tam is better. If I return, it would be for the fried rice, pork noodle-bun, or lunch specials.

Came for a vietnamese iced coffee ($3.21 after tax) and it's bitter and sour without milk. Too sweet with milk. Recommend Mau/Tin instead.
author: Jess C.

description:
I'll disclaim right now that I'm a very harsh critic of Vietnamese food, being Vietnamese and coming from Houston. I've been pretty disappointed in the Vietnamese food in San Francisco so far but I'm slowly making my way through all of them. Authenticity usually equals quality but not always, so I'm willing to give these joints a shot.

First impressions were so so. I came in with the husband and his dad for lunch on Labor Day and we were the only Asians in there. One look at the menu with zero Vietnamese on it and we were definitely raising our eyebrows at each other. We asked the waitress if she spoke Vietnamese so we could ask some questions, answer was no.

I ordered the #1 lunch special which was five spice chicken, soup, salad and imperial roll. "What soup is it?" "Hot and sour." Um, hot and sour soup is Chinese but okay. The husband ordered the vermicelli (bun) bowl with pork (thit nuong) and the dad ordered crab fried rice. 

I'm very curious about this five spice chicken dish I've seen on almost every Vietnamese restaurant menu here. I've never heard of it before, dad says it's a Chinese thing. My plate comes out and it is humongous. The soup is actually canh chua and not bad tasting. The salad is cabbage and carrots and flavored like traditional goi. The eggroll is very traditional, wrapped in rice paper instead of the usual flour paper. The chicken is very tasty and tender. Over all, a great value for the amount of food. The husband enjoyed his bun thit nuong and his portion was also huge. Dad said the fried rice was okay.

Service was good and quick. I don't ever expect stellar service at Vietnamese or Chinese restaurants, efficient is fine. C'mon people, when you're paying less than $10 for your entree, adjust your expectations. I want to give this place three and a half stars because the food was good but I'm rounding down because there was nothing here worth coming back for. Across the street is Thanh Tam that has a larger menu and is legit authentic.
author: Emmi D.

description: I'm SO excited they re-opened!  This used to be my go-to lunch spot (my office was on the same block for years) until they closed.  The soups are huge and delicious, the other dishes are definitely also enough for two people (or two lunch portions)!  The appetizers are also wonderful; the fried rolls and rice balls are sooooo delicious!  The service is impersonal, and the waits during lunch can be quite long!  I recommend calling in for take-out over trying to get seated in the tiny table space.  If the actual restaurant is open (Valencia side), definitely go there instead for seating, as most people only hit the tiny side on 16th.
author: Katie S.

description:
Who would've guessed there was an authentic Viet place in the Mission? Not me!

I was hesitant to try this place after reading reviews about this infamous waiter. Luckily, he wasn't there when I went in for lunch with a friend who was visiting. *whew*

The food is great. I got the Banh Xeo (aka Vietnamese Crepe which was under Starters, but totally enough as a meal for one). It was crunchy and the veggies were fresh - just how I like it! Guess I don't have to drag myself to SJ for this dish anymore. My friend's beef pho also looked really appetizing for the typical cold SF day. They definitely did not skimp on the portions. 

However, the waitress did seem like she was trying to make us skedaddle since she took our order very quickly and also asked for us to pay the bill. Also, there were a bunch of flies loitering by the entrance (which is a hallmark of authentic joints) so try sitting more towards the back if you don't want some extra protein in your food. Oh, and the bathroom has some pretty cool wallpaper you should check out.
author: Ashley L.

description: I love this place. I've since moved out of San Francisco and I still salivate when I think about their lunch special with soup with the pineapple in it and the green beans with the tofu goodness and that noodle bowl thingy with the fried egg roll all up in it. YASSS PLAZE!!! The thai iced tea is like a little zoom zoom dessert in a shake glass too. So good.
author: Sandy P.

description:
There is something very wrong with this restaurant and one particular waiter who works here.  I would give this restaurant negative stars if I could.

I had been coming here for about 4 years.  I recommended it widely.  The wait staff knows us well and always asked how we were when we come in.

I was here with my wife and sister in law yesterday.  My sister-in-law ordered a tofu salad; while she was eating it she reported that the tofu tasted rotten; this about half way through the cabbage part of the meal.  She asked to send it back.

I did not taste the tofu.  I don't know what it was like but my sister-in-law has lived in Asia and knows tofu well enough to know what it should not taste like.  And if food is not right the proper thing for a restaurant to do is to take it back and apologize/replace it, that's what good service is about.

So we didn't want to pay for it. We were more than happy to pay for what my wife and I ate.  I figured that as loyal long term customers they could write off an $8 bowl of questionable tofu salad for us.

How wrong we were.  The waiter (a large, flamboyant Vietnamese  man) held a screaming drama queen fit, alleging that we were trying to not pay for food we had eaten. He was shouting in the restaurant; he went so far as to show the bowl of half eaten food to other customers in the restaurant who were understandably confused and I would think discomfitted by this vulgar display of histrionics.  Why other patrons had to be involved in what was a private dispute between us and the restaurant I don't know but it's a testatment to the instability of this wait-person's personality.

Can you trust someone like that to handle your food?  Is berating long term customers over an $8 bowl of tofu salad appropriate?  The food is (usually) good but going to Def Con 4 over such a trivial matter makes me very concerned that there is something deeply and intrinsically wrong with this particular waiter who is ALWAYS working there.  Maybe he needs a day off.  

Regardless, there is NO WAY we will ever go back to this dump.  I could forgive a bowl of bad tofu if they had handled it with grace but to throw a temper tantrum makes me think that there is more going on than meets the eye.  I think a public health visit may be in order, their waiter would be well advised to behave like a grown up when that day comes.
author: Alan S.

description:
Garlic noodles, a bottle of wine and good company at Dolores Park. This is the utopia that so many people who come to the Mission search for. 

Sunflower is the epitome of hole-in-the-wall. It's a tiny joint that serves some of the best garlic noodles around. Pan fried with egg and garlic for $8.50. One portion will easily feed at least 2-3 people. The aromas you experience just from opening the box are mindblowing. The first taste will have you contemplating how such a simple combination of garlic, noodles, and egg can taste so delicious. Not too overbearing, and just the right consistency. 

An easy way to get a cheap delicious meal to split.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
Popped into Sunflower on a busy Friday after drinking with friends at Zeitgeist. Managed to get a seat right away. I was bummed that they were out of coconuts, which is one of the main reasons I like coming here. 

I got the BBQ Pork vermicelli noodles with emperor rolls and it was delicious! I like that they have all the sauces on the table so that you can season it the way you want. The BBQ pork was sweet and tender and the rolls were nice and crispy. Of course it came as a huge portion and I only ate about 1/4 of it and took the rest to go. Two days later I ate the leftovers for lunch and it was even tastier!

For the price, this place really can't be beat.
author: Casey S.

description: The fiancé and I had our first date here seventeen years ago and are so happy this location remains to celebrate us getting married! See you in February as we rave all the time about the vegetarian potstickers!
author: Betsey L.

description: Came here for dinner price is very cheap for a TON of food. Solid vegan/vegetarian options. I got the noodle soup which was great, the broth had a lot of depth. The vegetarian steamed dumplings are served with peanut sauce which we all used on our dishes on its own. The place is pretty cramped but was not too busy on a Friday night at 7pm. I think they are moving to a new location nearby that has more room.
author: Nathan T.

description: Four of us - all experienced Vietnamese foodies - by chance dropped in for the first time.  Three of us ordered the vermicelli (chicken, bbq pork, vegetarian) and all agreed that they were very authetic and excellent for the price.  The 4th person ordered the garlic noodle because it's labelled 'the house favorite'.  When the house favorite came, it was literally a big pile of carb; we got it then that of course it's 'the house favorite' because the profit margin from it has got to be shooting through the roof!!  The garlicky flavor otherwise was very good.
author: T L.

description: This restaurant is rather small and with the door closed, the stir-fry smoke lingers and was a bit much.  The seafood pho is so-so.  Price is reasonable.  I prefer the Sunflower Restaurant in Potrero (same establishment).
author: Betty M.

description:
Pretty decent.

Came here with a couple of colleagues for lunch. It was strange that they sat groups of 2 at the big table in the middle...and not to the sides. When we arrived as a group of 3, the waitress first tried to cram us in this small table behind the door (which, it was clear we'd never fit). The one big table for 8 in the middle had 2 groups of 2 on each end, and the parties were nice enough to allow us to cram in the middle of their two groups. I felt this could have been averted if they did seating better.

The food itself is pretty decent. Its not the best Vietnamese food in the city, but for the area, its pretty good. I had a beef vermicelli noodles, and they weren't bad. The beef was a little too thickly sliced for my taste, but it was flavored well.

Service (after the pre-seating issue) was pretty good. They always made sure our waters were filled.
author: Lily W.

description:
Disclaimer: I haven't eaten any food here. This review is for its service and the attitude of the staff. 

We came here (the branch on Valencia street) in a group of 5, and after a few of delays in arranging the seating, we managed to get in. And the first thing we had from the waiter is a bunch of menus *thrown* onto our table. It was not any welcome message or anything, he just simply threw the menus to our table and walked away. We were shock but calmed and asked for some water (we were really thirsty and tired at that time, after a long drive back from our vacation). Again, what we received were just waiting and waiting. We decided to walk away from this restaurant without any further thought. We could not except such the poor attitude from the staffs. Simply irrespectful and unacceptable. 

So, please watch-out for the service and attitude from the staffs, and I hope that you will be served better. And for us, we will definitely not come back to this place. There are so many other places, including Vietnamese ones, that know how to respect their customers.

(After scrolling through some other reviews, I realize that our case is not unusual)
author: Phuong N.

description: They just reopened! As good as it was before. Cheap Vietnamese in the mission, friendly service
author: David L.

description:
The food was amazing. Everything was great!

What ruined the experience is my friend put down (mindlessly, as we all work in service industry) a tip that was just over 10%. This guy charges over and berates us for a poor tip, demanding more. My friend put some extra bucks down after stating she had made a mistake, but everyone was taken aback. You DO NOT demand more tip - no matter how great you did, how terrible your guests are, any reason at all. 

I have been given zero tip on excellent service before, and it blows, but I would never in a million years approach a guest and demand more tip money. Unbelievable.

I would give one star, but the food IS quite good.

Still, way to be an asshole, buddy. Probably won't be back :(
author: Jane H.

description:
I walked in and wanted to turn around and walk back out. This place is tiny, and small, old and dirty!

Any restaurant that feels the need to put "Authentic" in their business name is probably not "authentic". I ordered the Bo Luc Lac which is a hard dish to really eff up on. It was overly salty and OVER LOADED with dark gravy.  I asked for Com Sot Ca Chua, a standard tomato rice they offer at most "authentic" vietnamese restaurants. They said they do not have this but offered me another type of rice. The rice came out and it was sticky and purple with grains in it.. umm.. ew? The boy toy ordered Pho which was lacking flavor and was slightly sweet? WHAT? Sweet? Did they accidentally put sugar instead of salt? Or just too much of it ? Will not be back, If you are in the area, I do recommend Thanh Tam II.

Oh and the kitchen is in the same small room with you. You will leave smelling like greasy food. -.-
author: Sharon N.

description:
Since Sunflower was listed on 7x7, babe and I had to give it a try.  And I must say I was pretty impressed with the food (and luckily I didn't get any shitty service that fellow yelpers seem to have a problem with).

I got the BBQ Beef with Imperial Roll Vermicelli both times I came here because it's just that amazing. This dish is very flavorful and I enjoyed every bite. (Even when I took leftovers home and it was a little soggy). The imperial rolls comes out super crunchy and it has taro inside which is a plus in my book. Oh and don't forget to mix all the veggies thats on the bottom, it'll make it taste much better. I learned that mistake the first time I was here after eating half my bowl. 

Overall, I would definitely come back for more vermicelli because it is bomb.
author: Harriet W.

description:
The food is ok. I like how I can add more veggies to my pho. The place is dark so it's hard to actually see your food. 

I've been coming here despite the so-so tasting food since it's one of the two non pretentious Vietnamese restaurants in the mission (the other being thanh tam 2) and is close to bart. 

Their service has gone downhill so much it's appalling. They wouldn't let me get a table without my friend also being there even though I said I would be ordering and eating first. They said I can order but my friend who may arrive late cannot. WTF?!? They started yelling at me so I just left. There are sooo many restaurant options in the mission I do not have to tolerate this absurd and rude service. I will not be returning.

Thanh tam 2 does a pretty good job. Go there. You can actually see what you're eating too.
author: Michelle K.

description:
The address listed on Yelp is a bit confusing ~ is it on Valencia, or is it on 16th? Verdict ~ it's on the west side of Valencia, just south of 16th Street.

I'm working on changing things up in my life and Sunflower made a blip on my radar since their vegetarian pho was recently noted in VegNews. Since it was a beautifully warm day in the Mission, I skipped the pho and had one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes ~ the cold vermicelli salad with crisp, imperial rolls. I was happily surprised to see this offered vegetarian-style with vegan (non-fish) sauce, a rarity. In fact they had several vegetarian (probably vegan, pardon my ignorance as I'm pretty new to this realm) offerings. 

If you're a meat eater not to worry, they have meat-based dishes too.

The service was nice, our glasses were filled throughout our meal and the food came out quickly.

My dish wasn't quite as good as I'd hoped, the imperial rolls were bland, a tad greasy and lacked the light crunch that I would've preferred. The noodles a bit dry and the sauce too salty for me.

Glancing at the other diners, their lunch specials and entrees looked appealing. I'm eager to return to try some other dishes ~
author: Cathy K.

description:
Service does not even garner a 1-star. This waiter frequently came to our table within the first 10 minutes of us sitting down. I was catching up with an old friend, and each time he came, we politely told him we're not ready yet. About 10-15 minutes later, we were, and tried to get his attention. By the 3rd time, we realized he was intentionally ignoring us. He kept his head held high, nose in the air, and walked from one side of the room to the other, refusing to acknowledge us. The restaurant was busy, but you shouldn't have service like that anywhere you go.

Long story short, we left and ended up eating at a Vietnamese restaurant across the street. They had damn good pho. 

My feedback is to higher better waiters. I hear their food is very good, but it's not worth it if the service is plain horrible.
author: Ashley M.

description: You need to see their kitchen its disgusting. I don't know how come health department still let them work.  They don't even deserve 1 star but there is no 0 or below 0. Also the server is the ass hole.  He still keeps arguing with people that people don't give him good tips.  What are you expecting aas hole? Never go there and ruin your lunch or dinner.
author: Erkan Ç.

description:
On the menu, imperial rolls and veggie imperial rolls are the same price. Cool. If you order a meal that comes with imperial rolls but you want the veggie ones instead (say, because you're Jewish and don't eat pork, for example), that'll cost you an extra dollar. EDIT: make that ONE imperial roll.

I'm really, really tired of local businesses just looking for ways to screw customers because they feel like they can.
author: jared c.

description:
I was starving and at that time brand new to city.  My craving was for vegan Vietnamese spring rolls which at that time I the only restaurant I knew of that had them was the slanted door.  I had vowed not to go back there as they were $15 each, but it was late and I wanted some quick take out so I called them.  Too bad, they don't do take out for their overpriced food!  A frantic yelp search brought me to sunflower!  

I got two orders of the Vegetable spring rolls and was very happy to see the price was only 7.25.  Nice!   Then when I picked up my take out, the bag was super heavy, when I looked inside each order was actually two rolls!  Super nice!!!  

The quality was great, just as good as slanted door.  When you consider that these rolls we're about $3.60 each versus slanted door $15, it was a steal.  Ok ok, I know sd has an ambiance that sunflower is certainly lacking, but hey, the quality was there, and this review is for takeout only.  I'll have to go back and dine in and try some other menu options.

EDIT:  I went back on 8.3.2012 and ate in the restaurant.  The restaurant is run down and old, and you'll leave smelling like deep fryer.  Not a place to take a date.  But the food is darn good, and so cheap!  They have about 4 tables in the restaurant and a bar.   I got the spring rolls again (YUM), and also a tofu salad that was HUGE and super good for $7.75.
author: Evelyn N.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Sunflower tonight. Quite frankly, I was far from thinking that it would end up that way. 

We have been sitting up right next to the door, which didn't close well. We first asked the host to be seated somewhere else since there were empty places. He barely responsed and waved a "no" with his face. We then asked the server who had the same bad attitude and response. We eventually decided to enjoy our diner although we were really cold. The service itself wasn't that great. When it came to pay, we decided not to tips a lot because of the service we had. 

As we got out of the restaurant, the serveur also came out and started to be mean because we didn't let any tips. It didn't take him too long to be disrespectful, giving the middle finger and using insults against my boyfriend. I honestly thought that the server would slap my boyfriend.

We certainly won't go back there again and I will personally share the word around. 

As I've read reviews about this restauant, I found out that many people were complaining about those exact same behavior. 

Certainly one of the worst experience I have ever had in San Francisco.
author: Samantha A.

description:
Went there for the first time with my husband. The food was decent but the service was horrible. We ordered the clay pot fish and when it came out the server put it right next to my husband's arm and it burned him!  

No refills, no interaction other than to take our order and to deliver food. Will never go back there!
author: Mariza W.

description:
it pains me to make this review. I've been coming here for ages and it's always been a pretty good experience. I usually recommend this place to other people, the food is always great. but this review is based on my experience yesterday. 

Came in yesterday for a quick bite w a friend. We already knew what we wanted, no need to see a menu. Walked in, ordered our food, sat down, they brought our food (which was great), then brought the check. That's it. We had an iota of interaction w our server, who mostly ignored us anyway. Totally not a big deal, cuz like I said "quick bite". 

While we were eating a couple came in, and sat next to each other, next to us. We were the only ones in the restaurant. All of a sudden the server comes over and starts yelling at them, that they were dirty and needed to find a hotel room. I have no idea what they were doing over there, but it couldn't have been much because they didn't disturb us at all and we didn't even notice them. But the server is yelling, the couple looked confused like WTF. The other servers started yelling at them from across the restaurant. The couple didn't bother us, but the servers definitely soured our meal. 

So based on the zero interaction w the server, and then the whole hoopla w the couple, I decided I wasn't leaving a tip so we paid the bill and left. The server came running outside after us. To ask us why we didn't leave a tip and then to start yelling at us about not leaving a tip. In his words "we have to leave a tip" and that our meal wasn't free (pretty sure I just paid a bill so not sure what he was talking about there). and then he started yelling at us that if we weren't going to tip we "should never come back and only order to go". SERIOUSLY. 

He need not worry. I WILL NOT BE RETURNING!
author: Maritza D.

description:
After reading many reviews of this place, I was hesitant about coming to this restaurant. If my friend did not insist on coming, I would not have eaten here.

When I walked into the very small restaurant, I was kindly welcomed by a young waiter and informed we will be seated quickly and we were. I ordered the Banh Xeo or Vietnamese Crepe and that was more than enough for me as a dinner dish. So I give this place 4 stars because of the portion of food that is relatively cheap, the taste of the Banh Xeo with the fish sauce, the warm greeting I received right after I walked in, the vegetarian options (many Vietnamese restaurants I have been to, does not offer vegetarian options!), and the good service we had throughout our meal.

By good service throughout the meal, I mean our water was refilled when needed and extra napkins were provided to us even though we did not ask for it. I appreciate them noticing the need to additional napkins while we were busy eating and didn't get to the change to ask for them.

I did not give 5 stars because the place is really small, tight, and not as clean as I would like for a 5 star rating. The bathroom is decent, not too dirty. The toilet and sink itself if decently clean.
author: Shirley M.

description:
Solid option for when you're in the mission and not feeling like a burrito.
Most of everything i tried was at least decent, and some of the simpler choices like garlic noodles were surprisingly good.  For now id rate my experience here at 4 stars, and id like to come back and confirm this impression.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Sunflower's Mission location v. Sunflower's Potrero Hill location Smackdown

Round 1:  Parking
Impossible v. Easy
Winner:  Potrero Hill

Round 2:  Decor
Divey v. Recycled Baraka Digs
Winner:  Potrero Hill

Round 3:  People Watching
Colorful Hipsters v. Mellow Locals 
Winner:  The Mish

Round 4:  Service
Sweet Asian gals v. Sparkles***
Winner:  The Mish

Round 5:  Eats
Yummy Food v. Yummy Food
(Described here:  http://www.yelp.com/biz/sunflower-potrero-hill-san-francisco#hrid:t_0-_byWvWO6Fwhdvhx8Ew)
Winner:  Tie

Scorecard:  DRAW

***Sparkles is our most favorite server EVER.  We love him for his sparkly belt, his sparkly personality, his sparkly smile, but mostly for his ability to flirt shamelessly with our metrosexual, straight friend J and make him uncomfortable.  AWESOME.
author: Amy C.

description:
To be honest, I tend not to review places unless they are amazing or horrible; but, I'm trying to change that...

Sunflower is that okay warm comfort food you get for a decent price on a cold winter night. Picture this: you and a friend are on 17th, decide you both want soup, and are too cold to get anywhere stellar. That's the scenario we were in last night -- the rare 34 degree night in SF (and your friend is obviously from the East Coast, but has been here too long to gain any fortitude points). You are equipped with 2 scarves (you NEVER wear scarves out of Tahoe... You are an SF native, but global warming and gentrification are sadly warping your fair city). What do you do?

Bam! You're at Sunflower near 16th. You go to the one on Valencia, because you know they have another entrance around the corner, but you've never trusted that one.

You are greeted by a sassy young man who only has a seat by the door. You take the seat, graciously, even though you notice there's no sriracha on it, and you are aware that the new wave of thoughtless people who have sadly joined your city are too self centered to consider closing the door when they leave. You order.

The Vietnamese Hot and Sour soup you get is a sour and sweet soup, at best. The rice you order doesn't come, but you are able to flag someone down eventually. The vegetarian imperial rolls (your east coast friend is a vegetarian after all) are surprisingly delicious and well made.

The bill comes, and you realize it's perfectly reasonable, and they even hand wrote the before tax cost on your split check, even though you were going to tip on the after tax number anyways.

You leave full, and not dissatisfied -- albeit never WOWed. All in all, a decent meal!
author: Michael C.

description:
Food Poisoning. Ate nothing else all day. This is on 09/26/13. Ordered the #25 B.B.Q Pork with noodles and Imperial Rolls. 4 hours later I'm rolling around in agony. 

This is it. No more. Eater beware.
author: Ty M.

description: I come here whenever I'm in SF for the bun (vermicelli bowl); I get mine with BBQ pork and imperial roll. Everything is just as it should be: the food is delicious; the service is fast; and the prices are reasonable.
author: Chris P.

description: This is a great spot for some hot chicken or beef soup on a cold night.  I like the spring rolls.  The quality is great and the service prompt and friendly.  I like the cozy atmosphere, but it gets super crowded 6-7pm most nights.  The portion are great.
author: Zach T.

description: Gotta say I've been coming here for years and consistency is the key to their success. The dishes I order are always prepared quickly, with fresh ingredients and simple, clean flavors. The portions are large and I always leave satisfied. Highly recommend the garlic noodles, their chicken or veggie noodle soup, and the deep fried spring rolls.
author: Leslie H.

description: THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT NEEDS TO INVESTIGATE THIS PLACE! If I could give this place negative stars I would! My husband and I ordered take out from here and I ordered the pan fried noodles. As I'm eating it I started choking on something and pulled a long piece of plastic out of my throat. I'm 23 weeks pregnant and it absolutely terrified me and my husband. I'm so nauseous just thinking about this place. We both immediately stopped eating and took our uneaten food back to show them and ask for a refund. The owners response was, "It look like noodle." I then had to argue with her about why it's not okay for plastic to be in our food, regardless of the fact that the long clear piece of plastic bag looked like a rice noodle. That's exactly why I choked on it! It looked like they deliberately cut the bag into the shape of a noodle to cut cost. The cleanliness and safety of this place needs to be investigated. DO NOT EAT HERE!!
author: Amanda H.

description:
Food has always been "good." But their website is WRONG. First they only have the PDF of their "lunch menu" which ends at 4pm. The prices are about 20 to 25 cents off and after 4 pm for some curried veggies I paid $10.50 plus tax... 
PLEASE SUNFLOWER.... I implore you to get your crap together!
Sincerely, 
P$&@ed off customer.
P.S.
Curried veggies should be in a plastic container so thanks for the mess of a lunch. 
I won't be back anytime soon!
author: K M.

description:
This place is terrible. The waiter shouted at two lovely girls sitting next to us. Everyone in the restaurant could hear him. I cannot repeat the words he used. Absolutely unacceptable.
The food was mediocre and the place doesn't look very clean.
author: Gina L.

description:
Probably one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to.  I can't say the dining experience is the most amazing thing Ive ever been a part of, but if you take your order to go you can enjoy wherever you want!

Check out the Shrimp Spring rolls and Vermicelli - amazeballs. I think I might pick up dinner from them tonight!
author: Kevin J.

description: Garlic noodles with tofu were great and the egg roll was perfect. Cheap price. Nice mom and pop. Not sure why the reviews are so bad.
author: Khalid N.

description:
I went here for years and while I'm pretty tolerant of restaurants not being excellent a 100% of the time, the lack of manners and basic respect for customers in this restaurant is appalling! I took a Vietnamese friend of mine there and she was sooooo embarrassed because she could understand the guy usually taking orders (with glasses and long hair) talking smack with the cooks about customers and how stupid Americans are and downright degradation of people just for "taking too long" to order!! Excuse me, could you at least try not to say that while "dumb" Americans are around? maybe one of them happens to speak the Vietnamese and understand how RUDE YOU ARE. 

The other issues are primarily about lack of hygiene and consistency If you sit in the part of the restaurant where you see the cooks, check out how dirty the kitchen area is... After 5 years of going here, I'm finally pulling the plug on sunflower.... Not gonna put up with rude staff who are ungrateful for the business that customers bring them!!
author: Dale S.

description:
Cold night blues? Famished and you don't know what you want, but what you do know is that you want cheap, tasty and filling in the Mission? 

Enter Sunflower. I'd hardly call it a hole in the wall like others have referred to it as, however, it's not exactly dark and romantic, either. Sunflower is a what-you-see-is-what-you-get kinda place. Menu is straight up and descriptive however they leave off how tasty/spicey/salty/garlicky their dishes are. And it's good because you'll be surprised at how something with so few ingredients can be so mouthwatering and satisfying.

I love this place, it's one of my favorites in the Mission for when I want to spend under $15 to be full and I can't say enough about their beef vermecelli noodles, garlic chicken, shaken beef and they have good pho for cold, rainy nights. I also love that they serve the "healthy" brown rice - the very dark thick kind versus the kind you can buy in a store. Healthy brown rice on plate with Asian dishes make Meredith R. very happy.

Mmmmm.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Gave me check 1/4 into meal.
Yelled at me for not paying yet 1/2 in the meal.
Yelled at me and my friend for not tipping on the card receipt, when I tipped in cash.
And to all you people saying "This Viet food is so authentic!"
They're Chinese, and they were talking smack in Cantonese.


Pho wasn't bad, but Thanh Tam II is KING.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Food: mediocre
Service : downright horrible. I've had bad experiences more than once at this place. The Waiter kept ignoring me multiple times when I requested for water. In the end, I did not tip him, he got really MAD and gave us a really cold stare and appeared downright hostile. He pretty much kicked us out of the place!
Be prepared to eat a little bit of your self-respect along with the mediocre food they serve.
If you really want 'Authentic Vietnamese' food and a pleasant experience, go a block down on Valencia to Tanh Tamh II
author: Vizard O.

description:
I've never had a problem with the service here so I can't really comment on that aspect of the establishment. 

The place isn't really big and it's in the Mission so yea.. there's going to be a wait and yes... parking is a little rough but that's just the neighborhood. The food is pretty so so... I've definitely had better vietnamese food, especially the vermicelli bowls that they are known for. 

I originally tried this place when it showed up onthe 7x7 list but as I've come to realize.. a lot of things on this list is hit or miss. It's a nice guide and a good start for checking out new places to eat. But just because it's on the list doesnt mean it's bomb.com. Just sayin.
author: amelia g.

description:
Tiger prawns on garlic noodles were awesome here, even if on the saltier side. Four huge mini-lobsters in a sweetish garlic sauce, mm. 

The clay pot rice thing was a wash for the most part since the clay was only there for show and everything had obviously been fried up before presented in the bowl. No caramelizing o' the meats! It's hard to go wrong with big chunks of sweet Chinese sausage though. 

Spring rolls were decent here and come with some green roughage to cut the oil a bit. Lots of ngoc cham to drench everything else in. Big portions, so the two entrees and the rolls were good enough for three hungry people.

L shaped restaurant with a cheery side and a bring-a-hot-date side on Valencia. I'd probably go with the cheery next time.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Fark you waiter guy!

We love getting take out from Sunflower - yummy garlic noodles!  

For my friends birthday we decided to go into the restaurant and have a sit down meal.  Nothing special, just 2 of us on a nice warm evening.  We were in a relaxed mood and having a nice time walking the streets looking forward to his birthday meal.  

We walked in and the waiter acknowledged us.  There were open tables so we asked if we could sit anywhere and he pointed around the room and spun off to take care of other customers.  After about 90 seconds he brought us our menus and walked away again to the back area.  He was clearly busy  which was understandable since it was 6:30pm.

About 60 seconds later he came back with water and asked what we wanted to eat. We hadn't really looked at the menus, so my friend grabbed one quickly and ordered some rolls.  We went back to chit chatting still settling in.  30 seconds later the waiter returned and wanted to take our orders, I chuckled at his abruptness, we both were kind of befuddled and said we weren't ready but could be in 2 minutes , we promissed to look at the menus and hurry things up.  The waiter said "something something something OFFICE" 

HUH?  

Im usually pretty good at understanding someone who doesn't speak English as a primary  or first language but all i heard was OFFICE and an irritated tone.  The rest was unintelligible.

So I asked "Im sorry, what was that?"  
"SOMETHING SOMETHING SOMETHING OFFICE!" the waiter responded looking at me like i was an idiot.

HE WAS SCOLDING US

So I said "well go get our rolls and we will know when you get back."

Then another SCOWL from the waiter - more unintellagiable blather and another scowl before he spun off to the back area.

At this point my friend was so offended that he actually got a little angry and announced he didn't want to eat there.

WHICH WAS FINE WITH ME. So we left.

Good luck with your table service Sunflower - you need it..

ThumbsUP - Always nice to hang out on Valencia Street.  Good Garlic Noodles
ThumbsDOWN - GET RID OF THAT WAITER
author: Jeff C.

description: One of my favorite spots in the mission. I've been coming here since 2012. They were closed temporarily for remodeling. It's good to know that there back open! I ordered the veggie pho and it's still good... Only 10 bucks. Can't beat that!
author: Black Frankenstien ..

description:
NEVER GOING BACK - NEVER!!!!
sunflower, which more appropriately should be named bumshower for the the spewing hatred and brown ugly goo that so readily flies from the mouth of the wait staff - particularly the super-hostile waiter with the quasi-flip thing going on w/ his hair.
I've been there before.  I knew this waiter was rude but have managed to overlook his idiocy because I was having a good time w/ my friend.
Went there last frinday w/ the same friend and apparently whatever amount of spackle  and prozac this guy uses to barely keep himself together had fallen short of its job.
And I mean fallen short in a big way.

We ordered our food  (which was truly mediocre btw,) and before we were even half way through eating he puts the check in-between our 2 dishes and indicates he's like us to pay NOW.
He came back 3 times telling us to pay. Each time with increasing hostility, histrionics and volume.   We told him we would when we were done eating.  There were empty tables and we hadn't been there long.  
On his 4th time over he starts screaming at us so everyone in the restaurant can hear, accusing us of not wanting to pay the bill!
My friend (who is kind and good) was super polite w/ him.
Not I.  

This guy went in to a FULL BLOWN MELT-DOWN OF TOTEMIC PROPORTIONS!!
Screaming and making this huge scene - irrational, paranoid and down right crazy.  He's obviously reenacting some original trauma of having felt 'dissed' in his childhood
and it takes NOTHING for his psychic wound to re-open itself and bleed all over his customers.
It appears he is mystified as to why people don't tip as he re-creates this dynamic over and over again while he approaches others with continued suspicion, narcissism and hostility.
Diagnosis: Borderline personality disorder w/ narcissistic features.

People, if you like giving your money to those who treat you w/ hate AND crappy food, then this is the place for you.
Yelp is forcing me to give this place a star before I can post, otherwise there would be zero.
author: TragicCastle C.

description:
My friend said he loved this place and wanted to meet for dinner here.  I read the reviews on Yelp and became concerned because apparently the waiter/owner/something is very rude and verbally assaults people, so I was kinda scared to go.

Apparently the small diner on 16th St shares the kitchen with the larger restaurant on Valencia - which is the part we ate at.  The decor wasn't anything fancy, it was all very casual.  I had the garlic noodles with beef and chicken fried rice.  I had no idea the portions were served "family style."  I got so much food that I had to take it to go.  I enjoyed the chicken fried rice and would get that again.  The garlic noodles with beef were ok and I would probably order that again.

While there, I did not observe any of the crazy behaviors mentioned here on Yelp, but my friend said that he has seen the guy act up and get ratchet.  The guy served us the entire time and was friendly, attentive, and quiet.  Solely based on my experience, I'd go back.
author: Shaun W.

description: Amazing food for the price. I got the  #2 Soup, imperial roll, salad and BBQ Pork with rice for $9.50. The service was great and the food had great flavor. I will be coming back VERY soon ;)
author: Jess C.

description:
I'm begrudgingly giving this place 2 stars. The food was pretty good. It is a great place for vegetarians. A lot of delicious looking options and the fresh spring rolls were fantastic. Some of the best I've had in a long time.

The reason this place gets a 2 instead of a 4 is the deplorable service. I know that's standard affair for Asian restaurants, but these people were particularly rude. 

I was having dinner with a friend and arrived early. The place had about 4 people in it. I asked if I could get a table for two assuming I would be seated at one of the many empty tables. Instead, I was given a dirty look, made to feel as if I had interrupted an extremely important conversation between the wait staff, then curtly was told to take a seat in an empty chair that was promptly placed right next to the bathroom. 

Then, when seated, about 3/4's of the way through the meal we decided to order more food. When we ordered, the waiter rudely told us that next time we should order everything at the beginning and next time they won't take an order later in the meal.
