Apparently, it's too difficult to make additional items after you've already ordered. It's the first time I've ever encountered a restaurant that didn't want more money? Doesn't seem like a very sustainable business model.

Finally, we were all but told to get out of our seats while we were finishing up because there were other people waiting. I really dislike when restaurants do this - especially, in the manner they did.

It really annoys me that they have good food. I'll head back, bracing for overwhelmingly underwhelming service.
author: Neal V.

description:
I love Vietnamese food, but not Vietnamese food at Sunflower. 

Food: The food is bland, the meat tastes like it has been frozen for one too many days and Pho broth makes me wonder what's really in it.  I do not recommend this restaurant for good Vietnamese - not even for Vietnamese on the go. Sure it's not a pricey/ fancy restaurant, but you can definitely get better food somewhere else for the same price. 

Service:  I visited the restaurant twice, in both occasions the waiters were rude and absent-minded.  Although there were two waiters and only three occupied tables, I had to get up and walk over to where they were sitting and chatting to order, ask for more water and for the check - they still gave me a bad attitude.

There are less than a handful of restaurants in general that I will not go back to, Sunflower is one of them.
author: Gaby O.

description:
It's a good pho place, but i've had better at other places. The pho broth could have been more savory. 

The beef clay pot was good, but more chinese than vietnamese

service is quick and the place is spacious and clean.
author: Dorris W.

description: I've been coming here for years, and the service has always been fast and friendly enough. I wonder about some of the people complaining about the service here. Do you go to a restaurant to be coddled and cooed at, and have your narcissistic needs gratified? Perhaps you should try therapy instead. I come here for delicious food served quickly without any fuss, and that's what I've gotten every single time. I hope they re-open soon.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description:
The Pho was ok -- not bad, but not anything that I would tell my out of town friends that they have to try. I've had worse and I've had better, but the overall experience here is what really turned me off.

I've never been treated more disrespectfully by a wait staff. I went in with a friend of mine (two females, if that makes any difference) and they seated us as close to open, loud kitchen and wait doc as possible. This normally wouldn't be a problem, but the restaurant was completely empty and when we asked if it was possible to be moved to a slightly quieter area, they just stated 'We don't do that.'

After that, they answered all of our questions about the menu as if we were idiots and then towards the end of the meal cleared our dishes before we were finished eating.

On top of all of this, as soon as we signed our bill the waiter rushed over and looked at the receipts to see if we'd left him decent tips. 

It felt as if they were trying to rush us out the door ... unsure why, but I'll never go there again.
author: Helen S.

description:
(See pics)

More like 3.3 stars.

Came to this other location (on 16th) which was a dimmer and slightly more restaurant than the other truer hole in the wall place.

This time I had banh xeo (crepe) and it was a lot of food and was pretty good. I like how the egg edges were crispy.

Service was good and friendly.
author: T L.

description:
Sunflower is open again! Woohoo! 

It's just the 16th street side, and it's a tiny little spot- maybe about 5 tables. There's a cool breeze when the door is open, but if they shut it it gets pretty warm in there. 

And the menu states the have beer and wine- but beware- there is only beer. Must have not gotten the wine back after the re-opening. 

Great low-priced spot for no frills noodles and fried rice. You really get a ton of food for what you pay, which is awesome. I'd say though that in general the food is decent, but not earthshatteringly great. Pretty standard noodle dishes and whatnot, and they tend to not have a lot of flavor. Even my husband- wimpiest eater ever when it comes to spice- was dumping the sriracha on his chicken fried rice. I'm a big fan of the garlic noodles, which I too needed to add a little kick of spiciness to. And we had the veggie imperial rolls to start, which are pretty good and filling. 

All in all- happy this place has reopened, but probably won't frequent it, same as I did before it closed.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I almost exclusively prefer mom & pop places for quick and easy Asian food that comes at a good value, and while this is a descent place for beef pho, and imperial rolls for take-out. (no real complaints)
 
However, I must say that the service is otherwise kind of rude, impersonal, and abrupt. I came in here a few days before Thanksgiving, with 1 waiter running around like a chicken with a severed head. Although I don't blame him, given the holiday season, and they the pan-flute Vietnamese Christmas music that was probably conducive to his madness.  They should probably consider hiring another person to help wait tables even given that the front room is the size of a shoebox.
 
My boyfriend has tried different chicken dishes from here now on 2 different occasions; I've taken tastes here and there off his plate and must agree that the sauce for the garlic chicken was quite diluted and bland  that the undead would die from irony of insult. The 5 Spice Chicken was loaded with pure heat from all the hidden red chili peppers, enough so that each bite was painful and that it was difficult to detect much flavor nuisances after the first few bites.  I'm not sure which of the former or the latter is preferred, I'll probably continue to order my beef pho, and same take-out order the next time I come here.
author: Ty T.

description:
My friends and I stopped by this place on a Sunday evening to grab a quick bite. I was looking for a nice spring roll to hold us over until our late dinner. As we walked through the door, my friend asked the inevitable question, "Here, or to go?"

Before I could answer, the strange and unpleasant smell answered my question! That being said, the spring rolls were prepared lightening fast and tasted just great. 

I would recommend this place for take out or pick up, but I most likely could not survive a sit down meal (or at least enjoy one) with that weird smell.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
I hate to write a nasty review but this place has gone downhill over the years with poor service and low quality of food. 

Our order:

Garlic noodles: Awful. At first bite, the taste was reminiscent of a wet dish rag. My boyfriend and I couldn't stomach it, so we decided to request a new batch. After trying to catch our waiters attention a couple times, a second waiter approached us. He kindly apologized for the chef's food and returned with a new plate. Unfortunately, the only improvement to the second batch was that it came back warmer. I had hoped they would check in and see if we were happy with the second plate but we were ignored for the remainder of our meal. 

Shaken beef: What used to be my favorite dish in its heyday turned out to be overly salty and sticky.    

Eggplant: This dish warranted at least one star to my rating. If it weren't for the buzzing creatures we noticed while waiting for the second batch of noodles, we might have enjoyed this portion of our meal. 

Sadly, we left the table with three full plates of food. Not a good feeling to be so wasteful. My guy normally scrapes his plate clean after every meal. He had no problem leaving the food behind. 

This used to be my go-to place back in college. Too bad revisiting it for old times sake was such a bad idea. The food was tastier back then, the place had been a tad bit cleaner and the waitstaff (the same waitstaff, mind you) treated their customers as guests. What happened?
author: Kelly G.

description:
John Denver comes back from the dead to sing about Sunflower...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eivZd4j5MBs

"Sunflower in the Mission makes me nappy
Sunflower on my plate can make me cry
Sunflower in my tummy feels so gassy
Sunflower almost never makes me high..."

I have to say I was underwhelmed with Sunflower when I came to eat here last week. I just wasn't feeling a Rocky Mountain High. I ordered one of their $7.95 Lunch Specials where you get the soup in the middle and the barbecue pork, imperial roll and side salad around it.

The pork was fine and a hefty portion to boot, but the soup was plain awful, an odd concoction with canned pineapple chunks in a soapy-tasting broth. The imperial roll was a greasy clump and dense to chew. Service was on the lackluster side, especially considering I was the only one in the place at 2:30PM.

"If I had a pho that I could give you
I'd give to you a pho just like Pagolac's
If I had a beef that I could shake for you
I'd shake some beef to make you feel this way..."

FOOD - 3 stars...just meh to my palate
AMBIANCE - 3 stars..."homey" would be a compliment for this place
SERVICE - 3 stars...rather bored, isn't she?
TOTAL - 3 stars..."FAR OUT!...Thank God, I'm a Banh Mi Boy!"...I'll need to try them again on a good night, I guess
author: Ed U.

description:
I like this place because:

A) It's tasty. I always get the veggie pho with tons of delicious, veggies (never soggy).

B) It's inexpensive.  Always a plus in my book.

C) It's close to my house.  

The staff is nothing to write home about.  They are no nonsense.  But they always get my order right.
author: Denise I.

description:
Two entrances (one on 16th, one on Valencia; we entered through the Valencia door) but Sunflower shares the same servers, cooks & kitchen.

Being the hot mess that I am, I felt right at home in this slightly run down restaurant. It's seen better days, but it doesn't matter; you're not here for the ambiance, you're here becasue you've only got $10 for lunch.

The lunch special: $7.95 for soup, rice ($.50 more for brown rice), imperial roll (vegetarian for me, pork for the BFF) & choice of meat (lemongrass chicken for me, BBQ pork for the BFF.) 

I'm always skeptical about restaurants claiming "authentic" eats; I've been to Vietnam & I don't know that I'd call this "authentic," per se, but I would say it's good enough to warrant a second visit. The imperial roll & green beans in the lemongrass chicken dish satisfied the texture fanatic in me. 

Total for two lunches & two thai iced teas $25 (not including tip.)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I went to this little restaurant by chance with my mom and grandma on a Tuesday night (it was the only menu that we could all find something on). We walked in and it was definitely cozy, but in a very good way. The vibe was extremely warm and like a nice place to catch up with friend after work. 

The wait service was a little abrupt, and the server forgot my beer (but luckily didn't charge me on the bill). The veggie spring rolls were phenomenal. I debated between the curry eggplant and the noodle bowl, and the server encouraged me to get the eggplant. It was a little too mushy and just not my favorite dish. My mom and grandma ordered their noodle bowls and were quite pleased

The service was extremely quick; our food was out before we got to finish our first spring roll. The portions were large as well; not a single one of us finished our plate.
author: Heather R.

description:
The food here is fine - not at the same level as spots in the Richmond, Sunset or Tenderloin, but it's not bad. Last week they repriced their menu and jacked prices by around 15% across the board, so now you'll save a fair bit of money for similar quality food down the street at Thanh Tam. (although the pho is a bit more flavorful here)

Also, I don't think they rinse their dishes very well. Occasionally your food may arrive with a soapy flavor, and a couple of times one of my colleagues has had an allergic reaction after eating here, to to what we're guessing is the soapiness in his food.
author: David C.

description:
Teetering between 3 and 4 stars, was gonna go with 4, but am sticking with 3.

The food is actually really solid for a Vietnamese place in the Mission.  Good, cheap Asian food is scarce in the Mission and sometimes I just FIEND for some noodles.

BF & I stopped by to check this place out on a Sunday night (later, around 9pm) and there was a wait.  Seemed like a great, low key place to catch up with friends, enjoy Asian food, and not break your wallet.  Not really like your authentic pho place with the small sauce dish, soup spoon, and chili sauce though.  Only sriracha and hoison (the basics).

We didn't wait long - and though we had to move tables for a larger party to sit, we got our food quickly.  After we got our food though the service was not that great.  Didn't have refills on water.

GARLIC NOODLES: Really big portion for $12.  We added chicken.
PHO: (or beef noodle soup, as was said on the menu...): pretty decent.  Fulfilled my pho craving - I'll probably be good for another few months.

I sort of thought about the garlic noodles afterwards for a couple of days.  Really garlicy, and delicious.  Definitely had leftovers.

Coming back here to get my noodo fix, for sure.
author: Adele Z.

description:
ok, so maybe I was Vietnamese in my past life or something. Or Thai, or Malay?  Or all of the above, I'm an old soul after all.
I've never had anything here that wasn't worth repeating.
Vietnamee crepes here are SO wrong yet so right,  Go there just for them if you're in the area. Grubbin, especially after day drinking and a shitty super bowl disappointment.

Love me some Sunflower, if only they were in the Peninsula too.  I'd be in rehab by now.
author: Athena S.

description:
It's important to know that Sunflower is two restaurants in the same locale with the same menu - one with an entrance on 16th, and the other with an entrance on Valencia.  They may actually share the same kitchen - I'm not sure.

This is important, because I actually give 5 stars to the 16th St. side, and two stars to the Valencia St. side.  Why? Read on...

The 16th St. Sunflower is small (only 5 tables) and shares a room with much of the kitchen.  It's warm and bustling, feels homey, and the food is great (especially the Fresh Vegitarian Spring Rolls), and nicely priced. Michael, the host who usually presides, is soft spoken, but totally willing to accommodate you: our favorite dish is the Shaken Beef with added green beans (not on the menu).

The Valencia side has the same menu at the same price, but the similarity ends there.  It feels like a suburban strip mall restaurant; it's murky and drab.  But the worst part is the service.  Firstly, it's kind of indifferent to mildly rude.  Secondly, the host will not accommodate requests ("...but Michael from the other side lets us..." "No - not on the menu.").  But the kicker (for us) is, they clearly dislike having children in their side of the restaurant.  If you have a kid, the service becomes markedly rude and dismissive.  We've experienced it bringing our own child on more than one occasion, and seen it with others.  Not acceptable.  We'll never go to that side again.

So go to the 16th St Sunflower.  But please, not when we do - there are so few tables.
author: Colin S.

description: Cheap and filling.. That about sums up my pho experience at Sunflower. The best pho I've had- methinks not, however for the price who's complaining. Would I think of returning? Probably not. Too many other tasty joints to discover in SF.
author: Ritu K.

description:
Might as well face it I'm addicted to "Garlic Veggie Noodles" Minus the TOFU (As I cannot stand the taste of it)

I have to say, every time I'm craving something quick and seemingly homemade in an off the wall restaurant, I come to Mr. Chow (so cold).  Oh wait,  I mean aaah, Sunflower.  It seems like you are in hide out spot in New York, because of it's small 5 tables and 4 chaired bar area. it's small and cozy and I think that is what I heart most about it. 

But, at the end of the day...it boils down to how my stomach reacts to the dish I am most addicted to.  The Garlic Noodle dish, Always always ALWAYS, gives me the .....


...
...
...

Drummm role please....
...
...
...

Hate to gross you lovely yelpers out there, but it gives me the...

 Ahem ***"runs"*** Ahem...

Huh? 

What? 

Uhhh, Who said that?  =/ 

I know what you're thinking, if this happens then WHY do I proceed to continue to devour in this dish that my stomach is obviously allergic to? Well it boils down to what is convenient and affordable and really who wants to walk or take public trans, when they are already tipsy from drinking one too many dranks... almost right next door?! 

I love you garlic noodle...but I gotta get away from you...

Cuz ya gotta chickity-check yo self be fo' you wreck myself...
Cuz garlic veggie noodles is bad for my health...
It comes real stealth....pum-parrarum-pum-pum

In the end....I'll prolly be back tomorrow =I

 And soooo it is...like...you....said...it...would be....
author: SammyWammy S.

description:
Heard about this place as a recommendation from others. Bad Idea. The food was very mediocre and when we were nearing the end of our Pho bowl, we realized there were two FLIES in there!
As disgusting as this was, we were even more disappointed when they refused to give us a refund (only exchanges), because the "manager" was not on site. Who would want another bowl of soup with flies in it since it probably came from the same batch?? 
Then they mysteriously (without calling) decided that they could make a refund. Not cool. very fishy
author: Alisha W.

description:
At this Vietnamese restaurant, I saw the Cantonese speaking cook break off the femur bone of a cow from a box of frozen clumped together femur bones -- with the heel of his shoe and it fell onto the kitchen floor, he picked it up and added it to the vat of beef broth on the burner. And then he repeated the procedure. (This was at the side, smaller Sunflower around the corner that has a counter over-looking the kitchen and its staff).

For a second, I thought, "This is the real shiznitch, I haven't lost my street cred as a white boy living in the Mission. This is old school cooking." Then, I thought, "I am too old for this crap. That's just gross. Shouldn't I be able to get in the Mission 8 dollar pho without shoe dirt?"

My final conclusion: Great restaurant if you are young and you think that frozen food kung fu'ed into pieces on the kitchen floor is cool. And, when I was younger, I would have.

I can't believe I took my parents to eat here five years ago. Wait. Come again, I can believe it: Sorry mom and dad, I used to want to annoy you so much for raising me in a conservative suburban neighborhood and that's why I ran away to the Mission. And I made you eat dirty pho to make you pay for your parenting crimes and you didn't say anything. You ate it and smiled. You really do love me.
author: Michael S.

description:
Delicious Vietnamese. Had the rice vermicelli (bun) with prawn and their fried egg roll. Delicious and good sized portion, without feeling heavy after finishing the whole thing. Attentive service

Note: there are two dining rooms -- one is right off the bus stop (22) on 16th. There is a much bigger one on Valencia around the corner. Small one has the open kitchen and smells delicious though
author: Aki N.

description:
WORST service EVER. 

This is the 2nd time I've had this experience with Sunflower so I know she wasn't just having a bad day. The lady who takes phone orders is extremely rude. She is the opposite friendly, is snarky and sounds irritated, doesn't like to answer questions, and pretty much makes you feel like an idiot for calling and wanting to spend your money there.

Unfortunately for us, the food here isn't bad and I like their salads...so we'll probably order take-out from them again. But seriously, it's absurd how rude this woman is. Quick fix: Give her a position that doesn't involve interacting with customers (she clearly doesn't want to!). There are a good # of complaints about her in other reviews here, so hopefully the restaurant is reading these and does something about it.This will turn into a 3 star rating the next time I call in and someone else picks up the phone to take my order :)

Aside from her horrific attitude, the food is good:

1. Shakin' beef: Really tender and flavorful, decent portion but a little pricey ($15 for dinner)
2. Shrimp salad: Healthy portion of both veggies and shrimp. Reasonably priced ($8)
3. Shrimp & pork spring rolls: Super overpriced ($7.25 for ONE - unless she messed up on my order) but the flavor isn't bad.
author: Ali L.

description:
The phö is a staple here,  but I almost always go for the Sunflower prawns.  Absolutely killer. 

Also, come for the eccentric waiter. Hilarious!
author: Robby F.

description:
BEWARE - dishonest people!

I had lunch there several days ago. The food was ok. I paid with credit card and left a $4 tip on the credit card (this was more than 20% of the bill). They changed it to $8 ! My hand writing is very clear, and there is NO WAY you could confuse 8 for 4 ! 
I discovered the overcharge when I compared receipts against the credit-card statement (I think many people don't  keep their receipts or check their statements,
and some places "take a chance" that the customer won't notice the overcharge).
I had to file a dispute with the credit card company.
author: G Y.

description:
Worst. Service. Ever.

Ok so I don't except a red carpet, love and affection, or someone to burp me after a meal, but i do except to have a server who is mildly polite, brings me food, and once in a while comes to check in and bring water. I DO NOT EQUAL high maintenance, but wowzah this was THE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD.

6:45pm
My friend and I came in around 6:45 to get some Pho, nom nom. At around 6:45 and 12 seconds the waiter threw (literally) our menus at us. At 6:45 and 47 seconds he came to angrily ask us what we wanted. I figured he was having a bad day, so i politely said that we would be ready in 5 minutes. 5 minutes later we ordered, and he walked away mid sentence, oh well, i figured he had at least gotten 90% of our order. 

7:05pm
20 mins later, about 5 minutes after we got our soups he came by with the check, didn't say anything, just threw it on the table...then the service got worse, yes...that was possible. 

7:20pm
He came by a few times in the next 15 minutes to pick up the check, which we hadn't paid yet since we were about 1/4 through our Pho. Long story short, it went downhill from there. I got bothered by his constant huffing and puffing and told him that we would bring him the check when we were ready, to which he yelled "WHAT ARE YOU STAYING HERE ALL NIGHT?". I'd like to point out that at this point we had been here for about 45 minutes total, and about 30 minutes into our meal. He went on to yell, clearly about us, to the other server, it was so uncomfortable that we ended up just paying the bill, senza tip, and leaving. 

I realize that we all have bad days, but this was simply unacceptable and I'll never go back here, unless i get a serious apology -- which clearly isn't happening.
author: Mariela C.

description:
Happened to be in the area and needed a quick bite.

I had a small vietnamese hot and sour soup, it was pretty good but I thought it was pricey for the portion. Boyfriend had the vermicelli noodles with beef and imperial rolls. the noodles and the beef were good, the imperial roll was not.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Let's start with, I love this restaurant! I always order take out here, which is super fast and super delicious. Eating here, the ambiance is really chill, relaxed and comfortable. The food has everything I want in authentic Vietnamese cuisine. 

Definitely go here.
author: Tom T.

description: Terrible service!! First we get there and he says only 30 mins service! Then we eat and they get super mad that we asked for water then we got charged for tea? After the bad service he wants us to tip? We left a nickle. I AM a server myself and fast food places give better service. But to top it ALL off he throws the nickle at my sister!!! Please don't come here, it's really bad !! The food sucked only because of his service.
author: Daniela M.

description:
I walked into Sunflower this evening with my brother and my nephew.  The place was packed but we were the first in line so we decided to stay.  The waiter/host 'ordered' us to sit by the bathroom door.  We complied.  But we continue to see that people who walked in after us continued to help themselves to tables that have just been vacated by the previous customers and no one seem to say anything.  We pointed this out to the original waiter who told us to sit and wait.  He immediately started flying off the handle and yelling.  THERE IS THREE OF YOU BUT YOU WANT TO SIT IN A TABLE FOR TWO!?!?  I TOLD YOU TO WAIT HERE.  YOU WAIT HERE!  THERE'S NO TABLE FOR YOU!!   

We were just stunned.  Since I was the closest to him in proximity, I told him there's no need to yell at us when we're clearly just checking with him given that no one is checking in with us.  The thing is, they really didn't actively sit anyone down, whether that's a table for 2, 3, 4, whatever.  People just seemed to grab vacated tables and put their belongings down on the chair to claim the table.  It's definitely civilization in progress!

The rude waiter became more and more flaming...  even foaming at the corner of his mouth.  Apparently, when he's not doing his job, he REALLY doesn't like to be questioned. My brother who was sitting down by the bathroom door, couldn't take it anymore.  He started telling the waiter to stop yelling at me.  It was not a good scene.

In the end we just decided on leaving because we did not go there to have a bowl of ghettoness with a side of pre-menstrual from a male waiter.

We went to Alibaba's Cave whose owners treated us with professionalism and respect and we ended up having a nice meal.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Can't compare to the Vietnamese food back home in Houston, TX - but, I can say this is one of the top Vietnamese joints I've tried in San Francisco.  My girlfriend and I come here about once or twice a week (as you can see, we don't cook very often). 

Some of our favorites:
- Shrimp and Pork Salad
- Shirmp Spring Rolls
- Seafood Noodle Soup; substitute the rice noodles with egg noodles
- Pork Vermicelli 

I give this place 4 stars for the food and efficiency.  The service, on the other hand, is either a hit or miss. There are days when the servers are extraordinarily happy and days where they seem stressed. 

In the end, it's healthy, it's tasty and it's quick - I can't complain!
author: Patricia T.

description:
Food is yummy, plentiful, quick, and all at very reasonable prices.  The sesame prawns comes with 4 giant prawns on a bed of tasty garlic noodles.  The Vietnamese crepe is legit and comes with lettuce and all the fixings to wrap and is DELICIOUS. Service was prompt.  

I would not say the servers were rude, they were cordial and hard working.  They were just focused on being very, VERY efficient.  They greeted and seated us promptly, said "thank you" when we were leaving, and double checked with my friend on the size of her beer when it was brought out.  This place was packed on a Saturday night and there was a short line forming on and off throughout the night.  I think that's why the servers kept dropping off checks before diners were finished and coming to pick up the checks before customers had paid.  The server came to our table 3 times before we actually finished our meal and put down our money.  I found this amusing but others might find it less so.  

The interior is a step or two up from your corner pho shop.  It was dimly lit and cozy. A big plus on a chilly SF evening was that it was also warm.  A good place for a casual meal with friends or a first date with a laid back beau.
author: Czarina B.

description:
I come to Sunflower for many reasons but the main reason I come here: GARLIC NOODLES... hmmm...
G A R L I C... [drool]

I've had it many times and have never been let down. Some of my other favorites:

- five-spiced BBQ chicken... the meat slides off the bone
- Vietnamese lemongrass chicken... wasn't sure how to eat this but turns out you use the lettuce as a wrapper and stuff it with the given ingredients
- eggplant curry... their curries are awesome
- shrimp spring rolls... very fresh

Their portions are generous. When I ate here with a friend, ordering the garlic noodles (hmmm) and another dish was more than we could finish. Having a third person would be perfect. So when I came here recently with two German friends visiting, we ordered the shrimp spring rolls and two entrees and shared it family style. We ate and finished everything.

When sitting down to eat, I prefer the cozy, dim atmosphere of Sunflower on Valencia St. But for to-go phone orders, the pick-up spot is the Sunflower on 16th St. As a tip for those driving (since parking is close to impossible on most nights), park in the white zone in front of Roxy's theater. There's sometimes a Roxy guy there telling you that you can't park there. Just mention you have a quick pick-up order at Sunflower and he's usually cool about it.

I've never had any bad experiences with the wait staff, but I could sympathize with other yelpers who felt mistreated and insulted.
author: Regs W.

description:
Wow I'm surprised I haven't raved about this spot yet.
SO delicious, SO cheap & quick, SO stuffed every time I leave.

The soups, the garlic vegetable, the summer rolls, the fried rice - all amazing but the stand out here is the calamari salad. The squid is so tender and warm - ahh - die for it.

Let me not forget about the hilarious server who is always in there (Thank you young lady! Thank you, sir!) - he knows his shit and he gets it done, crowded and usually by himself - he makes his job actually look enjoyable. And let's be real - nobody likes being a server but maybe this guy.

All in all, I come back, I leave more then content and I dream about that calamari salad.
author: S. M.

description: The food was excellent, but the service was curt and unfriendly.  We hadn't even finished our meal, and they dropped off the check without us asking for it(and there were many empty tables)!  Then, we paid the check, and made a mistake with adding it up and left a 10% tip(we all used to be food servers and usually tip at least 20%), and the food server marched back over and rudely threw the check down, and said, "you left $4 on a $40 tip!"  We said, "sorry, it was a mistake," and put a couple more dollars down(usually, we would have put $4 more down).  We were very taken aback at the moment, otherwise, I would have taken the tip and left!  As former food servers, we know that you NEVER question the tip!  He didn't even deserve that 10%!  Very, very rude!!!  But...the food is delicious!  I would get takeout there, but I will never sit in the restaurant again.
author: Krista W.

description:
We really love this place for lunch.

But one thing everyone should know is that there are two separate restaurants with the same name and owners, etc; one on Valencia and one on 16th. I can see what the one star yelpers are talking about with the service and the waiters on Valencia. 

We always go to the one on 16th and never have a problem. This restaurant is small and the service is what it is: almost non existent and borders on sarcastic or rude when you ask the servers to repeat something since their accents are so think. 

But I don't care about any of that. The food is really really good and affordable. We always get the lunch specials at around $8.50 for a huge plate of varying stuff. 

They don't care about coursing, or timing. My husband got his food a good 10 minutes before mine came. 

Love this place. Many returns.
author: Jenny M.

description:
For the post hippie and post South Vietnamese anti-war generation, they would not know the difference without 'inside' cultural experiences which defines most who are not Vietnamese, nor been to Vietnam, nor have enjoyed personal friendships and meals with Vietnamese community.  I  have, so my ability to discern authenticity on the extent and how Vietnamese dishes should or are traditionally prepared has the advantage. Most others patronizing most Vietnamese restaurants, outside of military veterans stationed in So. Vietnam at the time or Vietnamese community, graduated from meatloaf and hotdogs or 1970's diet of bean sprouts and Mary Jane brownies  or took bicycle touring low budget hostel tours now pretend to be culturally sophisticated because they actually walked around Chinatown or went to some suburban hosted cultural food street fair.

Most Vietnamese restaurants, to survive at a profit, simplify their menus and downsized otherwise uncommon complexity of ingredients to accommodate the fast food, all you can eat buffet nonVietnamese dining patrons.  Many foreign cultural menus in this town serve what is comparable to fast food list of dishes.  Sunflower Vietnamese Restaurant has survived this long because it compromises to appease the average American palate who have no personal experience interfacing with specific cultural communities.  Those of us with years of specific and varies inter-cultural interaction do know better.  Sunflower's menu is convenient to please an average palate.  No self-respecting authentic Vietnamese cook and proprietor would use canned pineapples in any savory dish and Sunflower does in both their locations including the one on Potrero Hill where I live and dined at that location.  

There may be only 3-5 in this entire city representing true Vietnamese dishes without compromising ingredients and cooking process. The best are in San Jose area. There used to be a very good one called Cali-Pho-nia on Clement St. but one of the owners told me that nonVietnamese patrons were used to the fast food shortcut tastes which contributed to abandoning the menu and go more mainstream gringo.
author: Lizabeth G.

description: Insanely hostile services. They refused services and asked us to get up coz one of our friends was a bit late. For party of five they added mandatory 20% tip. No matter how good the food is, which it is NOT good, it will never be worth it.
author: Yizhou J.

description:
Full disclosure: I just moved to SF from NYC. New York has lots of great things, but good Vietnamese? Not so much. Sunflower has some of the BEST Pho I have had in a very long time. It's the closest thing I've to authentic pho since traveling to Hanoi. The broth is extremely tasty and the portions are huge. You really can't go wrong for seven bucks. 

Note that the restaurant has *two* entrances. One on 16th (smaller) and one on Valencia. So if you are meeting up with people you'll want to specify which one to go to. They both use the same kitchen tho, so same delicious pho at both spots.
author: Dennis C.

description:
food: 3 stars
service: 2 stars
price: 4 stars

A lot nicer than it looks from the outside (walked by this location for years, even after going to the one in Potrero Hill, kept forgetting it was there). 

Great deal for the price, but don't go here if you're in a hurry. Had a hard time getting the server's attention to order, and an even harder time requesting the check. 

The food came fairly quickly once we ordered, though. The spring rolls were great, the BBQ pork was a bit salty, but the portions were very generous.
author: Sam Z.

description:
Delicious! I got the lunch special for $9.25 and didn't eat the rest of the day. I didn't hear about it until my husband shared his secret lists of restaurants.... the service was pleasant, the food expedited quickly and the freshness of all the ingredients was incredible! The portion is huge so you should share a plate if you don't want to go into food coma!

The five spice chicken is their house specialty, the chicken meat melts in your mouth and the flavors so distinct. 

I can't wait to go back and try all the other dishes.
author: Suzie Y.

description: I've been spoiled by the quality and authenticity of the Seattle Vietnamese food scene. I've been to the Sunflower location in Potrero Hill, and not only was the quality of food much better, but the restaurant was nicer. The food at this location was mediocre, take-out quality Vietnamese food. The fresh spring rolls with shrimp were pretty standard, but the peanut dipping sauce was overly sweet and and watered down that  I used hoison sauce instead. There was nothing special about the garlic noodles, except that it was a big serving and only came with vegetables if you requested it and paid extra. My favorite dish was the five spice chicken, which was tender and had good flavor, especially if you dipped it in the nuoc mam fish sauce provided. Overall, I would try other Vietnamese restaurants in the area before coming back.
author: Michael A.

description:
Our table of five was sat very quickly last Sunday night. Bf had wanted to come here our entire trip, as he had fond memories of the pho here two years ago. Fond enough that he came three times on that trip.

We ordered two appetizers (chicken rolls with vermicelli noodles and fried vegetable dumplings) and three phos (chicken +$1 for vegetable, beef, and seafood). The apps were my favorite part of the meal. I especially loved the sauce with the chicken. I pretty much ate the seafood pho myself as everyone else was a little sketched out by it. I enjoyed it, especially the pieces of calamari. However, without shiracha, it would have just tasted like fish.

Well, bf left a little disappointed that we all thought the pho was bland, but it was still good enough. Our server was mediocre. He did practically throw our five bowls for the pho on one of my tablemates. They literally fell on her. He said and did nothing while we nervously laughed. Thank goodness they were small and empty. We also had two ladles dropped on the table after asking for more.

The Thai iced tea was delicious! I'd come back, but I'd also be open to other pho options in the area.
author: Meredith D.

description: Ate spring rolls on 1/25/2014 & by evening was ill with food poisoning that knocked me out for two days. The place looked unclean & the rolls looked wilted and old. It was all I ate all day. Be warned if you eat here.
author: Crabby J.

description:
I've been going to Sunflower for a little while now and usually enjoy this low profile restaurant.
I won't be back after tonight though.

We are 2 and are placed on the table right next to the door. 
I asked for another table as it's freezing and the door doesn't close properly. 
The host refuses to sit us elsewhere: "It's full". Right. Besides these 2 empty tables  right there... 
I asked again a bit later, to the server this time: "It's full". Yeah? No. These 2 table are still empty.
Dinner was spent being cold and seeing 2 couples offered the 2 empty tables.
I left $0.53 of tip with a note "So cold. Not cool". Sorry my bad. I know tips are important. However, service is important too.
When walking out, a few feet from the door, the server rushes, yelling.
I stand still, he yells "You don't leave any tip?!" And I tried to explain: "I've been cold the entire time and you ignored me. Sitting other people on the empty tables."
The server, outside, on Valencia street, at 8:30 pm, yells "F%$k you! Don't come back!", wave his hands next to my face and yells and shows me his little finger. "F%$k you! Don't come back". Many more times.

Hey "young man", guess what? I won't be back.
One word of advice: be careful with your hands and foul language. You were scary out there.
author: Severin S.

description:
I've been going to this restaurant for years!  I love their food but, I just had the worse experience ever and now will never return.

I took my friend there, it was her first time.  The service has never been exceptional but it usually wasn't bad.  Well, tonight wasn't any better.

At the end of our meal, they handed her the bill.  She handed it back with a credit card.   She tripped according to the service she received (That's the way it should be, right?).  They brought back the check with a little laminated thingy asking for "15%-20%"

Never have I been more taken aback... I don't feel it's right to ever correct someone's tip...  I told my friend to put 'a penny'...

They had the nerve to yell at us all the way out of the restaurant and even make a racist comment as we were leaving.  NEVER WILL I GO BACK! EVER!
author: Jessie C.

description:
wow. WOW. 

tonight i got YELLED AT by someone who i think was the owner of this place. 

right after i finished my noodle soup (i eat fast) and was sipping on my hot tea (still piping hot), the waiter came over and told me there was a line, and so could i pay up and make room for other customers? i told him i was still drinking my tea and would leave when i was finished. ahem. 

two minutes later another guy came over, rudely patted the bill with his hand, and told me the same thing. i told him to let me please finish my tea and to not rush a paying customer out. he then proceeded to make a SCENE -- yelling at me -- seriously, standing there yelling (!) and saying something about how i was taking advantage of him because he was asian (???).

the customers around me were flabbergasted. one person left a 35 cent tip and another muttered something about how there would "never be a next time." a couple who was waiting to be seated walked out. thank you. 

naturally, i will never go back, and i encourage you to patronize one of the many other great restaurants in the neighborhood. that guy ought to be ashamed of himself.

rough night at the sunflower.
author: jean w.

description:
I am Vietnamese and came to the restaurant with 3 non-Viet friends, hoping to introduce them to good Vietnamese food, and I was not disappointed. The food was good. Not great, but by no means a bad first impression. And the shaken beef was off the hook! I highly recommend it... to-go.

Then one of my friends said his girlfriend would actually be able to join us in a minute if it's okay. The place wasn't crowded, and there were empty tables so I figured it'd be okay to take a chair and add it to our table or move to a bigger table. When we told the waiter that someone else would be joining us in a minute (we weren't sitting down for more than 8 or so), he shouted at us, "your friend can't come." I've never been heard about rejecting someone at a low-key restaurant, so I asked, "Why not? We can pull up a chair if it's okay." And he raised his voice and said that we could get out of the restaurant and come back in 1 minute with our friend, and reorder. And then she came to the table no less than 10 seconds later. This was why there were plenty of empty tables next to us. So I was utterly confused why he was in such a rush to kick us out and bring us back in. As we got up to get out and come back in, the wait just commanded "Fine! Sit down."

They never came to our table the entire time except to put down the food (mind you, if there was no space, he put the next dish on the plate we were already eating from even if we were still clearly actively eating from it, not bothering to let us move anything to adjust for space).

At the end, I was not happy about the +1 situation, having him put plates down while we were still actively eating from our plate, and also having to go into the kitchen to order. When I'm stingy, I leave about 10% tip. On the bill, there was a total, and then in writing, he wrote tip under the bill and "required" us to tip him 20%. I think not sir. So at the end of the meal, we all contributed 10% tip. While we were waiting for my friend's to-go food, they came back for the bill and I told him that I would prefer we get all of our food first. So as my friend is double checking the to-go food, he yelled "I've waited long enough, give me the check!" And the whole restaurant fell silent. My boyfriend quietly asked, "Sir, was that really necessary?" He said yelled even louder only 6 inches from my boyfriend's face, "Shut up!!" catching people's attention from outside the windows of the restaurant. And he stormed off.

Long story short, if you would still like to financially support people with this type of behavior (as I've read this definitely hasn't been the first time the waiter have quick temper and yelled), I highly recommend to-go orders.
author: Ailinh D.

description: Went there tonight, had a standard meal, my girlfriend was sick so she ate slower.  You can tell they were trying to get us out cause after my girlfriend went to the bathroom the waiter tried to take my girlfriends pho, I said wait she's not done.  He literally yelled back at me saying "What are you going to stay here all night". Small place, loud waiter, never going back.  Rude waiter giving me the evil eye as I walked out.  Why even be in food services is you have such an attitude.  Never again.
author: Andy L.

description:
I've ate here twice. The first time I wasn't all that impressed but me & a friend of mine were curious. The food was just ok. I've had much better Vietnamese food before. 
I tried their imperial rolls and shaken beef. The second time I had their pan fried noodles with prawns. 
What really had taken me back was the service. Extremely rude & pushy. 
Before I finished my last noodle they were snatching my bowl away and handed me the bill with a list of tips suggestion. I was really taken back by this. 
I've decide that I'll never return to this place.
author: Larry J.

description: Came here for the first time tonight. I love!! The food it taste good! Its priced fair!! And its made right!!. I was just about to give up on vietnamese food in San Francisco. I am so glad I found this spot! I highly recommend the shaken beef so tender and delicious!!!
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description: Don't bother, horrible horrible service and the food is mediocre. I won't eat there again. Learn how to treat well your customers, at least be professional and polite, that's the minimum we asked. Lame.
author: Seb D.

description: BF got food poisoning from the vermicelli, the kind where there is no getting over it without Cipro and your gut is never the same again. Thanks for the $1300 medical bill! If you eat here, make sure to get something served hot, the cold noodle vermicelli is too risky and I'll never get it from a divey restaurant again.
author: Alex A.

description: The food is delicious but that crazy flaming waiter needs to go! He picks up your plates when you're not even done with your food then tells you to hurry up. If he's not screaming at you, he's screaming at someone else in the room. He's lucky I'm not as gangster as I look. Skip this place if you want to sit down or head up to Potrero.
author: Fredo L.

description:
Pho-nominal!!!

I love this place! I actually swear that I stay healthy solely because of how often I get their chicken pho..

I don't know about how anything else on their menu is though..I come here for pho only.
author: Sarah J.

description: good food, friendly/fast service (both eat in and carry out) and reasonably priced - what more could you ask for?
author: wen y.

description:
In a neighborhood where lackluster restaurants persist because of one-time tourist purchases, Sunflower rises above the crowd.  

I've eaten here on super busy weekends and random midweek late nights.  The noodles dishes (vermicelli, egg, pan fried, etc) are huge, delicious, and vegetarian without tasting like you're not eating meat for health reasons.  Also, I am kind of in love with the veg spring rolls - and the sauce that accompanies them.  Authentic... maybe not.  Worth stuffing yourself anyway, yes.
author: Laureli K.

description:
Good pho in the Mission? Impossible! Oh wait, there's Sunflower. I am saved a long trip to indulge in my biggest craving... extremely tasty soup. I get sick of burritos, so Sunflower is a welcome addition to my rotation of reasonably cheap local eateries.

Sunflower has two locations... a take out section with a more cafe-like atmosphere and a little tiny hole in the wall restaurant around the corner. The former is great to quickly get lunch during the work day, the latter to sit down and actually take a meal. The menu is identical in both sections and delicious. The staff are friendly and quick, and the pho is excellent.

I think I might end up spending a lot of money here, as the craving for noodle soup is becoming stronger and stronger.....
author: Denise B.

description:
Still one of my favorite take-out places in town.  

Aside from the dishes we ordered in the past, this time we had the garlic eggplant (good although slightly prefer the curry version more), the green beans with chicken (very good).  Also, was pleasantly surprised by the veggie and tofu noodle soup - quite flavorful and a healthy portion of different veggies, even in a to-go order.

Basically, it's hard to go wrong here ....
author: F. P.

description:
How is it possible this place hasn't been shut down for the illegal shakedown of customers for tips?  No, I do not think it "cute" or "cool" that the waiters are hands down the rudest I have ever experienced, nor do I understand why the hipsters (or should I call them the "sheepsters"?) would flock to this place, unless they love a sadomasochistic relationship with their waiters....

8 years ago, I ate here for the first time with my boyfriend and was appalled to see that a 25% tip, FOR A TABLE OF 2, had been included in our tab.  I was so angry that I stood up, announced to the entire room that they should check their bills for tip-padding, slammed down the money for the food with NO tip on the table,  and huffed out, swearing to never return.

Fast forward to 8 years later when I happen to be in the Mission and a friend cajoled me into trying it one more time. Great food, great service, great time....hmmmmm? Was I wrong?  Maybe they've changed.....

NO, NO, AND NO.   3 weeks later, I bring 2 other people along, and the old familiar ugliness reared its head: this time, in the form of the waiter running out, after we had paid our bill and left a tip, to FLING our tip at us and scream that it wasn't enough, leaving my friends with their mouths open and myself fuming with self-hatred that I had ignored ONCE AGAIN what I knew was a basic truth: these people are rude as hell!

That being said, I really love their food.  Their garlic noodles, the shrimp fresh rolls, the generous portions, and basic freshness of the ingredients altogether make me crazy because I am now in a moral abyss: how do I get this food without the sure-to-follow insults? Easy -- TAKE OUT!
author: Mitra M.

description:
This place is definitely a dive decor-wise, but I found the food to be great quality at a good price point.

I had the vegetarian lunch special which included lemongrass tofu, an imperial spring roll, high quality brown rice, a cabbage salad, and hot/sour soup  -- all for $9. My favorite items were the spring roll (large, lightly fried with a great crunch and fresh filling) and the tofu stir fry (nicely spiced and served with green beans). The cabbage salad was a good addition if unmemorable. I didn't love the hot and sour soup, as it was served with fresh tomatoes, chopped quite large. All in all, though, I very much recommend the lunch special, since it is fun to get a bite of several things. I also enjoyed the Vietnamese iced coffee, which are brewed to order and strained at the table and served with condensed milk: yum!

The servers were very attentive: another plus!

Excited to come back and try more dishes from Sunflower.
author: Maggie J.

description:
Favorite mission restaurant, easily.  Nothing compares to their vegetarian imperial rolls - not even the stuff i had in vietnam!  The lunch special is always a great value, and the food is always consistent, fast, and unequaled. 

I've been coming here for 11 years, and even though I moved away for 5 of those years, the waiter still remembered my name.  i couldn't believe it.
author: Natalie L.

description: I was shooed out of this restaurant at the end of my meal. The waiter repeatedly came over and tried to take our check, but my dining partner and I had not finished eating and thus had not even looked at the check. The restaurant wasn't full - there were three empty tables near the door - and there was no one waiting. My friend and I were able to laugh about it because blatant rudeness was pretty surreal, but I'm not even going to bother talking about the food because the inconsiderate waitstaff was enough to turn me off from this establishment forever.
author: Jayme B.

description:
Extremely bad service
The stuff were shouting, being rude and even put 20% tips on the receipt with pen.
They were forcing us to leave the place before at 2210 and we were still eating - the opening time was till 2230.
Food was mediocre
author: Kitsios K.

description: I regularly have their vegetarian pho, and it's always so satisfying, with savory garlicky soup and tons of vegetables that are cooked just right, not overcooked. I've tried a few other dishes, and they were good, but not as good as their pho. Great prices!
author: C S.

description:
pretty good food. 

beef pho (4/5 stars)
sizzling seafood - bf got it and he seemed to like it

definitely a good option for the bunch of the restaurants in that corner
author: Janet Y.

description:
Sweet soup 
Good 5-spice chicken

I've been backed up on my reviews so I'm trying to catch up.  I went here 5 months ago with my co-workers.  Read good reviews and my boss goes here every Sunday.  I've always passed by this place every time I go to Truly Mediterranean.  I really wanted to try this because they served other food other than pho and bbq meat.  

Came here and didn't expect that they had 2 entrances.  We went to the bigger area and it looked nice.  I forgot what I ordered but it was a big combo.  I got chicken plate.  It was tasty and good.  My only thing was the soup that came with it.  It was too sweet, like dessert sweet it hurt my teeth.  I noticed they put pineapple.  I didn't really enjoy that, but other than that it was good.  

I wish I could come back again.  Soon!
author: Claire J.

description:
MISSION--If you want to amuse your friends or simply win a bet with them that you can get the waiter to scream at your table and go all bat shit by merely uttering politely nine choice words, go here.

To make this mind trick work, you need to first order the Pho beef with vegetables added for a dollar more. The words to say are "Sorry, I didn't find any meat in this soup."

And just as sure as Frank Sinatra in the "Manchurian Candidate" was powerless to keep control of his actions once the subliminal trigger phrase was spoken, you will have a waiter yelling at you. Actually, it's only been confirmed effective on the big queen-ee waiter. I'd be curious to hear from other Yelpers at their success in applying the phrase to others working there.

The funniest part of the whole disconcerting episode was when the guy called me a liar and said that he had observed me eating the meat on closed circuit TV. (Full disclaimer, at the end of the meal, i did turn up three pieces of smallish meat on the bottom of the bowl. I guess their rendition of this timeless Vietnamese dish is something akin to Cracker Jack Pho--a little meat surprise is included in every serving.)

The extra fascinating element at play is how the waiter guy went from from sugar sweet pussycat to pissy hellcat in the snap of a finger, a little like Miss Piggy of the Muppets fame.

Anyway, I stopped going here for a period of years after growing tired of a prior waiter being a little too fresh with me.

I've been back occasionally in the past year--only for lunch--and have stuck to standards like spring rolls and lemon grass with success. I should have known not to try to get anything as complicated as Pho.

The Mission doesn't have a lot of good Vietnamese food to chose from. And although passable, compared to what's on offer in San Jose, the food here is pretty unremarkable.
author: JayBee L.

description: Yum! The lemongrass tofu and chicken pho were really good. Service was quick and friendly. Easy location right off 16th st BART. Dishes are ~$10 each.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Food is relatively cheap but marginal.  Ordered one of the soups with tofu and got maybe 4 small deep fried chunks of tofu in a huge bowl of soup.  Service sucked overall.  I was very disappointed and won't be going back to Sunflower.
author: Matt M.

description:
I've had the garlic noodles (kinda greasy), the vermicelli with imperial rolls (super dee-lish) and the Vietnamese crepe (pretty ok).

It isn't the cleanest place, but if you're weird about dirty restaurants you shouldn't be eating anywhere near 16th Street.

The waiter is overworked and loving the hell out of it. He isn't rude, he just needs to know what you want. Love him.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Where have I been all these years?  Shame on me.  I've been lurking around the Mission forever and never thought to try this place.

That's what friends are for, I guess...The line was out the door when we arrived.  Good sign.   The wait?  Maybe 20 minutes.  Even better.

As soon as we sat down, swift service, great menu with lots of vegetarian options.  Totally diggin' it.    

I'm no authority on Vietnamese cuisine, so I can't say much there.  What I can say is that this place is TOTAL Mission.  Super cas'.   Cheap.  Not much goin' on inside but fresh yummy food.  And be prepared for some spice because they definitely bring it.

Way to represent!
author: Angella S.

description:
Good Vietnamese. Not over the top or life changing, but always solid.

The price reflects the quality of food and the servers are always wonderful to us. We love tipping well at this place.
author: Allison H.

description:
I love Sunflower for man, many reasons. Chief among these is the consistently tasty and hot food. The Spring Rolls are made with a thick, crispy and chewy rice paper, and the filling stays fire hot for at least 10 minutes after being set on the table. I always grab the Pho, or a hearty noodle bowl for an entre. Best part, most of the menu is Gluten free! All of the portions are GIGANTIC. 

For the most part the restaurant is fairly clean, but if you are looking for an immaculate space move along. The tables are always tidy, the place settings, plates and silverware is always sparkling, the bathroom is always clean, and the carpet is spotless - it's just that the whole place has a dingy look (but I love that kinda stuff).

Most of all, I LOVE THE STAFF. They are sassy and won't take any BS from anyone. But if you are a regular, they will get to know you, they will chat with you, and you will get better, fresher food FAST. If you act like an jerk, they will treat you like a jerk, and will feed you at their leisure.

So - it's great food, mostly gluten free, and the staff are sassy. What more could anyone want! 

If you want to eat here with a group larger than 4, be aware that you will have to wait a while to be seated as well as to get your food. It is worth it!
author: Jonathan D.

description: My take-out vegetarian food was greasy and unflavored (the Vietnamese pancake, veggie pho, and papaya salad). I'd requested medium spicy but couldn't distinguish much flavor in any of the dishes.  But the grease load was substantial and collected in the bottom of the container.
author: Barbara D.

description:
*quick, easy, delicious noodles*
#bigportions
#quickservice

So I've been here twice and...probably should've ordered different things but was so impressed with the lemongrass pork I had to get it again. It came out just as quickly as before and with some incredibly delicious vegetable rolls. The service is quick, one, two, three --- seat, order, eat with no BS in between. Garlic noodles are also very tasty as I hate half of my friend's portion. A close proximity dining service that I will surely be back for. 

Since it is that quick though, they want you in and out quickly cause a line does build up. Both times, I got prompted shortly after eating to get up and go for other customers.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I've actually been here two or three times, and its usually OK. I used to live in the Mission and go here when I wanted Vietnamese. The food is usually satisfactory, never amazing, but it was convenient. However, the whole thing today was pretty appalling. 

I understand if they're short staffed, but that is no reason for the waiter to be short and rude to us. 

We walked in, no one greeted us, we sat down and two other tables were filled after us, yet both of them had their order taken before we did and one table even had their food BEFORE we even ordered. That was really irritating.

For the record, we were really hungry and had made our decisions and put our menus away within minutes of walking in the door. Yet the waiter had to be flagged down to take our order. He seemed to be really angry at us and avoiding our table for some inexplicable reason. 

Then my friend spilled his water (probably in a delirium of hunger, lol) and they saw it and... no one came to help us wipe the table up. The table was dripping in water which we wiped up ourselves with napkins. Said waiter then had to be asked to take the wet napkins away, and was snotty when asked for new napkins. Kind of incredible.

I asked him a question and he cut me off and snapped at me! LOL!

My soup was also lukewarm.

He got a really crappy tip. I think we pointedly left $1 on a $35 bill. That is not something I normally would ever do. Crappy service will usually get a 10 - 15% tip. I just honestly felt he deserved nothing at all. He was just such a rude asshole. Probably won't be back ever. That was too much. I mean, I live in the fucking Sunset now, I can get better Vietnamese with good service any day, so why would I ever come here again? When in the Mission, I'll be sticking to Mexican from now on, me thinks.
author: Zvezdana O.

description:
Service = 2/5 stars.... the waitress was completely unenthusiastic and bland...bleh.

Food = 4/5 stars ... I had come here before once with some friends and did family style with their Garlic Noodles, curry vegetables, and lemongrass beef.  Yesterday my friend came here and shared a bowl of Beef Noodle Soup (pho) and the 5-spiced chicken.  OH GOD the 5 spiced chicken was SO GOOOOOOD!!!!!  I don't know what the 5 spices are, but they definitely came together into a really damn good tasting plate of chicken.  The beef pho was also pretty good, and the rare steak meat was really tender.  The garlic noodles are also really good, and overall the portions they give you here are generous and filling.
author: Liz W.

description:
Food & Drink: Noodle soup with chicken was tasty, and contained a pretty large serving for one person (and price). Not too salty, plus they bring the accompanying side of sprouts and cilantro. Beer & wine lists are nothing special but do have the usual San Francisco suspects (Anchor Steam) for reasonable prices. 

Service: The reason this place got 3 instead of 4 stars. We were seated as quickly as possible (though we did have to wait 10 minutes or so, having made no reservation on a Saturday night). But we were checked in on quite frequently soon after we were seated, despite not being ready to order, and despite there being no waiting customers. Our server (who didn't speak much English, or else feigned not being able to speak much English) appeared to get more and more irritated with us as the night wore on, coming over to "ask if we needed anything" but giving us the impression he wanted us to hurry up and finish. He then brought us our bill before we were even finished eating (and we hadn't asked for it). 

I'd say go to this place but don't expect friendly service. It's also really small so I wouldn't advise bringing a crowd (especially given the service issues).
author: Katie H.

description: So I finally came back to this place to catch a friend as they were finishing dinner. I had a burrito from Poncho Villa w/ me, and asked the waiter if he minded if I eat it while my friends were finishing and paying the check. It was the same guy I complained about 2 years ago. He was totally cool this time. Guess he was having a better night.
author: Joe S.

description:
I don't live in San Francisco, but when I come to visit, I usually go out to the Mission district to meet up with one of my friends, and the last time I was up there, she took me to this place for a comforting late night dinner (I was hurting from partying way too hard the night before).

It was a short walk away, and we got there around 8PM, so it was pretty packed with customers, so we had to wait about 20-30 minutes before we were seated. I was shocked at how small this place was, but my friend was raving about this place and how everyone loved it, so I toughed it out even though I was pretty uncomfortable waiting by the small waiting area and getting hit by the door every time someone left or came inside.

Once we were seated, the menu looked pretty simple, probably two pages long with basic Vietnamese dishes you would see at any Vietnamese place. I found it kinda funny when I ordered chicken Pho because it's actually called "Chicken Noodle Soup" on the menu, and my friend who ordered beef Pho called it "Beef Noodle Soup."

I'm pretty picky with my Pho, and I gladly give Sunflower my stamp of approval for delicious Pho. The broth was super clean tasting, and the texture/chewiness of the noodles was perfect for me. The veggies were fresh and I found myself eating my entire bowl (which was huge!).

Finding a good place for Pho is always an awesome thing for me because it's not very often that I find Pho good enough for me to return to eat it again. I hope I can squeeze in a trip up to SF to see my friend again because I would love to eat here again sometime soon.
author: Denise B.

description: Great Vietnamese restaurant! Loved their beef pho. I recommend this restaurant! Nicely priced!
author: Shaun E.

description:
Walking into Sunflower is kind of akin to walking into little dive restaurant in Thailand.  (I'd say Vietnam, but I haven't been yet.)

The place is sparse, but really you don't go to the restaurant for the decor, you go for the food, and it was very good.

I feel like I would have enjoyed the food more if I'd gone with a larger group so we could share more dishes.  As it was, I was with my husband and with only the two of us we had to be a little restrained with the amount of food we ordered.  

We had the garlic noodles, and the crispy beef.  The garlic noodles were good, very good, but in retrospect I should have chosen something a little more substantial and meaty.  The Crispy Beef was delicious.  It was a little spicy, and very tender.

We also ordered the fresh spring rolls with peanut sauce.  I'm a sucker for peanut sauce so of course I loved these.

Prices were reasonable, and we did get a lot of food.

I will say we had a hard time getting the check at the end of the meal.  It just took longer to flag down a server than it should have.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Yikes, what happened to this place? 

I used to love coming here. The service was never that great but I enjoy the food here so I decided to bring some friends visiting from out of town. We had planned to meet another friend who was en route and to arrive about 15 minutes later. At the door we mentioned that we had a friend coming to meet us but that we would like to order before she arrives. The waiter said, "ok," pointed to a table and walked away. Soon after he brought menus and water. We prepared to order and waited...and waited. At a certain point it was clear that the server was ignoring us so we kindly asked if we could order. This is when the wheels seem to come off the wagon. Our server immediately raised his voice and asked if our friend had arrived. We said not yet but that we would like to go ahead and order. This seemed to infuriate him, and replied, "no, we do not hold tables." I thought there was a misunderstanding and tried to clarify that we intended to order and pay for our time there. He simply cut me off by shaking his head and repeating no. We then asked if we could order anyway, without our friend. This angered him even more, he completely lost the plot and went off on a tangent about how the restaurant does not hold tables. Everyone around us turned to see what was going on as he continued to berate us. We were stunned. The experience was so awkward and bizarre we didn't know what to do. I've never been yelled at by a waiter. At some point he stormed off and started taking orders from our neighbors. We were left speechless. I apologized to my friends; I felt awful as I was the one who recommended this place. Fortunately, there are plenty of restaurants in the area so we found another (much more inviting) option quite easily. 

In retrospect, I still don't know what happened. I mean, I understand if a restaurant has a policy where they don't hold tables for guest but why seat us in the first place, just to ignore us? If the server would have mentioned the restaurant policy before we were seated and ready to order, we would have had the opportunity to make a decision without all the drama. Instead we were made to feel as though we were doing something so horrible by asking to pay to eat at a restaurant that serves food. It's a shame because I used to love this place. I'm still shocked at how bitter and mean our server was with us...seriously. Completely unnecessary. Ugh. I'll spare myself the hassle and go someplace else next time.
author: Laila F.

description:
One of the few places in the city where good pho does not come at the cost of service and environment. The staff at Sunflower are always friendly and on top of their service. (I have to express a particular gratitude for the server who, with an almost southern charm, insists on greeting me with " Good evening, pretty young lady!" every time I go in) 

The vermicelli is amazing, as is the veggie pho. My only complaint is that, depending on the day, the veggies in the pho can be a little lacklustre. Otherwise, Sunflower is an inexpensive, friendly, relaxing place to meet a friend for lunch or dinner.
author: Charlotte B.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE. 
I wrote my review only to find hundreds of others with the exact same experience. Read mine, read others with 1 star. It makes no sense that this exact same thing has happened over and over again. 

*******
Rudest waiters ever. I walked into a pretty empty restaurant and sat down since there was no hostess. The waiter yelled loudly from across the room, " how many people are you" and then promptly moved me to a two top. Ok, i thought. A little loud but understandable. Order pho. About 10 minutes later the check was placed on the table. Ok, I've only ate 1/4 of the bowl but maybe they are just putting it there for when I'm ready. I continue to eat my soup, and 5 minutes later the waiter comes back, opens the check book and sees no money, and slams it back down. Now i am annoyed because i blatantly still have 1/2 a hot bowl of soup left to eat. 5 minutes later he come by again and says, "nothing yet". To which respond, "well i am still eating". i find this extremely rude and am in shock. I think, "maybe he doesn't know he is being rude", trying to give him the benefit of the doubt.So I look for him to come back so that i can let him know. I ask for him but his other partner insists i tell him what about, so i cay tell him that I thought it was rude to check the check while i was still eating. He then says that i am taking up space, that he want to make room for more customers... Mind you, there are about 6 four top tables empty and NO ONE waiting. I try to clarify calmly that it is rude to rush people out when they are clearly eating and no one is waiting for their spot. He promptly becomes enraged, saying he will the call the police if i don't leave, is yelling and walking through all the tables disturbing everyones meal. I paid and left, but i will certainly never be back. Nor do I think anyone else who was there.
author: Elena P.

description:
This little place I call it "picada" which means an amazing little place with the best food for super cheap price!  It is always open, always good food, always best option for the perfect moment. Learn that ! when you know a "picada" , that "picada" will always be recommended and it becomes popular just like that.
MJM
author: Coté M.

description: Super affordable and very tasty!
author: Mira P.

description:
I've dined here every so often and never had a problem with the staff. It is a convenient restaurant to the Roxie theater. This visit I found that the staff was very rude, unwelcoming and I will never come back!

I was shocked when after we paid the bill. I asked for more hot water for my tea and was told we were done and would not give me the hot water.  A different waiter did bring me the hot water.  So I thought there must have been mis-communication. My friend and I chatted a few minutes while I drank my cup. I was again shocked when the 2nd waiter came back and told us we needed to leave so could have the table for other guests. At this time, there the restaurant was only 25% full and no one waiting to sit.  It's no wonder that this restaurant is not full and have such mixed ratings here.

There are more delicious and more gracious Vietnamese restaurants in lower Polk area.  Definitely more restaurants in the Valencia corridor to enjoy a meal and not ruining my evening by giving us the bum's rush!!!
author: Korene T.

description: One of the best rare beef pho bowls ever... maybe not the tastiest but the meat was impeccable.  Tender, soft and juicy and still rare when I picked up a slice from the hot steamy bowl.  I had a fresh shrimp spring roll and instead of peanut sauce I asked for a fish sauce and they were more than accommodating.  I also ordered and enjoyed the Garlic Chicken served with rice even though I wanted the 5 spice which contained gluten.  Highly recommend this spot and I was told to go here by those old school locals who've lived in this area for over two decades.  I'd definately go back next time I'm in the hood.
author: Shiho F.

description:
lovelovelove!

stumbled upon this place late one night while walking around.
we didn't realize it was close to closing and when we sat down we were told that the kitchen would only be open for another half hour. we were fine with that because we were ready to order right away. 

we had:
shrimp spring rolls
chicken pho
beef vermicelli

everything was DERRICIOUS. i love ordering pho from restaurants where the staff is actually vietnamese! the spring rolls were FRESH and larger than any other spring roll i've ever had...ever. blew my mind. i would comment on the vermicelli, but hot dinner date devoured it all...so i'm assuming it was amazing. honestly, the portions and taste alone merit 5 stars.

but to top it off, the customer service was unreal.
after getting a good portion of food, we decided to just pack up our food and leave so that the restaurant could close, but the owner/chef/servers all insisted that we don't rush and jokingly said not to leave until we were full. it was so kind and genuine. they even refilled our waters and didn't lurk around or give us the check early to rush us out. also, another couple came in while we were eating and asked if they were closed...but they offered to serve them since we were eating. they opted for take out, but still...

authentic food
great customer service
large portions?

5 stars all around. i'll definitely be back.
author: Riana C.

description: This place is a mission staple.  I stopped by last time to get some chicken soup to starve off my cold.  The bowl was huge.  I like sitting at the counter on the 16th street side because it's much quicker, especially if I'm eating alone.  Plus you get to watch them cook.   My other faves are the beef bun and the spring rolls. The clay pot looked good, but I haven't tried it yet.  Maybe next time.
author: Michelle R.

description: It's about time this place closed.  The staff was extremely rude but the food was good. I'll be going to the Potrero hill one more.  Great garlic noodles.
author: Edel C.

description:
What a gem on 16th St.  While I admit the ambiance and wait staff is nothing to write home about, I have had nothing but great meals here.

I've been three times now and will be back for many more.  Just a very quick and cheap meal.  

My recommendations are the spring rolls (any type) and the garlic noodles, which must be unmatched in the city...wow they are so good.  The lemongrass tofu is also good, but really, I imagine everything is good. Wash it all down with a Sapporo or Tsing Tao, and you are golden.

This is the ideal spot for a quick meal before going to the Roxie or going out on Valencia.
author: Will A.

description:
I am giving it four stars for the food, and another one for the good service, politeness, free tea, and consistency. This is one of the first restaurants i ever went to in SF, and it still is one of my favorites today thanks to the excellent food, competitive prices, and lack of unnecessary frills.

i nearly always have the lemongrass beef and the garlic and onion eggplant. these two are off the charts for me, and i could eat them almost every day. I just went to the one on Valencia for the first time the other day (normally i go around the corner to the one on 16th) and i am please to say there is no difference to the menu or quality.

i see someone has quibbled about it not being the best pho. I would agree, it's pretty good, but... I don't go there for the pho! the rest of the menu is good enough. If i want amazing pho, then i'll go to a place that is particularly known for its pho, like Evergreen Garden or Pho 2000.
author: William C.

description:
Weekday lunch specials are a huge portion for under $10.
Food is very good flavor and quality.
author: Eric H.

description:
Let me say that 3 stars is a good review for me. It just means that I wouldn't object to coming back if friends want to go but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back to this place. 

I ordered their garlic noodles with beef and it was definitely delicious but not the garlic noodles I expected (a la Crustacean/Thanh Long/Perilla). Not to say it wasn't good but it tasted more like Pad See Ew which isn't a bad thing if I were at a Thai Restaurant. Another plus about this place is that their portions are huge and the prices are pretty low in comparison. I will try another dish if there's a next time but seeing as that there are better Vietnamese places near me in the Inner Sunset, I don't know when/if I'll ever be back.

Despite my critiques, I still recommend this place because of its portion sizes and their prices.
author: Rylan C.

description:
I just came back from an enjoyable chicken with imperial roll over vermicelli noodles. We went to the larger sit down part of this unusually designed restaurant. We were able to get a table for 6 within a few minutes of arriving.
