The meal went pretty well. The chicken was flavorfully bbq'd and the sauce to drizzle with was lightly tangy. I really liked their imperial rolls.. they were fried goodness. Service was also quick and friendly. Despite the Vietnamese goodness, I am burping up a storm though... :(
author: Thomas L.

description:
Authentic Vietnamese food??? Methinks not!

I've avoided Vietnamese food in San Francisco simply because nothing could compete with the quality and cheapness of great Vietnamese food in Orange County.  I was craving a taste of my heritage, though, and decided to take a leap of faith.  Other yelp reviews brought me here for dinner...

I can sum up the entire experience with one word: YIKES.

You guys want good, authentic Vietnamese food?? I'll cook you some. Don't go here. 

First tip-off that it's not authentic: All English titles...WTF is an "imperial roll?" It's called Cha Gio, dudes...repeat: Ja? (like you're asking a question) Zaw...And who doesn't know what pho is by now?

What is this travesty they call Fish in a Clay Pot?  Where is my dark salty, spicy caramel soy sauce marinating my catfish to perfection? What is this gloopy, mushy, tangy fish with the wrong sauce that you have the balls to put in a clay pot? And you call that Shaking Beef? Please, mister. Hand me your apron - I'll show you how it's done.

And the service? I'm used to gruff service, but they way they cut you off mid-order and slammed down plates and drinks like they were at a Jewish wedding - it was just plain stressful!

The only thing I could recommend is their Vietnamese iced coffee - good, strong, and will keep you up for days in a jittery tremble over their food...
author: Sylvia N.

description:
There are two entrances to this restaurant, one at 16th St, and the other around the corner on Valencia.  If you want more of a dining experience, enter on Valencia.

For starters, definitely order the crepe.  It's like a huge taco stuffed with chicken, shrimp, and bean sprouts.  Very yummy.  And the crepe stays crunchy.

The fish cooked in the clay pot was a stand out too.  The pieces of fish were very flaky, and the taste had a slight kick to it.

I would probably skip the spring rolls.  It lack substance and flavor, and the dipping sauce didn't help.

Overall, good food for the money.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I am giving Sunflower 5 stars because they are one of the only Vietnamese restaurants around that DOES NOT USE MSG! Now I can enjoy pho in without feeling sick or inhaling a bunch of cheap preservatives. 

The food is solid, the rices are great.

Thanks Sunflower!
author: Créme d.

description: Great food, awesome price but beware of rude attitudes and abrupt service. They won't seat you until all parties are in- even if there are many seats available. Don't ask too much from them- you'll get disappointed with the surly response. Oh, the Thai iced tea is too milky.
author: Jovy G.

description: Simple, fast, satisfying. My partner loved the Shaken Beef more than I, but the greenbeans were great even as 2nd day leftovers. Awesome fresh rolls. Worth a trip.
author: Judith M.

description:
Horrible service!
BEWARE: Crazy server!
After ordering soup I informed server that we gonna order something else and asked to leave one menu, he said that he will bring menu when we are ready. After we received soup server brought us a check, I reminded him that we are going to have something else. He showed us an attitude and left. I had to catch him few times to get more water. Got check right after we order one more item. He was checking few times if we paid, which made us feel very uncomfortable. 
Check end up being $26+cents we left $30, big Taiwanese  dude started to yell that we didn't leave enough money for what he deserve. He flipped his finger, yelled and used foul language. At that moment I felt embarrassed, and almost wanted to put few more dollars, but I run out of there with red face, feeling guilty, but now I strongly regret that I didn't take change and didn't say anything back.
author: Natasha S.

description:
If it were possible to give this place a negative star, I would. 

On the positive side, I now have my own Soup Nazi experience (at least with regard to the service- not the food).

Three of us went tonight and had a reasonably enjoyable dinner (food is decent) until ~ 1/2 way through when the check appeared, delivered quite forcefully, by the waiter. I look to see if there is a line at the door; there is not, nobody is waiting in fact, so we continue to eat at what was a reasonable pace. Within a couple minutes more he is back at our table, looking to see if we had left a credit card- subtle hint. He repeats this several more times, then starts taking our not yet finished plates of food. When he asks if we are going to pay we respond 'not yet' and he starts telling the table next to us that we are not going to pay for dinner. He then starts wiping down the table while we are sitting there, one of us still legitimately finishing her meal. Although there continues to be nobody waiting for a table, he tells us that somebody is waiting for a table. When we ask who he points to a guy who just entered who appears to be waiting for take-out. When we point to the free (and set) table of two next to us, he tells us that the guy is waiting for a table of three. Uncertain as to the truth of his request, we decide to pay and leave. I suggested to my friends that we leave less than a regular tip, as our waiter had become a truly belligerent man, but they are more kind hearted  than me and said 'we shouldn't punish a man for a bad day' (if only we had a smart phone and could read fellow reviews in real time- this dude seems to only have 'bad days'). So we give him 20%. When he returns to the table he tells us that we are cheap and to get out in a voice loud enough for the adjacent table to hear. 

In true Seinfeld episode fashion, the waiter then sits the guy supposedly waiting for a three person table at the table we just vacated. The guy looks a little confused but obliges. Within ~ 5 minutes his 1 person take-out package is available, at which point it is delivered to him, and he leaves. So our table becomes available again, along with the now 4-5 other tables that have been pushed out during this time period. 

Do they not realize that this is a neighborhood place, as the food is not good enough to be a destination restaurant, and that the loss of repeat customers will mean a loss of business in the future?
author: Anne D.

description: They have one waiter there who appears a little developmentally slow, and he often brushes up against customers uncomfortably.  It's like he's brushing his genitals on strangers.  I'm surprised this place hasn't been sued already for sexual harassment.  As for the food, it's sub par.  This is my boyfriend's favorite restaurant, but I refuse to go with him anymore after the waitstaff screwed up my order and refused to fix it until I walked out of the restaurant leaving my boyfriend alone there so that I could grab a burrito around the corner.  It's pretty bad when you have to walk out of a restaurant before the staff will fix the order.
author: dAvid s.

description: I was really hoping to be wowed by this place, since I haven't had any great vietnamese food since I've been living in SF. But alas, it was just mediocre. The vegetarian selection was very small, the food was uninspiring, and the service was rushed and cold. With all the places to eat in the Mission, really no reason to settle for Sunflower.
author: Jon T.

description: Really tasty! The imperial rolls and (seafood) pho are delicious, but you already know this if you read any of the other 800+ reviews that this great little place has. There's not really anything else to say, so let's eat!
author: Gab G.

description: I have been debating whether to write this review or not.  I think its worth doing.  The people who work here are abusive and will yell at you.  I understand that its a busy restaurant on a street with a people with a lot of entitlement... but three times I had tried to eat here and had the waiters yell at me to get out of the way, or go away, or even been chased out.  I've also had them take food away before I've finished it. I think the main reason not to come here anymore is that if the waiters are this stressed out it must be a very bad place to work and we should skip it just to give them some peace.  I have reached the end of my rope with this restaurant.
author: On The R.

description:
Excellent food, outstanding service; If you've eaten there more than 2 or 3 times (& I certainly have, since this place is now a regular extension of my kitchen), the staff knows you & pretty much treats you like friends/family. 

Several great salads, the lemongrass chicken & tofu are fantastic, and the veggie imperial rolls are my favorite in the city; The veggie vietnamese pancake is positively irresistible, and the curries are basic, but delicious and very comforting winter fare; Not a huge fan of the sweet & sour soup, because it is too far on the sweet end, but that is my taste. 

Can't praise this place highly enough, oh, and did I mention imminently affordable!
author: Zee T.

description: The menu reads like a trendy Califonia Vietnamese fusion restaurant without authentic Vietnamese foods, and the food tastes fresh but the service really is lacking.  I had just finished dinner last night and was waiting to pay and the waiter was "offering" additional menu items, kept checking to see if we had paid and  he finally just told us to leave because he needed the table.  I saw only 2 people waiting and at least 2 open tables that had not been cleared.  Hardly a relaxing dinner, more like a eat and run.  I've never been kicked out of a restaurant before much less within 10 minutes of a plate clearing.  If you're hungry, this is one step up from fast food.  If you want a pleasant dining experience, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!
author: Eileen L.

description:
Wow, this was SUPER salty. I felt so sick after that I could not even look at the massive jar of leftover soup I had in the fringe. Even writing this review I want to cringe.

I am not sure how I feel about this place. Maybe I will try again but drink more water to avoid the upset stomach because the food was pretty decent, as was the thai iced tea!!!
author: Caitlin H.

description: Very good food and very good value.  I had the amazing garlic noodles--tasty! My friend had the vegetarian pho--yummy.  Portions are generous and prices are low. Nice place and packed at lunch on a Wednesday.
author: Osama B.

description: A hole in the wall place in the Mission, which generally implies good food. however, the food was disappointing and very bland- ordered the five spiced chicken and vermicelli. The spiced chicken had no spice, or flavor at all. The imperial rolls were pretty tasteless as well. I wouldn't  venture back here.
author: Romita J.

description:
This is for the restaurant on Valencia St.  Yes, a crazy server.  Maybe he's having a bad week given the review Natasha wrote.

A friend and I went in because I have enjoyed the food here in the past.  It wasn't busy. We sat down and within the first 5 minutes of our stay, the server came by three times to take our order.  The first time, we politely let him know we hadn't had a chance to look at the menu, the second time that we weren't ready.  The third time he came, after we had ordered drinks, he turned around and yelled something like 'if you're not going to order, you can get out'.  We thought he was joking.  

When our drinks didn't come, and we spent the next 10 minutes trying to get his attention, we started to get the picture.  I waved my hand at him while we walked by and he literally yelled at me.  'I don't answer to the hand!  I'm not serving you!'.  Really?  Needless to say, we left and found a delightful Indian restaurant across the street.

I guess you can't piss off the Queen, or you can't eat there.
author: Shanna L.

description: Yum yum yum. Garlic Noodles w/ Chicken is 2 meals at minimum for a man with a huge appetite. Wish I could visit again but alas, I was only in San Francisco to pay homage to the 49ers. :(
author: Michael T.

description:
I've been coming here for quite some time. I would eat there every day if I could.
Ambiance is a big 0 - Unless you're one of those people who thinks Mission Shabby is chic. But the food - Wow!
author: Pandora B.

description:
Mediocre food and cold service.

Our server was visibly irritated by being asked to repeat something he'd said. At first I assumed that he was just offended. He had no way of knowing that my dining companion has a degree in linguistics and knows a bunch of languages and it wasn't a "you better be speaking english" thing. After a few more similar interactions, I realized that the guy was just twitching with impatience. Asking him any question whatsoever would delay his departure. 

My lemongrass tofu was bland and unexciting. Crepe-y veggie pancake was better but still nothing amazing. Large portions.
author: Kimberley D.

description: Second time coming here. I love this spot -- super no frills but with great food/filling portions. Very accommodating to vegetarians.
author: Whitney W.

description:
If you REALLY want Vietnamese food, you're in the mission and are too starving to go elsewhere, and you want to spend around $10-$12 for your meal, this place fits the bill. The food is decent. Nothing special, and in any other situation I wouldn't choose Sunflower, but it's not bad. The portions are fairly large, they have a wide range of options, and it's decently tasty. Generally I would go elsewhere for Vietnamese though, specifically anywhere in the Sunset, Richmond, or Tenderloin. 

Be aware that there are two locations; one on Valencia and one on 16th. The one of Valencia is larger and has more atmosphere.
author: Talia G.

description:
(About the Valencia Street location) 

I can't believe what just happened during my visit to this restaurant this evening.  I've never experienced anything like this in a restaurant in my entire life.  My aunt and I came here to for dinner as well as to catch up - haven't seen her in a year or so.  

Everything was normal for a Vietnamese restaurant except for the fact that the place is run by Chinese people - a little unusual but no problem.  We ordered our food and enjoyed it - the food was fine.  The first problems came when they kept trying to grab my food and drink before I was done with it.  Then, I didn't have a chance to look at the bill and he kept trying to grab it, saying Thaaaaank yooooou, thaaaaaank yooooou - really annoying.  It was apparent that they were trying to usher us out as fast as possible.

I decided to take my time finishing my drink.  They kept asking me if I wanted anything else, suggesting if I was done I should get out.  I said no and that I would appreciate if they would back off.  Pretty soon our server lost his patience with me and started yelling at me at the top of his lungs, making the entire restaurant go silent.  THIS ISN'T A FIVE STAR HOTEL!  YOU BEEN HERE FOR 2 HOUR!  (I wasn't there for even 45 minutes) Among other things - he was seriously yelling at me for what felt like 5 minutes.   

Imagine that - a restaurant full of people went completely silent while I was getting chewed out by my server.

I told him that he's got some serious problems and that I wanted to talk to his manager.  He calls someone and hands me the phone after yelling into it for a few minutes and I talk to this man named "Danny."  While I am trying to talk to the manager, Danny - they are trying to get me to stretch the phone cord into the dining room and talk to the manager in there.  I refused.  An old guy starts tapping me on the shoulder really hard and I turned around and told him to "go ahead and touch me one more time."  I decided at that time it was time to leave.

I managed to get "Danny's" phone number before I left and I spoke with him afterward when I was walking on the sidewalk.  He tried his best to be accommodating, saying that he was going to talk to the server that treated me like that and he offered to treat me at one of his other restaurants.  But I have the feeling from talking to him it's all just lip service.  I don't think it's all that bad in Chinese culture to treat a customer like that - maybe I'm wrong.

I should have simply left early on when I recognized that he was trying to expedite me out of the restaurant before the problems started happening.  I am just left with the shock and embarrassment of that situation and the fact that my aunt, whom I haven't seen in a while had to go through that as well.  

I guess their business does so well in that location that they can afford to treat people like that.
author: Nathan V.

description:
Great Garlic Noodles and amazing Verm bowl.   

The restaurant has a great staff and is in the heart of the mission.  I have been there 5 or 6 times now and have walked out happy and full every time.
author: Rob S.

description:
I came here for a bday party but only drank wine, which was at least a half bottle for $8 (a full carafe elsewhere, posing as a half-carafe here).  SHWING!  

I've got it bookmarked to go back to eat, so I'll write an update.  Everyone's dishes looked and smelled awesome.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I must have gotten the wrong thing. My 5 spice vermaccelli was terrible. Well it was a holiday, maybe its better other nights.
author: Derek L.

description:
I'm a fan of the culture in the Mission District. When I was told we were getting Vietnamese food, I expected something like Pho, Banh Mi, or something else I could repeat in some Vietnamese accent (no offense intended)

When we stopped by here, it was a dark restaurant that was pretty bumpin, not too bad. But we got a table pretty quickly. I looked on the menu and saw that there was no pho! This actually wasn't a Pho restaurant like most of the Vietnamese places I've gone to in Oakland! But when we ordered, I was really surprised with the food they served us!

We ordered the Seabass, which came out first and quickly, a Crab/Corn/Egg soup, the Garlic Noodles, and Tofu with Green Beans. I have to say, everything we ordered was pretty delicious! I had a delicious and tasty experience here and I absolutely enjoyed everything they had!

Not only that, I enjoyed a Thai Iced Tea, which I was a huge slut for, like always.

For my first time here, I have to say it was pretty great! I just wish it was a little bit bigger and had more space to walk around and that the bathroom wasn't so dirty.
author: Johnny C.

description:
I love Vietnamese food, but usually go to a hole-in-the-wall kind of places, so for me going to Sunflower was a completely new experience. Fortunately there were five of us sharing the food family style so we were able to try lots of dishes.
Imperial rolls were super good, but we didn't like Spring rolls to much - they were super big but really lacking in flavor. Shaken beef is a must to order - super yummy and flavorful.

All the food we ordered was good, what we really didn't like is our waiters' attitude. The service was really bad both from our waiter and another one who was also helping us. Our waiter kept rudely rushing us while we were ordering and was calling everybody "young man" or "young woman", I suppose he thought it's cute and funny, but it was coming of as if he was talking down to us.

All in all it's more like 4 stars for food, 2 for the service - too bad Yelp doesn't allow you to separate them.
author: Ata N.

description:
We just finished eating at Bi Rite and started wandering around the Mission looking for a nice place for dinner. (Yes...we had dessert first but that's another story.) As we headed up 16th, we stumbled upon this restaurant that seemed to just blend in with its surroundings.

Walking in, I thought to myself, "Wow, this place is dark." Not dark as in the Dark Knight nor dark as in pure evil, but rather the low light feeling that one may find in a lounge. Not that it was a bad thing. People were all talking at a normal volume, chatting freely among themselves. 

After browsing, the menu, my eye's attention was caught by "Garlic Noodles." After consulting with my friend's Yelp app which highlighted the dish as a popular review item, I was committed. After the first bite, I was quite pleased. I love garlic so obviously combining it with noodles was a no brainer. Yet, as I kept taking bite after bite, I found the dish to become a bit bland. After all, it was just noodles and chicken. No vegetables or anything. Not even something simple like bean sprouts. If I come back, I would recommend going with mixed vegetables for some variety.

The Imperial Rolls starter dish was okay. The deep fried wrap was a bit too chewy for me on the ends (too much wrap?). The innards were so so. Overall, not a standout dish for this place.

During our meal, a couple at an adjacent table were bickering and one ended up throwing a napkin at the other. It missed and hit an innocent bystander. Long story short, the waiter (apparently infamous according to Yelp reviews) got upset and threw them out, calling them "stupid" among other things. While not very classy, he seemed pretty apologetic to the "victims" of the napkin throwing.

Upon further observation, I really noticed how rude the waiter was. I'm accustomed to rude service, growing up in an Asian culture. Nevertheless, I can understand from an American standpoint how rude he was being. Personally, I do not like it either but I tend to just brush it off.

Overall, the food is pretty good. Good size portion food but the service forces me to drop my rating down by one star.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I LOVE Sunflower! Whether it's the little cafe on 16th Street, or the full-on restaurant on Valencia (yes there are 2 Sunflowers!), they both serve up some of the best Vietnamese food ever. There are lots of vegetarian (as well as meat) options. 

I especially love the Banh Xeo - a vegetarian Vietnamese crepe, which you wrap with tofu, bean sprouts, mint leaves, and grated carrots inside lettuce leaves -- it's crisp, filling, and really refreshing! Also, their Sunflower Prawns are an all-time favorite. There's nothing like them anywhere: Sweet and spicy sauce with garlic noodles and big prawns. Delicious! 

Prices are cheap.  You can easily eat a full meal at lunch for under $7.00. Or, get a large lunch for $7.95 - which includes entree, soup, spring roll, and salad! It's a bang for the buck! 

Parking is admittedly difficult in the Mission, so it's best to walk, if you can. Service is friendly and quick. They do offer take-out but no delivery, and you can choose whether you want their casual cafe or their more attentive restaurant (on Valencia Street).

Sunflower is one of my favorite restaurants in SF!
author: Heather S.

description:
Went to this restaurant with my girlfriend after having a craving for pho.  

The service here was excellent, but the pho here was decent.  My Gf ordered the chicken pho with vegetables and as many of you know pho is all about the Broth!  Needless to say it was a lil bland and watery, but I must say the steamed vegetables added were fantastic.  

We ordered some chicken spring rolls that were amazing and the food people were eating around us looked great as well.

In conclusion, if you are going here for anything other than Pho, this is the spot, but if you are going to be a Vietnamese restaurant(especially in San Fran), you gotta have Good PHO!

-Ryan
author: Ryan S.

description:
I've tried other places and nothing can compare to Sunflower yet. 

The Pho is delicious here if you're in the mood for soup.  My favorite dish that i keep coming back to is definitely the Chicken garlic noodles! I like to add the veggies to the order and yum its just sooo good together! It's cooked just right & the chicken is chopped up for you in ready to eat pieces.

The imperial rolls are great here also.  They are crispy and not greasy! The side of vermicelli noodles and carrots they give you is perfect if you want a quick appetizer.  

If you're not too hungry you could probably split 2 plates with your dining partner or if you're dining solo you could take it to go. 

I would definitely recommend eating the food here.  You will like it! The only thing i don't care for is that the restaurant is kinda small & some of the servers are dry and not too friendly but the service is always fast. besides I don't go to Sunflower to socialize w the servers, i'm there to eat.  LOL!
author: Cryss S.

description: Five-star food, one-star service. No matter how delicious my spicy green beans and catfish clay pot were, the server's 12 attempts to get us to leave before we'd finished even half our food were a real downer.
author: kimberley s.

description: Hands down best pho! I never tasted this good of broth for pho. The imperial roll aka pork egg rolls are the best. I know a lot of ppl including myself don't like pork but this was different. It's so yummy. It taste like chicken   eggrolls. Only problem with coming to eat here is that the parking sucks. Also you can Togo their food and it still taste good.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Went there for lunch, the wait was abt 15mins. Everything looks yummy by just looking around the table. Highly recommend to ppl who haven't been there.
author: Jeannie Y.

description: When I came here I was not too hungry from all the water I just drank. We had the combo appetizer and the beef pho. The combo comes with imperial rolls and they were very good. They seem to be like deep fried on the outside and it had meat inside. One of the best fried rolls I've had. Along with that, there comes the traditional rolls where you get all the ingredients and you make it yourself. Once again the rolls were very good and I want to say the beef was flavored more than other places, but it is roughly as good as everywhere's. I was full after my half, which is 2 halves of the imperial roll and 5 spring rolls that I made. The beef pho tasted sweet a bit sweeter than I like. It was the first time the base was sweet to me. You did get a decent amount of beef in the pho, but the slices were relatively thick. Overall the pho wasn't that great, but the rolls were very good and filling. Would just get that the next time I come back.
author: Victor D.

description:
The food is good (they have vegan pho), but the service really stunk. Maybe it was just an off-day, but man, the place wasn't even half full and it took close to 30 minutes to get my food and well, the waiter was really huffy (not just with me, but with the tables around me - I couldn't even count the numerous expressions of "wtf" on people's faces - literally, the table next to me asked to split the check and before they could even finish their sentence, the waiter had walked off). 

I know being in customer service is hard, especially during the holidays, but this was uncalled for. I can find food that is just as good, but without the attitude elsewhere. However, I will give it another chance, since we all do have our off-days.
author: Leslie T.

description: Just for the vermicelli 5 spice chicken with imperial roll-- it was very good, the chicken tasted awesome and tender, the imperial rolls were hot and crispy. 9$ seemed a bit pricey though considering the setting
author: Vicky H.

description:
I tend to eat at places within a three block radius of my work.  Thankfully, Sunflower is within my guidelines, because they offer  pretty decent Vietnamese, good service, and a reasonable price.  

I say good service because occasionally they forget to fill your water.  Or smile.  Generally speaking though, they'll take care of you quickly and efficiently.  

Things to eat here:  Garlic noodles.  One of their specialties.  Tasty.
Pho: Hard to go wrong here.  Giant bowl, all the fixings.
Lunch specials:  lemongrass chicken lunch special, glad you exist.  Comes with soup, spring roll, rice, and chicken.  All around eight dollars.  
If you're looking for good lunch, and don't care too much for smiles, Sunflower's your place.
author: Corey H.

description:
I've never experienced anything like what happened at Sunflower last night.  There seem to be quite a few posts already demonstrating the unfathomably rude behavior of their server, so I'm just going to give the bullet points of what we endured last night:

-Completely rude and dismissive service from the moment we walked in.  Felt totally ignored and unwelcome from the start.

-My boyfriend threw up his garlic noodles within ten minutes of eating.  I'll admit he wasn't feeling well to begin with, but that's still not a great sign.

-When my friend asked to split the check in two, the waiter refused without any indication of apology, blaming us, and yelling at us to do it his way.  

-My friend ending up paying for the whole bill on her card.  We were trying to work out how much cash we were going to pay her and what to leave for tip, when the waiter comes back to yell at us about there not being enough tip out on the table.  We had only had a minute with the receipt and were by no means ready to return the leather folder with the cash tip we were planning to leave,  when he rudely interrupted demanding a better tip.  We were fully planning on tipping him, despite his previous rude behavior, but once that happened I decided to leave the crappy tip as is instead of adding more to the pile.  Why would I reward such behavior with gratuity?  Had he not come to interrupt what we were doing to demand more money, he would have received a decent (and probably undeserved tip), but coming over before we were even settled to make a scene is just bizarre. 

-At this point we stood up to leave, hoping to leave this strange dining experience behind us, when the waiter begins screaming at us, causing the whole restaurant to take notice, and trying to make it sound as if we didn't pay our bill.  In reality, our bill had been paid, and he was simply infuriated at receiving a tip commensurate to his horrible service.   As we got up, he pulled out his cellphone and put it right up in my friend's face, telling her he's going to take her picture!  She had to push herself past him to even get out of the restaurant.  I'm just glad he didn't try to do that to me, because I would have knocked it right out of his hand.  Who in their right mind would do such a thing and cause such a scene in their place of business?  This waiter was at the verge of violence over a crappy tip---which would have been a standard tip, had he not rudely interrupted us while we were working out our payment.

-At this point, I regret leaving any tip behind.  This person clearly doesn't understand what it means to treat customers with respect or to give good service.  Gratuity is based on service, and is not mandatory.  His actions were inexcusable.  I work in the service industry and was fully planning on tipping him until he began to make a scene.  There have been plenty of times where I've given excellent customer service and not been rewarded with even a standard tip, but I would never accost and publicly humiliate guests, thrusting my phone in their faces, and threaten to photograph them.  The whole thing was just absurd.
author: Alicia J.

description:
Rotten food, then public humiliation for mentioning it.

It is hard for me to write this review because we have been loyal customers for five years. My sister had her first date with her husband here and they come at least once a month and recommend the place to everyone they know. But after today, we are tempted to call the health department, not only write this review.

I ordered a veggie salad with tofu. I took a bite of the tofu early on and it tasted off, but I continued to pick around the tofu thinking that it was just a bad taste and I didn't want to complain. Taking a bite from another piece, I had to spit it out. It was rotten, and made me want to vomit the same way a rotten piece of cheese would. I felt sick and realized I should say something.

We called the waiter over and said the tofu was rotten. They said that no one else has complained and I just insisted they take the food away. To their credit, they asked if we wanted to exchange but I was too sick to want anything else. They charged us for the salad and we weren't comfortable paying for rotten food. I had eaten about half of the cabbage in the bowl when we sent it back. My sister went back and calmly asked about the charge, hoping that they might consider not charging us for food that was clearly rotten. Instead of calmly saying that they can't cancel or whatever their reason was, the waiter (whom my sister adored for being a very flamboyant character) started yelling at her. I listened for about thirty seconds to him yelling. She came back and said that they are charging us and I handed her the money for the salad, sad that they would do that. I wish it stopped there.

The same waiter then walked around the restaurant pointing us out to customers saying that we ate it all and then didn't want to pay. Then they brought out the bowl to show us that I had eaten the whole thing. They had clearly taken out the rest of the vegetables to make it look like I had eaten more, continued to rant that we had eaten the whole thing and didn't want to pay. The other customers looked confused. We calmly talked to another waiter explaining that we would never scam them and could not believe that they were treating loyal customers that way. As we calmly talked to one waiter, the other carried on to the other customer. The one we were talking to tried to calm him. The calm one also continued to say that no one else complained, we just said how sorry we were that they would dare treat customers, and loyal customers, this way, trying to humiliate us in front of the restaurant for mentioning that there was rotten tofu. We paid for the salad anyways (to make a point, but that was probably pointless), so disgusted and sad that we will never go back and do not want anyone else to patronize the place.
author: Jamie R.

description:
It wasn't like the best pho, but it was good. It was... okay. The broth was nice and sweet in their pho. I had the vermicelli with beef and asked to add shrimp to that dish... waiter said.."why not?" YES! he gets cool points for that...  lol he was very flexible and very nice. I was fairly happy with our service, and I believe we came at a time when the dinner rush starts because when we finally sat down there was no longer a wait to sit. And don't order the appetizer platter thing if you're going to get a vermicelli meal thing because it's the exact same thing only one is on a plate and the other one is in a bowl... 

To be honest, I think I am just way too used to San Jose Vietnamese pho restaurants because this place had 4 options for pho...chicken, beef, vegetarian or seafood... and they didn't have any 3 bean/ jelly drink or any hard core Vietnamese drinks..it was like intro to Vietnamese food.....if I'm in the area I'll stop by again.
author: Clara H.

description:
I'll keep this simple. This place is awesome! The food is cheap and the portions are large! I love the spring rolls and the lemon grass chicken here. Add some fish sauce to dip those in, and you're all set! :D

The wait staff is super friendly and fast. The only drawback about this place is how crowded it gets during dinner service, but it's well worth the wait!
author: Ty L.

description:
Sunflower is nothing more than a convenience, its near 16th Mission Bart.. their food is not impressive, it is very standard and over seasoned Vietnamese food.  

Service is terrible, they obviously are trying to get people in and out very fast.  I have never been rushed so hard to eat and get out.  First they almost kicked us out for taking too long to order food and then had the nerve to give us our check while we were still eating.  It was a busy friday but we got there at 5pm and the place had several empty tables.  

Another group promptly left when they saw the service we got, rather not experience it themselves they chose to leave.  Two more couples did the same through our meal.  

I wonder how they stay in business!  I just think they thrive on all the clueless folks visiting the Mission or passing throug. 

DO not eat here.  do not patronize this place.
author: Sharif R.

description:
Meh...

This seems to be everyone's go-to spot for Vietnamese in this area, but as many times as I've eaten there, I still don't get it. The vegetarian options are bland and the meat I've had there is gross. I hate to bad mouth it, but I know it'll do just fine (my friends love it!). Give me Thanh Tam II across the street on Valencia any day; it's just as cheap, but the food is better, it's less busy, and it's not as sketchy.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
The garlic noodles were amazing! My friends said it was a must have and I will def come back just for these noodles! Also had the tofu egg rolls which were tasty.

Place is a bit small and we couldn't get seated until our entire party arrived which was lame. I give it a 4 for the garlic noodles!
author: Karen L.

description:
All I can say is that you had better leave AT LEAST a 15% tip when eating here, otherwise look forward to getting cursed at by an angry waiter/owner as you're walking towards the door.  No matter that the full restaurant is watching while this occurs, he has no shame.  Or maybe he was trying to shame us?  Didn't work.

Do not even think of doubling the tax and rounding down to an even number, when figuring out the bill.  In fact, to play it safe, I'd suggest you bring along a calculator to make sure you're exactly at 15% and not a penny below.

Oh, and the noodles were greasy and the chicken was so full of gristle I couldn't take more than a couple bites.   Service?  Not that great.  

Authentic Vietnamese?  I don't think so.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Do you have a place where everyone knows your name? No it's not cheers. And no, not everyone knows my name here but if I call and give my take out order to the guy with the ponytail whose usually answering the phone anyways, he knows its for me. Some might find it creepy but I find it somewhat satisfying. If I've called and gotten take out from you more than once a week on a semi regular basis, the least you could do is bother to remember my voice and maybe my order so that we don't have to go over this charade like we don't really know each other. Remember that episode in Sex in the City when Miranda is embarrassed the Chinese lady knows her order and giggles at the end of each call? I would be proud and even be as bold to go and ask them to throw in an extra fortune cookie or two. 

What's all this blah blah without any review on the food? I like the garlic noodles, I add chicken. I usually order the pho with chicken or the vermicelli noodles with chicken and imperial rolls. The portions are humongous so I can usually save half or 2/3rds for future meals.
author: Sandy H.

description: Been here twice and both times've found the food to be a bit heavy, greasy & blunt. I'll keep looking for better Vietnamese.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Stumbled upon this restaurant at 10:30PM after grabbing some drinks with some people at Zeitgeist.  Was feeling Pho but ended up ordering Cold Vermicelli Noodles with Chicken, Shaking Beef and Garlic Noodles.

Garlic noodles came out better than expected.  First place I've been to that cooks their garlic noodles with eggs.  Eggs, garlic and noodles?  Three of my favorite things!  My favorite dish already!

I've never had shaking beef before, but I know it's a very famous Vietnamese dish, so I knew this would be an opportunity to try it with everyone.  Garlicky and tasty, but a bit too salty for me - went great with steamed rice.  Vermicelli tasted mediocre, but there was a generous amount of chicken, which was grilled to perfection. 

Boyfriend ordered a big bottle of Tsjng Tao (Chinese beer) and it was a perfect pairing with the food.  

Had a good experience with food but I think it was closing time when we reached to the end of or meal, so a guy came out from the kitchen and started kicking us out.  Whaaaaat? Crazy! Didn't want to deal with it so we hurried up and left.

Good food and bad service.  Funny memory though.
author: Nancy S.

description:
I love sunflower. i admit it. the lunch special is a great deal; a lot of food and a nice variety, what with the portions of imperial roll (fried and delicious), the hot and sour soup, rice, cabbage stuff. i get the lemongrass tofu, and always brown rice. the brown rice here is so good, it's really dark, almost purple, and nutty. i am also a fan of the vermicelli and the vegetable noodle soup, which is enormous and has a ton of vegetables in it. the hot and sour soup is good but doesn't have noodles. it does however have pineapple. the vietnamese crepe is also great. it's an appetizer but it's huge. you can get it with chicken and shrimp or vegetarian. it's like this big omelette type thing stuffed with bean sprouts and served with big pieces of lettuce.

yeah, the service can be brusque, even outright rude, but you just gotta take it in stride. this is sunflower. it gets hectic. you are in sunflower's realm, so get it together. don't be surprised if the check is indecipherable (at least english-wise). remember how much your thing cost if you're going to be splitting the check with friends. and they won't split it up on two different cards. you can pay on your card, and have your friends give you cash. or figure something else out. it's not sunflower's problem.
author: Kate F.

description:
We, sadly, chose to go to Sunflower even though the reviews were pointing towards disaster. The room itself is a dump. Poorly lit, uncomfortable and dirty. The server was rude. The order was put in wrong and came out wrong. They managed to screw up Bun Cha Thit Neung. The lettuce was lukewarm and wilting. The entire point of the dish is to showcase the contrasts in the cool versus warm components. There was no crispness in it. The prawns were overcooked and lacked any punch and the bbq pork was cold.

Lukewarm bun cha...yuk.

The cafe sua da was ok.
author: Paul K.

description:
Good middle of the road Vietnamese food. It's not meant to be a **** star restaurant, it's meant to be good, clean, inexpensive food. And it is - consistently. We eat here often when looking for a meal that is economical, tasty, has nice cold shrimp rolls with peanut sauce and a curry or two.

Again, this isn't a **** restaurant but it is a really good place to get good food. So, set your expectations, and go eat there.

Yum!
author: Mark M.

description:
the food is pretty good. But only go here if you're willing to be treated like crap.

On one particular visit, the service was beyond bad. They forgot everything that could have been forgotten. Including one person's entire meal.

They later brought that meal in a to go bag, blaming the chef for the mistake (who cares?). They tried to charge full price for the meal including that item, before I complained.

Not once was the word "sorry" every spoken by the staff.

*sigh* cheap food that comes with cheap service.
author: Sachin A.

description: I really love this place. The food is just delicious and it's one of the places both my husband and I can get something we find super tasty. It's definitely authentic.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Imperial rolls - Crispy, bubbly wrap. Freshly made wrapper, perhaps? Very good. I could eat lots and lots (and lots) of these.

Garlic noodles - I forgot to ask for shrimp, but it was good with just the egg. Not overwhelmingly garlicky, but enough to make you want to keep eating more and more.

Lemongrass Chicken - Ah, I don't remember what this tasted like, except that it was good but I liked the noodles better.

Service is typical of a small Asian restaurant. As in, attentive enough to get your food but don't expect much (why would you? you are here to eat) because it's a busy.
author: Amy N.

description:
Always love this restaurant.  My recent meal there made me feel like heaven again!

The Crepe with shrimp, pork and bean sprout was so delish with fresh vegetable and dipping sauce.  The steamed Chilean Sea Bass was to die for.  The sauteed Calamari dish was so wonderful.  My out of town guest was so impressed.  I really love the casual setting of its small dinning room which is connected to the kitchen. 

The service was very attentive and wonderful.

I love my Sunflower Restaurant!!!
author: Sunny H.

description: A small place with good food. I like how they have a clay hot pot--tough to find that.
author: Paul K.

description: It's been awhile since I have been to Sunflower so when a friend visiting from out of town wuz in the mood for Vietnamese I suggested we hit the Mission and check out my favorite spot for Garlic Eggplant.  Happy to report he is now a big fan too!  Love the food, service and the funky clientele.  Wuz pleased to know the quality of the food remains tastefully delicious!
author: Chrys-Anthony B.

description:
As a vegetarian and a huge fan of Pho, I'm often left out of delicious Vietnamese nights, as so often, everything is meaty, or has meat/fish broth.

Not here -- I felt at home, although it was a bit toasty while I was there. I had a giant bowl of soup, and honestly, it was one of THE best bowls of vegetarian Pho I have ever had. Ever. It took me almost an hour, but I killed the entire soup, because I didn't know when I was going to have another bowl of soup this delicious.

I highly recommend this to vegetarians and meat eaters alike. My friend enjoyed a chicken dish, as much as I enjoyed my veggie one, and both of us were full and satisfied for a very reasonable price at the end of the night.
author: Shanna K.

description:
The portions are huge.  I ordered the chicken rolls and the five spices chicken.  The rolls may as well have been an entree.  When they brought out the the five spices chicken, I wondered how I was going to manage to finish it.  Most in my party could not finish their meals.  Now, while the portions were more than generous, it was not the best Vietnamese food I've had.  However, it was better than any I've had in NYC.

Our waitress was pleasant.  The place is tiny; it has only about 8 tables.
author: Francisco H.

description:
The service is terrible.  They made me sit in a chair until my friend arrived to get a table when there were three open. 

Avoid.
author: Jordan S.

description:
I've been hearing so much about this place so I thought I try this for lunch.  I went through the 16th street entrance to the more "hole in the wall" side (if you didn't know, there's another entrance on the Valencia side).  

I ordered the imperial rolls and the typical beef pho.  The egg rolls were refried as I was watching them refry them.  It is typical but I could tell that it was not that fresh and at some points, I could feel hard pieces of dough.  The pho was okay, not too great.  It was a clean broth but I have had better.

Service is typical, wasn't expecting anything more; price was decent.

I've had better in the city.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Nothing spectacular. I ate here a couple of times for lunch and the pho was alright. I thought it didn't have enough beef in it, but that's just me. Looks like an expensive dining place with a line coming out the door at night, but I just don't see the appeal of this place. Whatever.


Update: 9/6/07

These douchebags brought back the check when I only put $1 on the tip. The waiter grunted something and pointed to it with the pen. I just sat their with the person I ate with in shock. I've never been to a restaurant that begs for more tip. Eat at Mai's or Tu Lan. Eff this place.
author: Gerard Y.

description: I discovered PHO in 2009 from a friend when I went to Seattle now I have found a place in my home town.... Sunflower if you come hungry and order Pho you will definitely leave full so what can i say.  The noodle soup is good for the soul it has mint and I do like mine spicy. When you will be greeted within seconds and if they are crowed go around the corner  it is connected by the kitchen to the 16th street  location small and cozy after 6 there maybe a line so try to come earlier.  Price will not leave you feeling like you spent anything only $6-7 to leave full and the fresh bean sprouts and mint with live do so good, I suggest it a must to experience and leave full.
author: RICHARD J.

description:
I just had a coworker ask me for a good Pho place. I recommended Sunflower, of course. Then I went to Yelp and realized I hadn't done a review for Sunflower!!??? wtf. 

So, here I am busting it out a review while I wait for TechSupport calls to come in. 

I've been here probably 5 or 6 times. It is by far my favorite place for Pho in San Francsico. I haven't been to a ton of places, but once you find a place you love, that is cheap and worthy, why keep looking? Amiright? Yes I am.

There is only one thing really negative I could say about Sunflower and that is the location. I hate going there because parking sucks big hairy Mission Rat balls. I've driven around for about 45 minutes before and ended up calling in the order to go and had my lady go grab it. But is that their fault? no. It's just annoying. 

So, here is what I've tried:

Imperial Rolls - Amazing, crispy and yummy way to start out a meal
Vietnamese Pot Stickers - These look like little sea urchins, but they are balls of joy. Put them in your mouths. 
Beef Noodle Soup - Amazing, perfect and amazing. 
Chicken Noodle Soup - Amazing perfect and amazing. 

I don't eat much else when I go out for Pho. I go for the noodle soup. They are big huge bowls and the dining experience is cozy and hole in the wall. Don't lick the floor or the walls and you'll be okay. 

I love this place. I am very pleased every time I go there and I want to go there now. But we bought ravioli so we are having that tonight. 

***SAD TROMBONE***

If you are looking for a nice hole in the wall style place with yummy Pho, go here. Don't be a snob. Get some good soup though.

I gave them a 4 because it's a favorite of mine and they always live up to my expectations.
author: Mack L.

description:
I was looking for a good Vietnamese restaurant  in town for the four of us and a friend advised me to go to Sunflower. This was by far my worst restaurant experience of whole time. Food was already not that good but the worst was the service: despicable. I'll pass on the sitting, the way they gave us our forks and knives agressively straight in our faces... While eating our appetizers, they came with our entrees which I sent back because obviously we were still eating our appetizers and above this there was no room on the table for extra plates. In the middle of the entrees ( which were first not what we ordered) we received the check... I know it's usually fast in the US but i can't get used being rushed this way. We asked for doggy bags and received embty boxes we had to fill ourselves.. Maybe it's not the only place where you have to do it yourself but I find it's kind of gross and not what you should expect from place which wants to offer good service.

We finally looked at the bill and saw that an arbitrary gratuity of about 18,6% had been pre-added. I went to see the waiter saying he could not decide for us which tip to add... He answered it was for big parties and I answered it was for parties of 6 or more not 4. He became agressive and crossed out the written tip amount... I'm pretty sure he did that thinking we were tourists and wouldn't dare say a thing... Bad luck for him, I've been here for a while and hate when waiters try to abuse me because i'm not a native english speaker.

We gave the baddest tip I've ever given, about 5%... After they came 4 times to take the bill and l said we were not ready, he finally took it from my hands, openened, counted and said: "what is that? 85$ bill and you give me 90$?" i said that the service was terrible... He answered, yelling at me in front of all other clients, that I was the worst client he had had in 25 years!!! They took the glasses from our hands and we had to leave because didn't feel so safe with all waiters staring at us...

This guy has serious anger management issues and should have stayed calm, maybe ask us calmly what went wrong, but no, he litteraly screamed at me in front of everybody! Never seen such thing in my entire life... Tips should be earned, and people respected.
author: Emilie M.

description:
You don't need to go here.  My most immediate reason for disliking this place almost certainly won't apply to you, but here it is, anyway: a boorish British kid, sensitive, right, but with a bit of chav edge, who wouldn't shut the fuck up about the worst (only, he said it, "wuhhhhhhst") places to book shows in the UK ("Don't even get me started on Luton, right.").  And for some reason, he was seated right on my wife's elbow, so that she had to contort her body to cut her food.  Is there really anyone out there who goes to a restaurant in the hopes that an insufferable British parrot will alight on his shoulder?

Oh, but the food.  It wasn't that special.  Heavy brown sauce "Vietnamese" where quantity and staff obsequy are the apparent compensations for kitchen mediocrity.  The seafood was, however, fresh.  

You might be happy if you found this place in a strip mall in Kansas.  Here, though?  It seems to be the kind of place where Chinese entrepreneurs (the same type who realized that the name "A-1 Buffet" would put them out front in the Yellow Pages) realized they could cook cheap, sloppy food and charge $2 more a plate to call it "Vietnamese" instead of "Chinese."
author: John B.

description:
Holy shit, batman!

You mean they have quality pho in San Francisco right here in the Mission??? Yes sir, they most definitely do.

Sunflower is one of the few pho restaurants that would give the Seattle chain Than Bros. a good run for its money. And Sunflower wins hands down because their service is impeccable, unlike the legendary and lightning-fast bitchiness to be found at Than Bros.

Start with the shrimp fresh rolls, they are some of the best I've tasted. Big portions and served with a delicious peanut sauce.

The broth is amazing, rich and flavorful (esp. with a dash of sriracha). Be sure to get the extra veggies for $1, you'll be glad you did! All of this + Vietnamese-style iced coffee = AWESOMENESS! What are you waiting for?

Please note: this place is a hole-in-the-wall that is sure to be full at the precise moment your hangover kicks in full force. Plan accordingly
author: David P.

description:
Sunflower is a go-to spot for my co-workers and me.  The veggie pho is the best I have tried and the lunch special  is enough to safe half for dinner later.  I have liked everything on the menu that I have tried, but lately my favorite is the chicken salad.

Go in, get a fresh coconut and enjoy!
author: Laura P.

description: Been looking for good Vietnamese Restaurants around the city. Had the  lemongrass chicken lunch combo plate and the BBQ pork vermicelli with imperial rolls. My favorite place for BBQ pork vermicelli has always been Tu Lan but this place comes real close. Their imperial rolls also battle Tu Lan's. The Lemon grass chicken lunch combo was good and the portions were grate without charging too much.
author: DJ Madison H.

description:
Being 100% Vietnamese, I was a little apprehensive about the Vietnamese food in the Mission. Raised in San Jose, CA, I had my fair share of great Vietnamese joints and my mother is a great Vietnamese cook. 

I was craving some BBQ beef and egg roll vermicelli with fish sauce so I decided to give Sunflower a try and got it to go (FYI, I judge Vietnamese restaurants on the quality of their egg rolls). 

YES! finally some decent egg rolls! They were crunchy, chewy, and great tasting. The beef was a little dry but the marinade was good. Their fish sauce had a good salty and sweet flavor. 

So is this the best Vietnamese restaurant I've been to? NO! But is it good enough for my Viet food cravings? YES!
author: Hong N.

description:
The food here is okay, not fabulous, but the service is pretty good, the space can accomodate larger parties, and the location is convenient to all sorts of other things to do when out and about in the Mission.

GARLIC ALERT:  If you're allergic to garlic, you're going to find eating here to be quite a challenge.  You've probably noticed in the other reviews for Sunflower that people mention loving various dishes that have the word "garlic" right in their title.  So, be forewarned!  As a result of my own garlic allergy, I pretty much don't come here anymore...but won't begrudge them their 3 stars, because to me, good service and a courteous staff are sometimes even more important than the food!
author: Amy L.

description:
Totally bummed , ordered Beef noodle soup to go , got home the noodle box was literally 1/4 full with 4 pieces of frozen beef , frozen solid. I used to love this place but this is the third and last disappointing time I will 
make to Sunflower
author: Karl K.

description: Does a bad attitude & bad service make it more authentic? I'm sick & tired of places that think they can treat customers like garbage and then take their money. I won't return here because they obviously don't care about getting my business at all - so I'll take it somewhere else!
author: Shal J.

description:
Oh Sunflower...how do I love thee? Let me count the ways...
* Your food is lovely, especially your noodle soups and vermicelli.
* Your service is amazingly fast.
* Your prices are fantastic.

Some people may be put off by your loud atmosphere or brusque service, but I love that I can come here for delicious food-- that isn't overpriced --delivered hot to my table in a matter of minutes.
author: Carolyn U.

description:
The food here is pretty decent.  The pho is not bad at all.  I wish I could find pho with super silky rice noodles and birds eye chiles instead of jalapenos in the US but I can't, and this place holds its own among nearby competitors.
Price point is also reasonable, and the service is pretty good.

Problem is, the interior is a bit gloomy and oppressive.  Sort of feels like someone died in here.  But other than that, I like it.
author: Jane F.

description:
Phoget about this place. The problem is that there are really no decent pho places in the Mission. If you really want some good (and cheaper) Vietnamese food, make the extra trip to the Richmond or Financial District. The pho at Sunflower is watery and lacks flavor that warms you up on a rainy day or after a hangover.

I also think it's funny that they have the "15% is customary in tipping" note on their menus. If this place was a really authentic, it'd be cheaper, grittier, and lots of fluorescent lighting. I'm only give it an extra star since it's better than Than Tam II down the street.
author: I Love Beef C.

description:
I ate here for the first time today and ordered the curry chicken over brown rice. Portion was huge and the food was great, except the brown rice had a slight black licorice taste. So, no more brown rice from here for me.

It was nice and cool inside, the perfect respite from a hot Indian Summer day. Finished my meal with a cold Vietnamese iced tea. Only downside was the chubby male waiter, who speaks unintelligible English and comes across as phony/fake when you order or finish up. I couldn't understand most of what he was saying, and his constant "Thank you" just sounded insincere and forced.
author: Maurice R.

description:
I met some friends here last week, w/o realizing this was the same restaurant my step-sister had taken me to when I was in town for Bay to Breakers last year.  While I didn't approach the place with a feeling of dread, I also wasn't excited to be there.

I think the Vietnamese options are better in Reno . . . 

The vegetarian spring rolls were decent, and I had the garlic noodles with prawns.  Huge portion of noodles, and they would have been perfect if I was trying to carb up.  Nothing special here though, and I ate the noodles more because I have a bad habit of eating whatever is in front of me, not because they were delicious.

My brother describes this as his "go-to" restaurant for out-of-town guests, but I don't understand why . . . the place is ok, but I would think there has to be better food in the Mission . . .
author: Ernie C.

description: We continued our food discovery in our neighborhood here last night. We started with the Vietnamese potstickers. They were different but not my favorite and I don't think I'd order them again but they were good. I ordered the chicken noodle soup and loved it. The chicken was duper moist and flavorful and the veggies were crisp and cooked just right. My husband ordered the claypot on my recommendation and it also was delicious. With his mouth completely stuffed he said, "Normally when I eat something, I pick around for my favorite bite... But this whole thing is delicious." two thumbs up. Only 4 stars because the service wasn't the best. I kinda felt like we were an inconvenience but it was delicious anyhow.
author: Autumn B.

description:
The food
I live in the area so it's within walking distance for me. I'm a pho addict. I LOVE pho. This place has some gooood pho. Come here to get some pho. 

Plus it's a little hole in the wall so you feel like you've discovered one of San Francisco hidden gems =) 
Wait is short. 
Place is clean.

Keep in mind, there is very little seating inside- I always get the food to go and it is just as yummy at work.
author: Janai F.

description:
An Authentic Vietnamese Restaurant where you CAN'T slide around on the floors because of the layers of grease.

I really have to enjoy my experience at a place to give it 5 stars. I am not the type of person just to be nice, they have to impress me. 

My friends and I were on our way home after some pampering time at Tranquility Nail Salon in the Financial District. 16th and Mission is our Bart stop to transfer to the Bus to my house, we were hungry so we walked around to eat first.

Sunflower smelled good and was busy, but open enough for us to easily get a seat immediately around 8:00 PM on a Friday night. Ten minutes later, there was a line outside the door. 

We had BBQ Pork, deep fried egg rolls or spring rolls, pineapple soup, and shrimp crispy noodles. The egg rolls were the best I've had since my fav egg roll place in LA -- Natalee Thai. BBQ pork was also very tasty, they give you an enormous amount of food for each plate.

Definitely will keep this place in mind next time I'm in the hood of the Mission.
author: Lorrie N.

description:
this is going to be really hard for me to write.

i've been coming here for years.  when i discovered this place in 2006 i fell in love with their meaty meat dishes and their garlic noodles.  when i went vegan in 2009 I realized i could STILL come here and fell in love with the veggie pho and lemongrass tofu.

after getting tired of the yelling lady at Than Tam II across the street which was a nice escape from the crowds at Sunflower i'm now realizing i'll need to keep searching for vietnamese options with no yelling at all.

i've always gone to the valencia st. side and i've always seen the smiling waiter who was always quite nice to me and called me sweet girl.

there was always one other waiter on the floor.  i didn't pay him much mind.  he didn't say much and i was always ok with that.

until last night when he said they didn't have take out containers when we were surrounded by people who were receiving take out containers.

we asked for one earlier then waited for 10 minutes as service ignored us.  we had paid our bill and they had taken it away, tip and all and they asked us if we wanted a take out container and i said yes.  10 minutes later after raising our hands and trying to get ANYONE's attention, we flagged one of them down to ask for a take out container.

we made the mistake of flagging down the unfriendly one who said they didn't give out take out containers.   my boyfriend pointed out that the table next to us had one and the unfriendly one muttered something about "be nice to me and i'll get you one."  but then never came back to the table so we left.

it was annoying to say the least.

and after visiting their yelp page i see that the waitstaff has some anger management issues.
author: Jen I.

description:
This may be some of the best Vietnamese food I've ever had. I wandered in here one day as I was strolling around the Mission, and ordered imperial rolls over vermicelli and... oh my god. The rolls were crispy, freshly made, not greasy, and packed with love and sunshine and everything great in this world. Combined with the veggies and the perfectly textured noodles..I was in heaven. I practically inhaled that plate. 

From now on, whenever I get that special craving for Vietnamese, I'll be sure to come here. The server was great, funny even, and the food was perfect. Definitely give this place a try.
author: Alyssa T.

description: I ate here with my friend on Monday night and everything was really good, the service has been friendly and fast, and the food was amazing!!! We'll be back for sure!
author: Debora B.

description:
If I have to suffer a painful death in the middle of my meal in this restaurant, and come back to life just before dessert gets serve, I would do it over and over again. If you have tried their deep fried sea bass and garlic rice, you would understand.
 
I discovered this gem in the mission maybe a little more than two years ago. The first time I walked in, my face grayish from hunger, I was wondering why there were many people who are willing to stand and patiently wait for other diners to finish their meal. But I knew words wouldn't suffice and I knew it was something that I have to experience myself.
 
I sat and my friend (who is a regular patron) ordered for us. That first bite, I couldn't forget that first bite of the sea bass. I thought I was just awakened from a slumber. Then there's the garlic noodle, topped with delectable prawns. I am a soda-drinker but I am not willing to taint the flavor with carbonated drink, so I opt for their Thai iced tea. 
 
Maybe I am just too focused on my food, but I don't seem to see the server refill water. But hey, forget the water, get the coconut water! 
Food - 5 Stars
Service - 5 stars
Parking - 4 stars. There are two parking garages nearby (Hoff Street Garage and the bank parking lot that turns into public parking after office hours). Street parking is a little bit challenging but free after 6 pm. 
Price - 5 stars. You get what you pay for.
author: Richelle Mae R.

description:
I love Pho, and I especially like this place! I had their beef Pho last time and seafood Pho today, both were very good (I'd prefer seafood more personally) and chicken spring roll is something that should be tried if one is eating here. Their noodle is not too different than other places, but I loved their soup.

I didn't like how servers were not very attentive, I had to ask for check 3 times to get it. But understandable considering they are pretty busy during lunch time.
author: Hanjun K.

description:
This is officially my neighborhood go-to Vietnamese spot. I've been here once before, but tonight it really sealed the deal.

I ordered the Chicken Pho and Vegetarian Spring rolls. My take-out was ready in 5 minutes, and they gave me a free Thai Iced Tea (thank you). 

It's reasonably priced, and you get a lot of food. The Pho was delicious, and I appreciated the generous portions of fresh basil, lemon, bean sprouts,  and chili. 

Now I feel warm inside and out and happy like a "sunflower."
author: becca j.

description:
If you want to get yelled at by servers please eat here. I promise they will yell at you. Especially if you're there an hour before closing time.

The food: scrumptious.
author: Nica M.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  Yes, it is hard to find parking, but I think it is worth it.  The food is flavorful and the staff is always nice.  I have only been there for dinner and always, always get the Sunflower prawns w/ garlic noodles - YUMMY!  I usually eat the shell of the prawns - heheehe!  I also love their steam fish - YUM!  Their stand only vegetable dishes are great too - I believe I had all of them.

The only reason I gave it 4 star and not 5 is that everything I leave there, my clothes tends to smell of food.  =(  But, that doesn't stop me from enjoying the food and staff there.
author: James L.

description:
Best chicken soup in the Mission! Very fresh. Get the extra veggies for a $1.

I really love this place!!   I like sitting on the smaller side (there are two different dining rooms here), to watch the kitchen personnel hustle food in an out.  Its pretty amazing b/c they don't talk to each other, its like some kind of cooking dance.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Great cheap dive to sober up - if there is room.
Really cosy atmosphere, fills up fast.
Decent menu with inexpensive, well made food.
I will also say that their broth is really rich and delicious, right up my alley.
The only pork entree is also very good, smoky and goes well into that same soup.
I would definitely come again, either for pho or for anything else on their menu.
author: Anton M.

description:
Sunflower is a great place to grab a delicious bowl of pho, or one of the vermicelli, or the Vietnamese pancake, which is awesome. 

There are two locations right next to one another, on the corner of Valencia & 16th. 

I usually go to the one on Valencia (the other one is much smaller)

I have primarily devoured the pho consistently, but I have also dabbled in their Vermicelli bowl, the Vietnamese pancake and the imperial rolls.

The Pho provides the soft therapy one needs when looking for a good meal, trying to curb a powerful hangover, or just in need of a food hug. It is very good here, not the best I've had, but it is quite good.

The Vietnamese pancake is great as well, along with the Vermicelli bowl and imperial and soft rolls. I have never been disappointed here.

The service is very good especially considering how busy they can get sometimes. One of the waiters, the unofficial head waiter, is great. He is almost always frazzled and hectic, and will almost always refer to you and your party as "young man" and "young girl". Age does not matter to this man, you are young in his eyes. 

The pho isn't really quite authentic, it is missing the guts and other things that make some people go ewwwwww... (not me).... but even then, I do enjoy their pho quite a bit.
author: Anish B.

description: Delicious pho noodle soup. Really nicec service,
author: vijay v.

description:
Cheap and good, that about sums it up!  We went ~8pm on a Sunday night and waited a few minutes for the friendly host to find us a spot in the crowded Mission restaurant.  It's super casual, full of hipsters and others (note, the bike parking was especially difficult b/c of all the other fellow bikers!)  Also, there are 2 entrances, one on Valencia, the other on 16th.  Hopefully that will save you some of the confusion me and my friend had!

What we ordered:
Grilled Shrimp and Imperial Rolls w/ Vermicelli - Huge portion for only $8!  It was full of vermicelli noodles, lettuce, grilled shrimp and deep-fried vegetable imperial rolls.  It was all "good", not outstanding.  But for that price, it was excellent :-)

Curry Chicken:
My friend thought it was quite tasty and the portion was HUGE.

I'll definitely be coming again, even if we have to fight the crowds again.  Well worth the price and quick service.
author: Alison E.

description: Get the Beef Noodle Soup. Its a large portion. I will sometimes make it two meals. Everything I have tried here was great but my favorite is the soup. All the prices are budget friendly too.
author: Trisha V.

description:
I really want to give this place two stars, but since this is my first review I'll award three.

So I went there last night with some friends who are firm believers of this restaurant, so I just went with it. I'm very hesitant with trying new asian restaurants, due to the fact of growing up asian with two amazing cooks as parents. 

One friend got the pho. Looked ok. I'm weary of places that doesn't mainly focus on pho so I stayed away from that.

My other friend got the 5 Spice Chicken & Imperial Rolls which looked amazing. I was definitely feeling a bit envious.

But the envy didn't kill me until they dropped the big mess of plate they called Seafood Pan Fried Noodles. It was mono colored pile of garbage. The noodles were over cooked, the shrimp definitely didn't fall short of their name, and the squid had no consistency. No amount of Sriracha was able to enhance the bland flavors of this dish.

I'm not saying not to come here, I'm just saying not to have your friend order something delicious and order a pile of crap for yourself.
author: Andy S.

description:
The people complaining about the service are not lying. The waiters are so rude and and probably have anger management issues. It's so sad for this restaurant, because the food is fairly delicious.

Last night I stepped into the restaurant asking for a table for 2 people, as my friend was on his way to join me there. The waiter told me to sit down on a chair by the cashier while I was waiting for the second person, though they were empty tables available.

My friend and I were very hungry, and I was supposed to already place the order so that we would have eaten right away.
I asked for a menu. The waiter totally ignored me initially, and finally he told me to just sit and wait for my friend. I then asked another waiter for the menu, which he basically threw to me. 

Getting upset by all of this, I asked gently to order, but the same waiter skipped me and seated other customers. I asked him again to order my food as I knew already what we both wanted, but he told me in a rude and angry way to just sit down, and wait for my friend,  and walked away.

At that point I had enough: I dropped the menu on the chair, and I rapidly walked out while the waiter yelled something at me for doing so.
author: Mikit A.

description:
OK, so i gave it a 3 star.  That is not cuz it sucks, but more that it is over hyped.  It is fast, clean and the food was good.  However, to say this is the second best Vietnamese restaurant. (Reviews / Ratings)  Remember, this place in located at the corner of Hip and Ster.

B.B.Q. Pork (Lemongrass marinade) & Imperial Rolls (28) was thin, flavorful and not too oily.  I would say it is good, but the it lacked the usual spiciness from the fresh lime.  Also, the Imperial Rolls were a soggy as if they had been sitting and refried 5 times too many.

the Chicken Pho had a good clean finish, but as for traditional i would say it was lacking.  Usually, the broth has a tight citrus flavor.  This is what makes the added veggies taste so much better.

Overall, i woudl say it is good, but Turtle Tower Restaurant is FAR better, but remember, if you are in Mission and you NEED a late night Pho, than i can not say no to Sunflower.
author: Jai D.

description:
This review's long over due! Sunflower has been my to-go Viet food of all time! Nothing fancy, but they deliver when it comes to tasty food! I feel bad because I still do not know the server's name up to this time...he's the talkative and funny one...the one you can tell when he's in a bad mood (he can be bitchy), but he's over all nice! He's been serving for 10+ years he said. 

Food here is cheap, tasty - the cork fee before if you bring a bottle of wine was $5...I was there sometime in May and it went up to $8! Im not happy about that. Here are some of my favorite dishes:  garlic noodles, shaken beef (so tender and juicy!), sizzling seafood, garlic eggplant, and the crab meat fried rice!

Oh, they need a better ventilation system! You always smell like garlic whenever you dine there....
author: Emil J.

description:
Sunflower is a casual Mission Vietnamese food joint with great food at low prices. I love getting takeout here because it's generally pretty busy, which means you always gotta wait for a table. Pretty much everything on the menu is good. I usually get the crispy noodles with chicken and seafood. The pancakes are a must try as well. The soups are perfect for a rainy day.

The servers try hard to be very friendly but seem to always be frazzled and in a hurry. I can't blame them though. Come here with friends rather than a date, just an FYI.

~A
author: Alex C.

description: I ate here last week, and I can't say I really recommend this restaurant.  We ordered the garlic noodles which were just oily, as well as a vegetable soup dish and something else I can't remember because it was also bland and unremarkable.  After we had been there about half an hour, the waitstaff began to yell (really, they did) at us to tell us that they were closing. It is conveniently located next to the Roxie, so it has that going for it, but honestly not much else.
author: Erica L.

description:
disgusting smell.
terrible service.
delicious pho.
author: Ronny K.

description: I came across this place from the mouthwatering aroma that carried out to Valencia from inside the door. Fantastic vermicelli and spring rolls! And a great deal too $$$
author: Kat J.

description:
With a hankering for Vietnamese food and an appetite worked up from our evening yoga class my roomies and I decided to try out Sunflower on Valencia at 16th. There are actually two locations one on 16th and one on Valencia. We were told they had the same menu and the latter had more table space.

The meal was great, I had the Thai iced tea (delish), and Chicken + Imperial Roll Vermicelli. Our table split the chicken spring roll appetizers and a bottle of wine we brought (corkage fee of only $5!) My dinner companions all had Pho (either chicken or beef) and felt it could have had a bit more meat but otherwise hit the spot.

The service was a little curt, hence the 4 stars, but overall it was a great experience and I would definitely go there again.
author: Christina H.

description: Have you ever left a restaurant mad because you were so hungry and spent your appetite on terrible food ?  I can't believe they call this place "authentic " Vietnamese. When I got my "imperial rolls" it was egg rolls.  Stuffed with cabbage carrots. No clear noodles or the key ingredients in imp rolls  WTF. Plus they were so large and thick like logs  over fried.  They are supposed to be small  So disappointing !  This place has changed since 7 years ago
author: Sam S.

description:
I just started working in the mission and was browsing Yelp on my Nexus One trying to find a cheap and filling substitute to the philly cheese steak heartburn I had the day before. I stumble on Sunflower and the urge for vietnamese takes control.

I went with their BBQ Pork with soup, salad and an imperial roll lunch special. The proportions are amazing! Usually I can scarf down most meals no matter the size but this... this has left me stunned. Who in their right mind would go anywhere else? $8.70 for 2 meals is a deal for me.

Delicious and fast. My two favorite terms in the food industry. If you're in the area, most def try this place out.
author: Tim J.

description:
Pros:
-Friendly amd amiable Waitstaffs
-Quick service
-Awesome fried spice chicken
-Bang for the buck 

Cons:
-tidiness is not the best concerned
-warm inside

My Verdict:
Not bad for a quick lunch or dinner
author: Michael K.
