description: Eating alone, together. Mathew Dear spinning ethereal in your white-phoned ears. High-heeled girl with cautious disregard digging into garlic noodles. Balding beatnik waiter avoids eye contact. Snapped fingers. Avoids eye contact again. Too bright, her face shows scant regard for makeup. We order two quarts of beer, I finish mine and order another. She sipping slowly looks up and smiles. The conversation dies.
author: Marc M.

description: Best veggie noodle soup around! A delicious stop for any occasion while passing through the mission.
author: Alexander K.

description: vermicelli with imperial rolls, it's all you could ever want, crispy fried veggie rolls resting atop a mountain of noodles, veggies and broth.
author: gina b.

description: Cheap, fast and service with a smile. They don't skimp with the portions. We had the Imperial Roll, fried tasty goodness. The Beef Salad was quite the large portion and could have been a meal. Will go back with a bigger appetite.
author: Parisa M.

description: I love the steamed sea bass here.  It's melt in your mouth tender with a perfect sauce, I end up scooping it all over my rice.  The Vietnamese crepe (chicken/shrimp) is excellent as well.  The imperials rolls rival my favorite version at PPQ, a tad bit bigger in size here.  Oh yeah, if you don't want your clothes to smell from the kitchen, then eat on the Valencia side.
author: Derrick V.

description:
have you had lunch here?
have you had the best waiter in san francisco?
are you hungry? 
okay, i will meet you there.
author: vanessa s.

description: Great food.  The shaken beef was very delicious.  The service was slow at every turn, but maybe that was because we ended up eating very late on a Sunday night.
author: Jesse C.

description: Excellent Vietnamese food.  The beef dishes are especially good.  Its a cute date place. They give a good quantity of food for a good deal.  Definitely check this place out.
author: Rupa P.

description: Had lunch at the 506 Valencia location before with people from work.  Food was excellent, so I thought of having a family dinner there tonight for my daughter's birthday.  Food was as great as I remembered.  BUT!!!  When it came time to pack our left over food, I requested for a fourth container.  The response I received was absurd.  The server stated, " I already gave you three containers.  That's all you get."  Really? I don't think I was asking for too much.  After all, they can't sell just that container to someone without anything in it.  Tonight's experience makes me think twice about going back there again. Definitely would not have tipped them had I known this was how I was going to be treated for an extra food container.
author: Jan D.

description: Asked the waiter if we could sit at a certain table and he exploded at us. he was literally yelling at us, so we walked out.
author: Arun W.

description: Decent food, strange service. We called two weeks ahead to schedule a group lunch, but they told us to just show up at noon and they'd have room for us. We arrived right on time to a nearly-empty restaurant. They seated us immediately, and brought out the entrees over a period of about 20 minutes. My chicken salad was average, but the vegetarian crepe was HUGE and excellent. At the end, instead of thanking us for coming, they instead told us, "Next time, come before 11:30." Yikes! Don't go expecting friendly customer service.
author: Dave K.

description:
Another fantastic Mission restaurant that is friendly to it's neighbor non-profit (being where I work).  I went here this afternoon to place a large order for a meeting we were having and Victor, the owner, blew me away with his kindness.  He spent a good 20 minutes talking with me and took the time to go over all the items we wanted to order and make sure nothing was missed and the right amount was noted.  He also cut us a break since we are 501 C(3) and poor, so we did not have to spend too much on our dinner.  I also was given a free appetizer for no apparent reason, I'd already been discounted on the food, it was not necessary but really sweet.  Not only that, I specified that I would pick up the order at 5:00 and they promised the food would be ready by then.  Well, they kept their word and were ready for me when I showed up right on the dot.  And one of the staff insisted on double bagging one of my bags so it didn't break on me even though I was just walking across the street!  Oh, and did I mention the food was a hit??!!  Especially the veggie spring rolls, dynamite!

I'm happy to report on ANOTHER really good restaurant in the Mission with fantastic food and even better service!
author: Swetha G.

description: I've had a wicked head cold for 3 days and have been living on their chicken noodle soup.  It's good but I wish it were just a touch spicier.  Have had to add rooster sauce in order to clear out the ol' sinuses!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Oooh, cheap & tasty! I loved the Vegetable Curry I had & will order it again. My husband had the same dish, but with chicken & found his a bit bland, but added one of the tabletop sauces & was good to go!
author: Melisser E.

description:
love the vegetarian hot and sour soup - i actually daydream about it because it has bittermelon!!! wonderful tangy, sweet broth and packed with very fresh vegetables and tofu.

the beef salad is another standout - super tender beer and fresh cabbage with generous mint

fresh sping rolls actually have enough sauce on the side! this should not be as rare and delightful as it is...but that's life, and sunflower's made it better.

also: the waiter who's about our age called jonny, my luvah, 'young man'
author: Joanna R.

description: My sweetie is obsessed with this place. Sometimes I think that's why he comes to see me so often, because I live right by Sunflower. He's even taken to coming and meeting me for lunch when I work at home. This place has done wonders for our relationship, and the pho is really good when you have a cold - the perfect antidote.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I enjoy the food here most of the time. However, what really bothers me is the service. I know other reviews here say they have gotten good service, but I must disagree for my two experiences here. I always felt like I was being ignored. I only saw my server twice, in the beginning and at the end to drop the check off. So, two stars knocked off.
author: John C.

description: I was here for some pho, just wanted a quiet night to myself. The dish was not very good - it was basic pho but the vegetables were huge! For a soup, I need to be able to chew some of the vegetables, not take several bites of half a brocoli. The flavor was minimal, and I needed extra seasoning, but had to flag down a waiter to ask for sauce. No one came to check on anything, but I was reading and just figured it was a mediocre restaurant experience. It wasn't until the waiter lost it at a customer (see the review written before me by Nathan V.!) that I realized I needed to leave quickly. I honestly don't know what the conflict was, but I've been a server for 6 years, and there is absolutely never a reason that could justify raising your voice at a costumer, even if they were holding a table for five hours.  There are hundreds of different ways of approaching a costumer- including politely explaining that you need to reseat them if it really comes to that- if you need to turn tables over. I felt very uncomfortable, especially as the waiter tried to explain to different tables his version of the story. If the food had been great, I might cross my fingers for a different waiter and give it another shot. Now, I have no reason to.
author: isaak b.

description: Lots of vegetarian choices. Always good food. Cheap & quick. Lots of hot oil cook smoke atmosphere. It's funny they always have 8 kinds of beer on the menu, but they actually only ever have 1 or 2 in stock.
author: Amy E.

description: The last time I was let down this much by undeserved raves was Tu Lan.  I would rate Sunflower as half a star up.  The menu mentions fresh lemonade three times-our server told us it wasn't available because the boss was lazy.  Speaking of which, I approached the waiter when 20 minutes after we were done, and there were still plates siting before us.   I had to check twice to ensure that I had entered their bathroom, and not the facilities of a Shell station.  The chicken and beef were very fatty. I haven't seen the amount of grease found in the Imperial rolls since homeroom in 9th grade in Jersey.  There are so many great places to eat in this neighborhood, and top quality Vietnamese in the Bay Area, that I strongly advocate skipping it.
author: Beth V.

description:
sunflower place has been here forever and for good reason.  it's tasty, cheap, and fast.  i recommend the chicken salad, shaken beef, and garlic eggplant. 

i don't know what lucky is talking about in his "fugly" review of the server- the guy has been here as long as the place and is attentive and kind.
author: lily k.

description: This place is awesome! Giant bowl of steaming beef noodle soup (pho) for $5.75 is so yummy and healthy tasting too. I also love the imperial rolls, tofu curry and all of the vermicelli dishes. My friend got the chicken fried rice that I tried and it was yummy! He ate the whole plate in one sitting. For the price and speedy service it can't be beat.  The same Sunflower is also around the corner on Valencia (I believe it's the same kitchen) which is bigger and has more seating than the tiny one on 16th.
author: lani P.

description: I went here with a fairly large group on a Friday night, and we definitely had to wait. But as our group grew to a certifiably large group, we were accommodated and moved to a long table in the back. The food was excellent and cheap. I was absolutely shocked by how low the bill came to for a full table of delicious food. You'll have to wait, but I definitely recommend coming with a group of friends so you can order multiple dishes and share. The atmosphere isn't the nicest, but it works.
author: Mary C.

description:
Sunflower restaurant is one of those very good quality hole in the wall restaurants.  First thing is first, the food!  The food is classic, authentic and delicious Vietnamese food.  Everything is good, so take your pick!  Its readily apparent that the restaurant genuinely cares about the food first.  It's delicious and inexpensive and they serve large portions that can provide several meals over the next few days.  The ambience is simple and no frills.   
And to top that off, the service is great whenever I go.   Sometimes it gets really crowded at this restaurant, but I avoid those times.  So, every time I eat there, the wait staff is extremely friendly, kind, and attentive.   If you need water, sauces, special packaging, or whatever, they find away to accommodate with a smile and provide creative suggestions to help you resolve any issue.  This is quite shocking for a hole in the wall restaurant where people would be willing to put up with marginal service in exchange for cheap, great food.  However, I haven't experienced this restaurant during the crowded times, so keep in mind the limitations of my review. Please enjoy and share!
author: Kimo S.

description: Best pho in the city. Amazingly priced entrees. I'm excited to have found such great Vietnamese food.
author: M A.

description: Vietnamese food is an aquired taste...my first time I ate here I was little judgemental because I was used of thai and korean flavors.  The second time, I was hooked.  Ate there alot on my lunches in the mission.  I love it. The food and the service is great, but they need a makeover of decor.  I recommend the vegetarian special with fresh sping rolls over fried.  The fried are good but not as healthy.  Also the chicken curry is awesome and the brown rice rocks!! and the thai ice tea.  Very delish!  You just got to know what to order.  Those are my recommedations, oh yeah the soup is great too, the chicken soup.
author: meeky P.

description: shaken beef and spring rolls!  the waitstaff is always very gracious despite the constant flow of people. tasty.
author: Tina J.

description: really delicious food, the rice paper fried spring roll was delicious, although pretty greasy, the noodle soup was surprisingly flavorful and the pan fried rice noodles were yummy!
author: Jasmine F.

description: I think I may have to make an admission.  I don't like Vietnamese food.  Pho just doesn't sound appealing to me.  Ok, that was a lovely soup.  Now I would like to have my meal.  So I avoided the Pho this time and went with spring rolls and a Vermicelli dish with Imperial Rolls.  First, the spring rolls were pretty tasteless.  Fat and plump, but tasted like green leaves.  Maybe if I was Little Foot from Land Before Time I would have been a fan.  Not sure what the sauce was that came with for dipping, but all it did was make the roll too slippery to pick up with my chop stix.  Now for my vermicelli and Imperial Rolls.  Once again, tasteless sauce and bland vegetables.  The rolls were a nice touch, but even the fried outer coating couldn't save them from the middling interaction they had with my tongue.  The BBQ pork did not help matters.  It was fatty and bland.  The most surprising part of all of this was the line out the door.  So I will qualify this review with my belief that Vietnamese food must just not be my thing.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Being Vietnamese and growing up eating, cooking and being around Vietnamese food all the time - I will say with conviction, this is a GREAT place for Vietnamese food.

When we have a craving from Viet food, we will always go here.  The food is authentic and very tasty.

The appetizer sampler plate is a great deal.  It comes with sliced bbq pork chops, imperial rolls, vermicelli noodles, cucumber, pickled veggies, leaves of red leaf lettuce and rice papers.  The object -create your own Vietnamese burrito masterpiece.

Other suggestions: bbq pork chops, catfish in clay pot, chow fun noodles

ULTIMATE suggestion: Vermicelli noodle bowl with bbq pork, imperial rolls, and veggies dressed with a sweet fish sauce.  THE BEST IN TOWN.  If there's another place that you think has this dish better, please let me know - because already, this place has got it DOWN.

There is always a good sized crowd here, so there can sometimes be a wait.  But once you're seated, the food comes out pretty quick for the most part.

Only bummer: no Vietnamese beer  : (
author: Liz T.

description:
this place is delicious! me and my friend walked in here one day after hanging out at dolores park. we split an order of vegetarian curry, which filled us both to the point of vomiting (almost).
and theres sweet painting covering the walls/ceiling... like fish and stuff.
good eats, cool decorationg.
author: Becca M.

description: this is where the Imperial rolls live. Perfectly textured crunchy warm savory... you can fill up on a whole order  or split them with my favorite, the 5-spice chicken!     The shaken beef is a heaping plateful of Heavenly Flavored Steak Chunks!!!  It's a garlic lover's dream, but bring the minty gum after this one, as it's also served with lots of yummy tender onions. Catfish Clay Pot, Lemongrass chicken, fresh spring rolls, and the pepper prawns are all fantasmic. cheap and delicious.
author: Alex o.

description: I eat here now and then because of my friends.  The food is decent for the price but it's not cheap.  I'd rather goto TL.  I would give it a 3.5 stars but I saw the waiter chase after another customer to ask why they left so little tips!!! I mean WTF!!  People give what they want to or what they have.  Sometimes you just didn't bring enough cash!!!  GEEZZ!
author: Yuko Y.

description:
ok, this is not the place where you go to eat pho. 

HOWEVER

the garlic noodles and prawns are simply put, AMAAAAAAZING. thick, fresh noodles and huge tender prawns covered in delicious chunky black garlic sauce, served with a side of fresh cucumber and tomatoes.... just thinking about it is making my mouth water... this is my must-eat food whenever i'm in the bay. as well as the vermicelli noodles and imperial rolls, with a side of scrumptious fish sauce. for dessert, i highly recommend the fried bananas and ice cream.
author: Aletheia W.

description: The portions are HUGE and the staff are super nice.  What more can you ask for considering the very cheap prices? You won't leave hungry!
author: Nadine H.

description: I love this place. I go there just for the #22  Veggie Sweet and Sour Soup. This yummy soup is loaded with tofu, mushrooms, tomato, pineapple, and garlic.  Sometimes I add vermicelli noodles for a pho-like soup.   mmm!
author: Karlee D.

description: This place is pretty good although I doubt it's authentic but who really cares? Their Shaken beef is excellent as well as their sea bass. I honestly haven't tried anything that I didn't like. The only down side is the lack of parking.
author: Diane M.

description: a divey, whole-in-the wall restaurant (but what isn't in the Mission these days) that serves great spring rolls.  the workers are ethnically cantonese but the food is definitely vietnamese.  i will definitely be coming back to try other dishes, but for now, 3 stars, since I've only tried the spring rolls and I can certainly make a better peanut sauce.
author: Ben T.

description: Really cheap, really fast, lots of vegetarian choices.  The vegetarian spring rolls are really good and massive!  Decor is a little ratty but oh well.  Adds character.
author: Melanie C.

description: Good solid food - pretty cheap, and you get a fair amount for your money. I liked the chicked curry as well as the vermicelli.
author: Dana L.

description: For a quick bite, Sunflower is one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the city - I only wish they delivered.
author: joe b.

description: Had a really great dinner here with the bf.  Got seated right away on a Friday night, and it was warm and the servers were friendly and quick.  The bf, who's Chinese (-American), was confused that the servers were all Chinese, but the food was good, so whatever.  I got the pho and we split the awesome spring rolls, and I forget what the bf had but he loved it.  Thank goodness this place is just a couple blocks from my apartment.  And there's another location around the corner too--who knows why.
author: Gina K.

description: disappointing.  got some garlic noodles and tasted like bad chinese takeout starchy noodles msg-laden mess.  and each prawn is 50 cents each.  no thanks.  salty to boot.
author: Rob C.

description: I almost feel bad giving this place one star, since it's in my 'hood and I am a fervent believer of supporting local businesses and restuarants... BUT, I can't recommend this place with a clear consicence. I ate pho here once, and it was some of the most bland, unremarkable, beef noodle soup I have *ever* had. If this was any indication of the quality of the other items on the menu, I can only recommend staying away, far away, from this place.
author: Sunny Y.

description: This is one of my favorite asian restaurants in the city.  My favorites: the garlic noodles, spicy string beans, & vegetarian crepe. For a treat try the Sunflower Prawns which are on top of a bed of the garlic noodles. The sauce is so delicious (spicy & sweet) and the prawns are huge!
author: Erica B.

description:
i highly recommend the vermicelli spring roll salad (vegetarian).   probably not super authentic vietnamese, but is anything around this intersection authentic?  gotta blend in.  not quite fancy enough to be  http://stuffwhitepeoplelike.wordpress.com/2008/01/31/45-asian-fusion-food/ but not quite http://stuffwhitepeoplelike.wordpress.com/2008/02/20/71-being-the-only-white-person-around/ either.

either way, its one of my regulars.  wish it weren't so far of a walk from work.
author: Katherine R.

description: everything on the menu is excellent for satisfying a craving for fish sauce.  My favorites are the Pho, Imperial Rolls and chicken salad... but everything is delicious.  I live down the street and feel lucky that I do. I wish they had delivery!!
author: Best M.

description: This place was awesome! We had a delicious Vietnamese crepe that was filled with fresh vegetables and deep fried to perfection. My main course was a vermicelli bowl with spring rolls and lemongrass beef. There was piles of beef and every bite was tender and delicious. The waiters were extremely friendly and helpful. This place is worth the trip and I plan to go back.
author: Joe R.

description: If you're feeling a little under the weather this is the best place for chicken noodle soup!
author: Josie C.

description: Great prices for tasty rolls and vermicelli dishes. Very friendly host, in the perfect manner of the homosexual that we have come to know and love, but beware if you forget to tip him the requisite 15-20 percent. His demeanour will be a perfect caricature of a deeply disgruntled queen.
author: Sameer S.

description: WARNING: their "Vegetarian" noodle soup is made with chicken broth powder.  Not only is the broth not fresh, it is made with msg laden powder.  On top of that, it isn't even vegetarian as advertised.  Whoa, that is like way to many negatives for one product on the menu.
author: Andrew P.

description: I only go here to eat 2 things: battered prawns with garlic noodles and banh xeo (crispy crepe). Both have been pretty good. Not the best I've had, but large portions are flavorful and tasty enough to satisfy my cravings. Shaken beef is not bad either. It's hard to find a restaurant in the city that has more than vermicelli and pho, so its nice to have a place nearby (that does take out) with a little more varied menu.
author: Sabine S.

description: Gee, I'm a bit confused with the reviews my fellow yelpers are giving this average place. Sure, the prices are reasonable and the selection is typical of what you would expect from most Vietnamese places, but the food is not something to write home about.  I've had better pho elsewhere and my friend's spring roll and beef vermicelli was a bit tasteless even with the fish sauce.
author: Eileen Q.

description: I will never, never go here again.  I know two people who have gone here and found bugs/worms in their food.  That is enough for me...
author: Emma M.

description: This place is phenomenal! The people who run this joint are brazilliant!  We can eat here anytime-anyday!!  Usually, we can't get away without ordering a couple starters and three to five main dishes!  With prices so reasonable our bellies and wallets leave happy.
author: Nate K.

description: The best chicken friend rice I've ever had.  The imperial rolls are awesome.  A single waiter manages to serve the entire floor with two bus boys--truly an amazing accomplishment.
author: Kaku A.

description:
I have no adverse comment about the food, which is reasonably well cooked and well presented but this restaurant takes the lowest rung on ladder when it comes to attentive customer service. On a recent visit (my third) i was ushered to a table at the entrance door on a blistery windy and rainy evening. I was with my 7 yr. old grand-daughter. The waiter was rude and refused us a vacant table further inside the hall, though several were vacant. Naturally, I took my custom somewhere else. and decided never to go there again. 
When we dine out, we look forward to a pleasant evening and should not have to deal with ill-mannered boorish behavior from the staff.
author: Anindyo C.

description: Vietnamese food to me usually means three things - healthy food that's not drowning in sauces and curries, fresh spring rolls (not fried, not steamed), and the vermicelli bowl with vegetables and imperial rolls. And Sunflower delivers on all three counts! I Vegan friendly.  Generous portions. Easy on the pocket. Expect long waits on weekends.
author: Shweta V.

description: ok, a friend recommended this restaurant but I was a bit leary since my fellow yelpers gave it only 3 1/2 stars. But, I love this place. There are 2 restaurants, one on Valencia and one on 16th, both by the same owner. Valencia is bigger and has more of an atmosphere. We had the BBQ lemongrass beef... so good... still can taste it in my mouth... spicy lemongrass chicken, vegetarian spring roll... yummy...and this rice crepe dish... you wrap your own stuff in a rice crepe... can't wait to go back...
author: Jay S.

description:
I came here for the first time fresh out of Atlanta & living nearby - I think the change in climate really messed with my sinuses and I had one ultimate goal for the evening: SOUP!!! I searched for "soup" on yelp and this highly rated restaurant caught my eye because of the one $ mark.  
I had a nice table on the window overlooking a very happening corner in Mission and enjoyed a very hot jasmine tea (on the house) while I waited for my vegetarian hot & sour soup.  I asked the waiter if the soup was spicy, he said "mild" but it was definitely spicy!! It was a perfect spicy though, the heat in the cafe combined with the heat of the soup (temperature and spice) helped me sweat out whatever ailment I suffered.  I then asked the waiter how much a side of brown rice would cost and instead of telling me he just ran and got one - $1.75, whatever, not bad (considering the tea was free?) and combined I had a very enjoyable meal.
The only truly unenjoyable aspect of my dining experience was the AWFUL music - some FM station playing all of the cheesiest love songs you could imagine.  No seriously, imagine the most cheesy love songs ever and that's what I had to listen to.  Maybe I'm just bitter because instead of being spoon fed homemade soup in bed (where I probably should have been anyway) by a hot man, I was dining alone.  But whatever.  Can I at least get a top 40 pop station?? After being cheesed to death by sappy love songs, I enjoyed my complimentary chocolate mint, marveled at my reasonably low check and walked away with leftovers.  It was nice.
author: Rachel G.

description: The veg spring rolls and the chicken noodle soup are very good here.The service sucks and the people who work there are just straight up RUDE!! I suggest you get the food to go,go,go.The staff chasing the crackheads out is a bonus..Its like a theme restaurant. H
author: ed m.

description:
this
place
is
so
so
good.

it's hard to dis Tu Lan, but Sunflower is so FUCKING DELICIOUS. i got here every time i can. the last time i was here i took my brother. he eats only things that are the color white and cautiously sniffs every food before tasting. he left full.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Worst service I have ever experienced.  

I've rarely walked out of a restaurant after sitting down, but I had to walk out here, because they wouldn't let me place my order.  I had a few questions on the menu before ordering.  I've never been given such terrible treatment for asking about the food at a restaurant before.  In the poor waiter's defense he was the only one for a packed restaurant and didn't seem to speak English very well, nor know what the ingredients of the various dishes were, nor was he even able to describe their approximate size.  All this I could handle - I pretty much know all the ingredients already and English troubles I could work with - but when the waiter stomps away in the middle of the conversation and doesn't come back, only to return ten minutes later seeming to have forgotten the previous interaction, and this happens multiple times - I start to get a bit unhappy.  Then he tells me (actually yells at me) that I can't order a single thing on the menu based on??.  I won't stay in a restaurant where they won't even let me order.  My patience ends there.

The food actually looked and smelled pretty good., but I will never be back, unless, perhaps I go with someone who speaks the language and this is the last restaurant open for a fifty mile radius.
author: N T.

description: Really, really good food.  The fried rice is my favorite in San Francisco, because it is just rice and chicken and some good crisp vegetables and none of that unidentifiable stringy stuff that restaurants sometimes throw in to take up space. The fresh spring rolls are so fresh you may consider slapping them.
author: Jude F.

description:
My non-date for the evening and I decided to go the Mission for a cheap but good NON-date, someplace that would have at least enough atmosphere to support our non-date purposes.  It also had to have food for me (VEGAN) to eat.

So we happened upon Sunflower, and while it's itsybitsyteensyweensy, it feels warm and inviting, with fun tropical-esque colors and fish painted on the walls and just enough grime to make it feel authentic without actually needing a bath immediately afterward eating.  We sat at the counter, right up against the open kitchen and there's something authentic, Anthony Bourdain Cook's Tour-y about it.  I was pleased to see that there are plenty of veggie/vegan things on the menu.  I got the tofu vermicelli noodles and it was delectable - yummy, tangy vinaigrette, good bits of tofu.  A LITTLE too much celery (I feel like celery is filler and not particularly delicious filler at that) but no biggie, and if you're aware of it, you can probably say "no celery" or something.  ALSO it's fantastic value - I'm generally founding member, president and chairwoman of the Clean Plate Club, but this ended up being two meals worth for less than 8 dollars.  And they have beer and wine.

But the best part was the boombox on the counter, right next to where we were sitting.  Seriously, our experience at Sunflower was basically perfect and here's the main reason why:

"True" - Spandaue Ballet
"Wicked Game" - Chris Isaak
"I Want to Know What Love Is" - Foreigner
"Kiss From a Rose" - Seal
"Fooled Around and Fell in Love" - Rod Stewart
"Boys of Summer" - Don Henley
"I'll Make Love to You" - Boyz II Men
"Dreams" - Fleetwood Mac


IN THAT ORDER AND ALL IN A ROW. 

Okay, so maybe these four stars should go to 96.5 KOIT's Thursday night DJ, but I also gotta give props to the counter and the loud boombox blasting said songs into my ear right next to my delicious, huge bowl of noodles and my frosty glass of beer.  Perfect perfect perfect.  This will be added to my regular rotation of restaurants.  On Thursday nights between 8:30 and 9:30.  Love Songs After Dark.  And noodles.  Who knew?
author: Ashley B.

description: Tried this place last night, started off with the crab & asparagus soup (large for $7.95) which was a but much for two but really tasty...lemongrass beef with green beans, also very good and just right amount of lemongrass...5 spice roasted chicken, also delicious and juicy and the hot & spicy seafood combo which had prawns and squid. This was just ok in our opinion; not that spicy and too much sauce. Overall a great new spot, we found parking really quickly but I think the parking Gods were with us as I know that area is packed tight most nights. Service was excellent and the place itself really nice and cozy, I'll definitely return...
author: Steve K.

description: We had a good time at this spot despite the crowds. Our meals were good but not great and the Pho was a 6-7 out of ten. We have heard rave reviews about the authenticity of this place and we could certainly see the potential there. The portions are totally out of hand and the value is all there. This review is likely to go up upon another visit but for now I have to call it as I see it.
author: M L.

description: I've been to Sunflower a few times and have never been wowed.  It's dark and crowded and the food is OK but nothing special.  If it had any real competition I'd only give it 2 stars, but for the Mission, this is the best Vietnamese you're going to get.  However, if you live in the Mission and you're stuck at home with a cold, I HIGHLY recommend getting their vegetarian/tofu pho to take out.  Steaming broth + fresh vegetables + rice noodles -- you'll feel healthier in mere minutes, guaranteed.
author: Sarah B.

description: This was my first time having Vietnamese so I can not really compare it to anything else in terms of authenticity but I thoroughly enjoyed myself.   We came in about 9 at night so we were seated right away.  We looked over the menu and started with the Imperial Rolls which i thought were absolutely delicious, wonderfully crispy on the outside and not typically greasy on the inside like most egg rolls and hot as hell .  I had never had Vietnamese BBQ so decided on the BBQ Pork Vermicelli Noodle which was super tasty although I love spicy so I had to douse it in the chili garlic sauce that they have on the table.  Then we also ordered the Beef Pho which I actually exactly how I imagined it would be so I think that was something that I will skip next time and get something else.  Although I will definitely be craving some Pho on a cold winter day for sure.  All in all food was tasty and service was not terrible (though I never expect really good service in places like this cause I am not going for the service just the food, that is why I still go to YAMO, cause that is awful service)  I liked and will go there.  I will say that I do not recommend this place before a night out on the town cause the kitchen is in the dinning room and you will leave smelling like grease, but its worth it.  Oh and for 2 of us our bill was $25 which is awesome cause I am all about affordable eating...
author: K Q.

description: Cute little informal restaurant in a great location. Huge portions that you can't possibly eat in one sitting. Great Vietnamese coffee -- they give you a individual Vietnamese drip filter and a glass of ice. Very friendly staff.
author: Bre D.

description: i LOATHED vietnamese food until this restaurant came into my life, I am now a reformed hater. The bbq pork and PHO ,and imperial rolls are heaven on earth.Thank you allah...thank you Vietnam.THANK YOU SUNFLOWER
author: Lauren V.

description:
I love the sweet and sour soup with the pineapple and tofu!!! I always get take out from here when I am sick.
The lemongrass tofu and greenbeans also kick ass.
The people who work here are really nice.
author: Jessie H.

description: I come here quite a bit.  I love the vermicelli with the fried spring rolls.  MMmm.  Decent service, good atmosphere, and generally a good back up if you can't think of anywhere else to go.
author: Joanna S.

description: good pho, really great service, one time they gave me a free vietnamese iced coffee.  One of the waiters is really into calling guys "young man" its hilarious
author: Ian H.

description: Not special, but fine for lunch if you're nearby.
author: Jane M.

description: One of my favorite san francisco restaurants.  Food is amazing, service is great, and prices cant be beat.  If there is a heaven, Sunflower is served there.
author: Bitzz B.

description:
ok i have to say that i love the food here. i'm vegetarian/vegan and they have great options for me.

either way, and the reason they have only three stars is that the service is horrible. and i mean horrible.

the guy who served my friend and i was rude to everyone else and even called some girl stupid behind her back because she couldn't understand his accent.

as that wasn't enough he kept touching me and saying how beautiful i was, which creeped the shit out of me.

i'm gay, but i really don't want to go have dinner to have the waiters touch me and bug the hell out of me and my other gay friends. he even went off saying that because i was vegetarian that explained how my beautiful my body was.

seriously, it's creepy. i'm not sure if i'm going there again.

in summary:

awesome food.

don't go there if:

you are a gay vegetarian :)
author: Afonso S.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants!  But it is all about the rolls.  Those crispy imperials rolls are out of control.  Its all about the Bun!!  As a converted meat eater after 15 years, I can't resist the bbq pork with the imperial rolls bun.  And the Pho is so good!  Having been to Vietnam last year, this is the best Vietnamese restaurant I have found in the city- but I only get the Pho & Bun!
author: Gregory J.

description: Pho is great but venture deep into the menu... Shaken beef and clay pot fish are fantastic
author: Shezana M.

description:
i have been eating here for about 10 years now.  the quality continues. and the sercvice is great.
also, as i understand it,  the val and 16th sides are one in the same.  its the same people.  the same kitchen.  dont know why anyone would think they are different spaces...

my faves are the veggie crepe.  the spring rolls, the mint pork.  and the salted plum soda.

yum!!!!!
author: the one m.

description: It's a cold drizzley night. foggy, chilly, not cool, totally lame. your answer=Seafood noodle soup at Sunflower. Hot, brothy, full of seafood. Quick and tasty. The lemongrass chicken is also very good. Decor is pleasant. People are really nice. Though they move you through. They need your seat. And they don't like you to dilly-dally as they like to close on time.
author: shannon t.

description: Always busy but don't have to wait to long to be seated, Really good, Lost of great stuff , Vietnamese crape, shaken beef, pepper prawns, pan fried rice noddles, its all good! Crazy waiter is a lot of fun
author: jordan n.

description: quick service!  amazing vietnamese iced coffee. go for lunch and get the heaping portion lunch special of lemongrass prawns/beef/chicken/tofu. seating is very limited and the place is cramped, but for authentic vietnamese food, you want to come here.
author: Anthony I.

description: Huh. Lots of good reviews for this place, but it's hands-down the worst Vietnamese I've had in the Bay Area. Dry flavorless noodles, way overcooked spring rolls, terrible service. No jars of hot sauce and garlic, instead just sriracha and hoisin. The only good thing was the BBQ pork, which was actually really really tasty. Too bad the vermicelli it came with was inedible and almost totally lacking in veggies.
author: J N.

description: Good service. Very friendly and pretty quick. The pho here is very clean, with a garlic based broth instead of being loaded up with a ton of MSG. Great place to go to with a group of friends. Place can be a bit cramped at times.
author: Derek Y.

description: OMG. i love this place. haven't been here in a few months, but i dream about the yellow curry eggplant dish all the time. this restaurant (or actually, the sister-restaurant around the corner) is equally great for takeout and parties. inexpensive, reliable, and comfortable. oh, and delicious and healthy!!
author: Eryn L.

description: Sunflower is cool, but it's no Elephant Bleu which sadly disappeared recently. I thought I'd swing down and try it out for my Vietnamese craving and thought the double dining room part was the most interesting aspect. The imperial rolls and bun were pretty standard and didn't thrill me. If Sunflower stepped it up a couple notches, it would probably be my regular hangout, until then I don't know how often I'll get over here...
author: Michael E.

description: Great lunch special that can fill you up for two meals.  Excellent selection of food, though their liquor license is (temporarily) suspended.  Nice place for hangover food that won't break your wallet.  Bonus: the staff is uber friendly!
author: Jenny L.

description: This place never fails me. Although I am not that adventerous but I enjoy the "dry noodle" dish- I am not sure what they call it in Vietnamese maybe Banh Mi with the vegetarian eggrolls. My husband and I also tried the spicy string beans which were tasty and the fried rice balls. Those were fantastic! We love coming here when we are craving for Vietnamese food.
author: Zannie S.

description: Food is decent, not spectacular.  Feels mostly authentic, like the name implies, which seems to be somewhat rare in this area (for Vietnamese food).  The vegetarian selection on entrees was lacking, which docs them a full point in my book.  It's well worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood.  Their take on hot and sour soup is worth trying.
author: Nelson A.

description: Nothing makes me feel better than a huge bowl of noodles! My favorite is the vermicelli with pork and imperial rolls. It's almost as good the next morning when you're eating the other half of it for breakfast!
author: katharine s.

description: I know it could be better, but for the price and location this place serves up some fast decent pho.  I've never had to wait long, their cuts of beef have always been excellent, and their various fried rolls are all good as appetizers.  I never make a destination out of it, but when I want Pho *and* I want The Mission, I'm not sad to have to eat here.
author: Bailey S.

description: I had lunch here the other day and I still have the taste of the spring rolls in my mouth - and not in a good way.  I ordered a rice noodle bowl with chicken and vegetarian spring rolls.  The chicken was dry, the spring rolls were crispy, but very greasy, the noodles were all stuck together.  At the end of the meal, I had most of the noodles and some chicken left, so I packed it up.  As I walked by the BART station, I realized I would never eat the leftovers, so I left it on top of a bench.  The service wasn't very good either - we waited a good 15 minutes for the waitress to pick up our bill.
author: Julie W.

description: Hands down the BEST Vietnamese in town. It's small, they're VERY quick, the price is right, and the portions are huge. Good for sharing or taking home some leftovers. I highly recommend their vegetarian spring rolls and lunch meals!!!
author: Asha T.

description: i feel like this place is very hit or miss! I went with my Mom a few months ago and it was nothing special but then i went a few days ago and it was great.. The service last time was lousy at best.. but good food.. will likely go back ;)
author: rukshan b.

description:
i have not been very impressed with the pho at sunflower.  its ok, but there aren't very many options and its really nothign to write home abput.  the appetizers i've had there have been much better.

hint:  there are 2 entrances that share the same kitchen.  the entrance around the corner on valencia has a slightly nicer atmosphere if you are looking to sit down and eat.
author: Steve S.

description: This place met up to it's hype!  Which is rare!  Everything we ordered was delicious, it was so hard to decide b/c everything on the menu sounded delicious.  I'll have to return over and over again to taste the rest of the menu.
author: Debbie Y.

description: The food here is exceptional and there are a plethora of seafood and vegetarian choices.  Haven't tried their pho yet, but their spring rolls + shrimp and peanut sauce are replete with flavor.  I would also recommend their claypot with fish and lemongrass tofu with green beans.
author: Sid D.

description:
disclaimer - 4 stars based soley on ordering the lunch special.  

my old co-workers are in the mission and wanted to meet for lunch.  they said "meet me at sunflower on valencia and 16th".  no problemo.  i'm walking around and didn't even notice the place for a good 5 - 10 minutes.  partly i'm dense and partly the place is a hole in the wall.  i was a little skeptical at first (wasn't sure the place would be clean).  once i went inside the place was a hole in the wall, but clean.  

for $8 i get soup, a gianormous imperial roll, shrimp w/green beans, rice, and (i think) cole slaw (weird).  not bad.  i'd go again.  it's a change from the great mexican in the area.

p.s. my "previous" co-workers are not that old.  :)
author: jen b.

description:
it's small and crammed...
vermicelli with bbq pork was good, but my brother's pho barely had any meat in it...
author: charlotte s.

description: good priced food, not particularly memorable, but good place to get your fix for pho and other typical vietnamese dishes.  The service started off well, until the bill came, there was a reminder card (?) that service is at least 15% of the bill.  When we asked for change, as we still had to add tip and split the change, the server returned to us and verbally reminded us that we had to give him a tip.  we didn't look like cheapskates, so didn't know what the deal was.  to say the least, it was a turn off.
author: Adrian N.

description: Ate at the 16th st storefront a few years ago and had a decent noodle soup, and just recently found out that this place is sharing the same kitchen.  the temperature is much cooler in this dining area, since you're not so close to the kitchen.  the imperial rolls here are decent, but the lettuce leaves weren't quite large enough.  i ordered the shaken beef, and while it was tender, i expected a bit more kick to the spice.  there's better places to eat, particularly since those two items and a thai iced tea ended up running me $22 w/o tip.
author: shawn g.

description: I love this place, luckily for me its enroute to my office and I frequently grab lunch to go on my way to work (dont tell my husband) drool worthy tasty favorites include Vietnamese Crepe, crispy combination egg noodles, chicken curry and shakin beef.......huge portions and tasty soup bowls that could feed a family of four......this place is a must for lunch or dinner when in the neighborhood.
author: Kirsty E.

description: Very good food at a reasonable price.  The trade off is dining space.  When full you may need to get cozy with you neighbor.  Heck you might make a new friend.
author: Jack M.

description: I recently ventured here for lunch with a co-worker. I got the BBQ pork lunch special to-go...they give you a ton of food. The amount of meat was at least three times what I have received at other Vietnamese places. It was quite tasty and it comes with an imperial roll and soup. My friend is a big fan of this soup. It has tomatoes, tofu, pineapple and jalapeno peppers. It's a tad too sweet for my taste, but it was okay. The pork was very tasty. It was not as thickly cut as other restaurants but since the portions were so big, I did not question it. Any time I feel like taking a little extra time for lunch (it's a lengthy Bart ride for a lunch break), I think I will venture over here again.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I'm a newbie to Vietnamese food but first impression is it's sub-par Chinese food (maybe I'm biased because I'm Chinese). I had the Vegetarian Spring Rolls, which were pretty decent and I enjoyed the peanut sauce. The pan fried rice noodles were nothing to yelp about though. A little on the dry side and pretty bland. When I'm craving noodles, I'm going to stick with Chinese style.
author: Susan L.

description: Ugh, this place was nasty.  What the heck was that soupy excuse for a fresh shrimp roll dipping sauce?  And the bunh noodles?  Don't get me started.  When I want my BBQ pork all sauced up, I'll go to a Chinese joint.  I promptly derided my Mexican friend for this disappointing trip.  Next time I'm bringing him to PPQ or Tu Lan.
author: Dave L.

description: ummmmmm.....sweet and sour shrimp soup. Has this porus onion like item in it, and it is delicious. They even offer small or large sapporo which puts them high up there in my book. The staff is also really nice and friendly.
author: Emily L.

description: I can never decide what dish  I want to order here. I like the claypot cat fish, tofu dish, lemongrass beef, garlic noodles. It is not a place you go for the atmosphere but the price and service are great. Not to mention the AWESOME and delicioussss food.
author: Ervinna L.

description: This is one of my regular spots.  Even when I was traveling through Vietnam, I still craved sunflower.  I love their shaking beef, the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, and the catfish clay pot.  But don't go there for the "standard" vietnamese food, like pho, 5 spice chicken, bbq pork over rice, etc.  They are definitely sub par for those things, but their specialties make this place a worthwhile meal (or in some cases, once a week).
author: Joe S.

description: The vegetarian lunch special (vegetarian soup, vegetarian imperial roll, salad, lemon grass tofu) was awesome!  The soup had tofu, fresh diced pineapple and tomato.  The vegetarian imperial roll was deep-fried but not over-greasy.  The lemon grass tofu with string beans was just tasty.  Apparently for 50cents more, you can substitute brown rice for white rice.  A HUGE plate of food for $7.95!  I'm in my vietnamese vegetarian happy place when I am at Sunflower :).  Last but not least, they have got the *friendliest* folks working here.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The food here is great, but the service is lacking.  Prices are great for the quality and quantity of food that we had.  I was a bit hesitant to get a group of 6 together here, as I knew that it was likely that some of my friends would be late.  As I don't drive into the City, I forgot about the difficulty of finding parking in the Mission.  We were lucky to get a table rather quickly, as I remember that we waited for quite some time the last time we were there as a party of 3.  They sat us rather quickly at the front of the restaurant, but they groaned as we wanted to move the table a bit away from the door, as one of us would have to move every time someone came in or out of the restaurant.  The maitre d' was surly and I kept having to ask for water, which is a pet peeve of mine.  The restaurant was also on the loud side, as I had difficulty hearing some of my friends on the other side of the table.

We ordered the following dishes, all of which were wonderful.  My favorite is the crepe, which was what I was craving.  The seabass was good, but I didn't need it:

* Vietnamese Crepe - (Banh Xeo) rice flour crepe with bean sprouts, chicken & shrimp. served with lettuce & fish sauce.

* BBQ Chicken and Imperial Rolls with vermicelli - (bun cha gio bo nuong)

* Shaken Beef - exceptionally tender cubes of beef with green onion, black pepper, & garlic.

* Steamed Seabass - filet boneless white meat steamed with ginger, green onion, & sauce
author: Albert C.

description: Love their PHO! If you need a good pho soup try the chicken and/or seafood pho. IGave it 4 stars cause I haven't tried the other items on the menu. P.S. Don't expect much from the decor or service, it's nothing glamours. Just your local vietnamese hole in the wall.
author: Patricia - Trixie M.

description: Was totally impressed by this place. Went on a whim after walking by and it was a very affordable and enjoyable meal (actually 2 since they give you so much food!). The service was exceptionally friendly-- especially for a vietnamese restaurant. Will definitely be back!
author: Jon N.

description: You know how some things smell funny/or bad but taste great, i think a lot of Vietnamese food is like that, the sweet and sour soup is great, pineapple in soup! who would have guessed? (hint: the Vietnamese) the the "crepe" was a little odd, but everything else was perfect. except for the smell.
author: Jared Z.

description: The pot stickers rule. The portions are desirable and the eats are tasty. Nice little spot for a dinner between friends. Some shit is a bit bland so you should probably add Sambal to whatever you eat.
author: Emily S.

description: I tried the pho from this Vietnamese joint and lost most of my appetite.  The broth was a grey color, which scared me a bit, and overall it was bland, completely lacking the right aromas and taste of real pho.  On a previous visit, I did try the vermicelli noodles with imperial rolls and grilled beef, and found this dish to be decent.  Perhaps I will stick with the vermicelli entrees whenever my roommate drags me here, or try another dish, but will definitely not order the pho ever again.  I would rank this spot low on the list of good Vietnamese restaurants in SF.
author: Linda P.

description: This was the best pho I have ever eaten!  The beef was so lean (I don't like fatty or chewy beef in my pho).  Great imperial rolls too!  The wait was long on a Friday night, but it was definitely worth the wait.
author: Max G.

description: It was a cold day and nothing is better than a nice hot bowl of pho.  But is there a decent pho place in the Mission area?  Well I yelped it and found this restaurant.  Why do people here think the noodles are so tasty?  IMO, the pho was nothing to rave about.  I had the chicken pho here, which consisted of chicken breast meat (a lot of it) in a clear broth.  I had to drown it with Saracha hot sauce to get some flavor out of it.  But other than that, bland.  I guess I'll have to go back to TT for some good Vietnamese chicken noodle.  Imperials rolls however were very good, huge and tasty.  Forget about the pho.  I'll have to try the Bun next time.
author: Lucky M.

description: The imperial rolls are pretty fantastic, but the chicken in the chicken noodle soup--while abundant--was overcooked to an inch from complete disintegration. I'll come back, but not for pho ga.
author: Maximillian M.

description: their chicken soup will cure you of your cold and make you feel warm and fuzzy inside.
author: Mary C.

description: This place has given me occasional cravings for their garlic noodles. I don't know why they are so tasty, but they are (the menu says there's a secret special ingredient, hmm). The fresh rolls are also world-class and the crispy noodles likewise. I've been there at least five times and never been disappointed. Excellent value for money. Very friendly staff.
author: Dennis G.

description: I have been enjoying awesome food here for many years and have had company lunches and dinners here along with highly recommending them...I will no longer come here or refer anybody. Dont get me wrong..love the food, but I was so badly treated by the waiters that I am still in shock and just grateful that I practice non-violence and left after being yelled at and horribly treated by a waiter that I have seen working there for years!! I got there at 6:10 with a friend ordered our dinner and 10 minutes after they brought the food to our table they brought the check. We were not even halfway through our food. they came back several times and tried to take the check but I said we were not done ( I also wanted to order dessert at some point). we were still eating and he came back again to try and pack up our food and take the check again. I asked if there was a problem and could we finish our food...he said we needed to pay we were taking up the table!! First of all the place had many empty tables and nobody waiting, we sat down at 6:10 and at this point it wasn't even 7:00!! Meaning we wer not even allowed an hour for dinner!! he yelled at us and said we had to leave..OMG I was like WTF is going on?? it is the worst experience ever in a restaurant I have ever had!! I said very loudly can I at least get a to go cup for the rest of my ice coffee that I have paid for!! I wanted to make a scene so bad but it is not my style and I didn't want to lower myself to what had just happened. I am shocked as there are many new restaurants that have opens on Valencia street and you would think that customer service would be a priority with all the competition...I will not be returning or recommending this place ever again....so pissed off.
author: Delia G.

description: Truly delish Vietnamese. Try the little fired rice meatball appetizers. The service is friendly and the dishes are always consistent. I also recomend the Sunflower noodle. Garlic noodles served with crispy giant prawn and bean sauce. 33 served in a frosted glass mug is a sweet contrast to wash down the sultry and spicy eats. Yum! This place is good for weekend groups doing the mission bar crawl or families with kids on a week night.
author: JJ C.

description: I like the Vegetable Pho (lots and lots of veggies) and that's all I can really attest to...I don't think I've ordered anything else.
author: Ky W.

description: Excellent food, great service. The waiter is a happy and friendly. When we got in, the place was packed, but ended up only waiting 10 minutes for our table. I would definitely go there again. The Vietnamese ice coffee is good here.
author: Prasant R.

description: A dive, for sure.  And so good.  I always get the fresh shrimp spring rolls, the corn and crab soup, the garlic noodles and the spicy string beans.  My girlfriend loves the Pho.  Micheal, the waiter, is so nice, and he always brings little Andes mints with the check.  I didn't even like Vietnamese before I ate at this place.  Now, I eat it probably once a week.
author: Napoleon R.

description: I don't know how my friend and I ended up spending $38 at this place but it was well worth it. The veggie spring rolls are amazing and fresh, and then I got this HUGE grilled shrimp vermicelli dish for $7 dollars. This bowl could have been lunch, and dinner for another day or so. We also got this HUGE carafe of white wine which was surprisingly pretty good. We could not finish it because it was so huge we ended up giving it to the table next to us. Despite the growing line outside, our server was very pleasant and continually kept reminding us to take our time. Will definitely come here again. Now my favorite place for Vietnamese food.
author: Kat F.

description:
Let me start by saying that i am a bit prejudice when it comes to Vietnamese food. I was a bit skeptical when I first I saw the menu on the door and nothing was in Vietnamese. I honestly didn't know what kind of food they served (What the hell is beef noodle soup?! or seafood noodle soup?!).  But my friend wanted Vietnamese food and we were getting tired of walking around so we went in. They give us the menu and it is in English as well as in non-accented Vietnamese. Woohoo I could at least recognize somethings. Then I heard the waiters and cooks speaking in Chinese. Hmm  maybe they were ethnic Chinese Vietnamese? But then our food came and I was a bit sad. The crepe itself is good-its crispy and not too oily.  But the vegetarian dipping sauce is mediocre-it taste like soy sauce with vinegar and sugar. Its okay though because I usually eat my crepes with peanut sauce (mien trung style) but their peanut sauce was too watery and bland.  Next was the Hu Tieu aka seafood noodle soup-okay but not good. The broth should be much more flavorful but this was just lacked the zing and the seafood was just pitiful. My friend though ordered the bun with beef and egg rolls and that was delicious! Beef was so flavorful and tender and they give you huge, HUGE portions. 

bottom line, if you order stick to the basics-vermicelli, pho, beef. Don't get anything too  fancy. And next time I will get my hu tieu fix in Tenderloin.
author: Christie D.

description: After hearing raves about this place from my roommate, I finally made it.  The service was friendly, and the spring rolls were pretty good, despite the runny peanut sauce.  But then things got real dark when the entrees came.  When my curried chicken arrived at the table, I was overwhelmed by curry sauce laced with some sickeningly sweet smell that I still can't place even though it haunts my dreams and flowed from my pores for the next 24 hours.  I brought the leftovers home, but threw them away a week later after being unable to muster the courage to face it again.
author: Rachel B.

description: REALLY good White Fish Clay Pot. The fish was perfectly cooked, nice and tender. The Bun or Vermicelli as they call it (with pork and imperial rolls) was decent, not the best I've ever had, but still pretty good. The lack of alcohol was kind of a downer but the hot pot definitely made up for it...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I've never had a bad meal at Sunflower. Admittedly I think I always get the chicken pho and the spring rolls to start (w/peanut sauce), I put lots of hot sauce in my soup. It is yummy and the price is right. There is nothing very fancy about this restaurant but the food always hits the spot when I'm in the mood for Vietnamese. You never have to wait for a table, the service is quick and you can eat in or take out.
author: Abby W.

description: One of my favorite vietnamese restaurants.  Lunch special is pretty good and reasonably priced.   Parking at night is a real pain, so you might want to take Bart (it's about 1 block away).   I like their garlic noodles and bbq pork.
author: Jeff H.

description: Had a very late lunch here yesterday after wandering around trying to figure out what I was hungry for. So I said, fuck it, I'll just eat here after contemplating whether or not I'd rather have a salad at the restaurant next door. Yes, this is a hole in the wall. A hole that takes my debit card! Hurrah! Have you ever notice that most Vietnamese only take cash? Cold hard cash. Well, it turns out they weren't Vietnamese after all because the waitress gave me a blank stare when I ordered in Vietnamese. Oh well, the food is what counts. I ordered the seafood curry dish and it was alright. I'm not a fan of curry, except what my momma makes (what the hell was I thinking?) Should have ordered the pho. Pho is good. The people sitting at the other table had happy faces eating their pho. Should have ordered the pho...
author: Hieu D.

description:
I met some friends here for dinner one night.  Another friend and I were standing outside the entrance of the restaurant on the 16th Street side... our friends were on the Valencia side of the restaurant (think L-shaped);  I heard they share a kitchen...

Once we found our group, we got started with some vegetarian spring rolls.  For dinner, we had the BBQ pork, yellow curry tofu, steamed sea bass, vegetarian pho, the imperial roll with rice 'vermicelli' noodles, and some chicken dish that was supposed to come with rice wrappers, but came with lettuce instead.  All served with steamed rice...  I am not vegetarian, maybe part-time, if any, so I won't comment on the vegetarian-ness of the food but there was a significant selection to choose from.  Being from the South Bay, I felt this place was a little pricey for an 'authentic' Vietnamese restaurant.  

I swam laps earlier in the afternoon, so I didn't really care what I ate when I arrived - I needed a lot  of food and fast!!  So, as long as the food wasn't burnt or totally obscure tasting, I ate it... I had a bit of everything.

The spring roll appetizer was out in 5 minutes or so, and they served up the food within 20 minutes of our main order (though the restaurant wasn't too busy yet).  Definitely, the broth of the pho was not too thrilling - after I added some basil, 'red rooster' sauce, and bean sprouts, it had a better taste.  Also, there were more noodles than broth, so it almost looked like a saucy noodle dish.  I am a broth fan, so that was a bit disappointing.

We arrived at 7:20 PMish and by 8 PM patrons were lining up outside for a table, on a mid-week evening.

I am Asian, but not Vietnamese.  So, I can't really comment on the authenticity of the food. But, one guideline that I always use for any cultural restaurant is that if the place has a good cultural representation of the food, then the people of that culture would be eating there.  I did not notice anyone of distinct Vietnamese decent.

The service was on top of topping off our water glasses.  And, fairly customer service orientated.  I saw several patrons come in and ordered take-out; they were in and out within 5-7 minutes.

Though I am not terribly familiar with the Mission district, I would head back there for a basic meal.  And, I did come home with my lunch for the next day...
author: L R.

description: I totally loved the fresh spring rolls. I am a sucker for these and it has got to be my fave vietnamese dish. The rolls were huge for my tiny hands but really fresh and tasty. We also tried the fried egg noodles with seafood and it was awesome. The egg noodles were somewhat crispy but totally tasty. We had the grilled pork..the bbq taste was great but it was rather greasy. But all in all, I really enjoyed the food. Nothing great about the ambiance but yummy decent food that wont bust your wallet!
author: Topazskye L.

description: This place is great. It's a small, bare bones restaurant in the mission. You get a lot of food, for just a little bit of money. I went with a group of 5, the place was packed but we were seated in about 10 minutes. The waiter was extremely friendly and very fast (he had is order taking strategy down!). I ordered the calamari salad which was very good- sweet, tangy, salty--all the right flavor combinations, and for entree I had the Vietemese Grilled Beef. The food was amazing, but the beef dish was just a LOT of food-the one dish could have served 3 people. Sunflower is a great spot, and a nice change from all the taquerias of the mission. Its cheap, its yummy and its in a great neighborhood.
author: S A.

description: I love the food they make. It is my favorite!!! The customer service is just okay but I will be coming back here because it is delicious. Theyr soups are great!!!!
author: Zara L.

description: Everything was just okay.  I had the Chicken & Imperial Roll Rice Vermicelli and it was alright.  The other people at my table got the beef noodle (pho), the noodles were okay but the broth wasn't piping hot, which would of made the dish better.  Another person had the Lemongrass Shrimp lunch special, she said it was good.  It was clean and overall experience was okay. 3.5 stars
author: Chris L.

description: Seriously, you can't go wrong with this place. I've been many times and they never fail me. Fast service, consistent food quality, fair prices.
author: Greg B.

description: Yum yum gimme some bun. When it get's busy I can't believe how only 2 guys run the front. Too bad they lost their beer license "for temporary" Would be 5 stars if the place was just a little bit cleaner.
author: Leslie T.

description: I went to Sunflower for the umpteenth time yesterday and proclaimed "I could eat here everyday". Everything I've had has been delicious! The only reason they don't get a fifth star is that it gets hot in there. The 16th street side isn't as warm but you will smell like vietnamese food when you leave. Overall, great, consistent food.
author: B S.

description: This place is amazing. Reasonably priced food and they use really fresh ingredients. No matter where we have lived in the city my bf and I always come back to Sunflower. I would travel far and wide to have their imperial rolls and their pho. We always get both. The clay pot with Shrimp and tomatoes was hard for me to order, breaking the cycle of same meal ordering, but it was super tasty and I will definitely get it again.  The spring rolls are great, but how can you really mess up a spring roll. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place
author: Erin L.

description: Sunflower has good food, fair prices, and a great location. I usually get the Spring rolls, Beef Pho, or the vermicelli bowl with bbq pork and imperial rolls. Everything is good, though I sometimes have to punch up the flavor with some sriracha or chili and soy. Consistently tasty, good service.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Spicy prawns and garlic noodles, yum.  I can also tell you the steamed dumplings are really excellent -- just enough dumpling wrapper --exactly what I'm looking for in life.
author: Jordan K.

description:
eh?!

is this the twilight zone? why so many 4 stars? my fellow yelpers have failed me.

this place is "eh." the food = eh. the service = eh eh. i went and just wasn't that impressed. there is better pho to be had people (turtle tower) and better banh mi and better everything. delude yourself not!
author: monkey l.

description:
whats with the no more vietnamese beer?
great food as usual.
shaking beef baby!
author: s s.

description: It's been a while since I've been here but when I lived in the Mission District this was my favorite place to eat.  The food was cheap and oh so good.  My favorite dishes were the vegetarian pho and I believe something with eggplant and garlic.
author: A. V.

description:
i needed some clean, green food as the first real meal on monday after a weekend of debauchery, so i went looking in my new neighborhood for some sort of salad. after not quite finding what i was looking for, i ended up at sunflower and ordered the vegetarian salad and shrimp fresh spring rolls.

it hit the spot.

some other people in there ordered what seemed to be a noodle soup, and they looked pretty damn appetizing.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: I have been feeling sick for the last week with a cough that will not go away. So I ordered the beef Pho to go, so good, and it made my throat feel a lot better. My experiences with Pho in the past have been hit or miss, the meat always seems sketchy. Not here. It was fresh and really tasty.
author: Adrienne G.

description: This place is absolutely amazing!!!! Totally authentic!!! I'm Vietnamese and was wowed at their selection of entrees and appetizers. My boyfriend and I ordered the crab meat asparagus soup and the Bun Mi Cha Gio Tom Nuong (Vermicelli, Imperial Rolls and Shrimp) dish.  Both came out in heaping bowls of food and everything was made very well!!  The imperial rolls were super yummy and not greasy.  I only wished for more asparagus in the soup, but it was delicious nonetheless.   YUM! It is always the seedy looking places (from the outside) that turn out to be the best places.
author: Jessica N.

description:
I'm more a fan of the big side on Valencia than the smaller luncheon side on 16th.  If you're headed to the small side for lunch, the lemongrass chicken combo is great, but I wasn't such a fan of the other combos.

The dinner menu is why I keep coming back.  Perfectly steaming gargantuan bowls of yummy soup always look so tantalizing, but I somehow cave in to getting my favorite fish clay pot almost every time.  They also have RED rice as well as brown rice.  Try it, it's super.  Softer than brown rice with a great nutty taste... not sure of the nutritional positives, but there must be some.  Besides, it's simply a gorgeous color!

The shrimp spring rolls are always nice, fresh, and minty.  The steamed pot stickers have great flavor too.

Turn over is pretty quick, which is good, because this place is almost always full with a line out the door.
author: Kelly W.

description: Awesome place for Pho! I go here all the time. Quality is consistent. The wait staff is focused on getting people in and out so don't exect alot of chit chat with the staff. Ambiance is medium. Won't break the bank.
author: Frequent D.

description: The food here is undeniably amazing and hard to beat for the price.  My only complaint is the service.  However, even with the worst service, the food still evokes that simple contentment only great food can provide.  If you're looking for suggestions, just close your eyes and point....you're bound to get something good.  (the Vietnamese fried egg rolls and eggplant entree are amazing!)
author: Ashton M.

description:
okay, i know i am not the first person to be duped by the dual-locale thing, although i did feel a bit sheepish when it was pointed out to me that there's on 16th AND valencia. hehe. 
i love love love their pho. i've had the chicken and the beef and both are fantastic. srsly. i've had it once a week since i started going. 
i only docked a star because i want to see more non-fried appetizers. i always get the spring rolls (which are great), but my dining partner and i are eager for something new!
yea, sunflower!
author: Amanda B.

description: Went to the one in Potrero Hill.........Just a bit nicer atmosphere, more room but all in all the food is EXCELLENT! I never go wrong with SunFlower and both spots are A+. I personally like the Mission location cause theres bars to go to after your done eating!
author: Edward B.

description: I simply LOVE this place. I go get my fix of vermicelli, pork and spring rolls at Sunflower at least a couple of times a month. It's the best I've ever had. It's the only thing I've ever ordered there, so I can't comment on the rest of the food. If the main restaurant on Valencia is crowded, go to the alternative smaller space on 16th Street. The flamboyantly amazing waiter is very nice and funny.
author: Remy L.

description: Yummy Vietnamese joint in the Mission. Definitely order the tasty garlic noodles with spicy shrimp. Best of all, the price is downright friendly. We only paid about $10 each after being stuffed with so much food. So worth the trip to the Mission, especially if you get tired of waiting in line at Ti Couz.
author: Tami Y.

description: I love the Vietnamese food here for the price, location and menu variety!!! The vermicelli salad, the BBQ pork,  just tastes good and this place is always packed.  BUt I am concerned that local Vietnamese generally don't  make the special trek out to this place. Have the flavors been Americanized/Missionized? Near the Roxie movie theatre.
author: miriam b.

description: I really can't add much to what has already been said.  Very good, way too much food, cheap, and have the garlic noodles.  Really... have the garlic noodles.
author: Alured P.

description: I'm in love. The food here is good, affordable and it's just a stone's throw away from my house. Warm and friendly service. You'll go again and again.
author: Marianne s.

description: My favorite restaurant in the city, and possibly in the world. After at least 30 visits during the last year and a half, I have officially crowned the Sunflower as the shit. I have never had a bad meal here, but I will try to narrow it down to a couple of dishes. You cannot go wrong with any of their pho's, the crispy noodles (my favorite), or their fried noodles...including the staple Sunflower garlic noodles. The imperial roles here are the best I have come across in SF. You have a choice in just about everything here, including eating by the hard working chefs or in the dining room. Great people, great food, and tremendous vibe in this always busy Vietnamese treasure on the ever-cheezy corner of 16th and Valencia. Represent!!
author: Kenny G.

description: Best fried rice in the city.  So fresh.  Wonderful imperial rolls, soups, and chicken dishes.  Reminicent of my fav vietnamese place in Minneapolis - Lucky Dragon.  Nice work.
author: Simi J.

description: I don't care if everyone has said this place isn't authentic vietnamese... It's cheap & damn tasty!!!
author: Stephanie R.

description: The food was alright and the service was ok but the waiter decided to change the tip from 20% to 50%. Not a good idea. If you are really drunk and starving, this might be a good place to stumble into but eventually the big cake of dust is going to fall of the ceiling fan and into someone's food. It might help thicken the soup though.
author: John F.

description: I have to stop giving places 5 stars but I've lived here a goodly while and I'm starting with the places I go back to a lot. Sunflower is a fav because everything is delicious and it's reasonably priced and the staff are friendly as hell and the ambience is just right, plus you're surrounded by 25 dive bars so what more can you want. Have the larb salad, fresh spring rolls, any of the soups and the steamed fish with ginger, if you walk out the door and get hit by a bus it wouldn't be a bad way to go, though it would be a bit unlucky as no buses go down Valencia. Oh it has two doors and I prefer to eat on the Valencia Street side, it's less brightly lit and a bit more relaxed.
author: mefloquine x.

description: Had lunch, nothing to complain about at all.  Food was tasty and no issues with service.  Will be back s other dishes looked really good.
author: Stephen W.

description: The Pho here is exceptional!  They even have vegetarian pho which is pretty rare in the city.
author: Sarah I.

description: with so many good restaurants in the mission, this one is completely unmemorable.  head somewhere else if you're looking for some good pho!
author: Jill k.

description:
Vegetarian noodle soup (pho chay) and fresh vegetarian rolls. 

The pho has a vegetarian broth, perfectly cooked rice noodles, tofu, brocolli, snap peas, toasted onion, zucchini, bell pepper, and cauliflower. It comes in a huge bowl with a side plate of bean sprouts, fresh basil, jalapeno slices and a lime wedge. 

The fresh veggie rolls are as thick as a fist. They have a lovely taste of warm mushroom and tofu and carrot shaving and noodle. These are the best fresh rolls I've ever had.

Service is polite and quick, servings are huge and price is great.
author: Sarah J.

description: I get the catfish soup every time I go in there .  It's only 7 bucks and soo good.  Try it.
author: Matt B.

description: Best Vietnamese in the neighborhood. I love that they have two dining rooms with different feel. I'll take guests or even a date to the Valencia side or grab a quick cheap dinner by myself in the diner-esque 16th St. side (alsoa  good casual date spot). THe Vietnamese Pot Stickers are a deffinite everytime I go (and a bottle of "33" Vietnamese beer).
author: H. Joseph E.

description: I love this place! It's not fancy, but that's what's great about it! Since it's a block from my house, I can stumble in there in my pajamas for some pho when I'm sick, or stop by after work for crispy noodles when I can't imagine cooking. At one point I was eating here once a week at least! The food is fast, fresh, cheap and delicious! Plus I love how they have two locations in the same place...
author: Bethanne S.

description:
love me some sunflower!

the shaken beef is by far the best and the people that work there are great!!!
author: David F.

description: The Shaken Beef is excellent, the hot and sour soup is very good and the huge prawns in the sweet chili sauce over noodles was simply divine!! The service was excellent and because we ordered so much, they moved us to a larger table to accomodate all the different plates we ordered. It was lunch time, but they allowed us to order off the dinner menu. The food, service and wait staff are top notch. I will go there again. Besides it's only about 4-5 blocks from work!  :)
author: Carol N.

description:
Really good.

Portions are huge, inexpensive, and fast.  

I really love the Vietnamese Pot Stickers.  Deep fried goodness.
author: Nora m.

description: I work right around the corner and go here weekly. I always order the beef pho or pan fried noodles with chicken, pretty much anything on the menu is good. The lunch special is always a good deal as well. Love this place!!! Decent service.
author: julie q.

description: no ambience.  but cheap.  and the best vegetarian spring roll i've ever had.
author: Flevoland D.

description: I really hate giving one-star ratings.  I really feel bad about it.  But I also want to make sure that the restaurants I review with four or five-star ratings aren't clumped anywhere near the same category as restaurants who provide substandard food.  This is San Francisco - the best city in the world for food.  I have had so many wonderful culinary experiences in this city since I moved here.  But not at Sunflower.  My boyfriend remembers this place as one of his favorites and so we went to try it.  The salad rolls were really bland.  The spring rolls were okay - but again kind of bland and just too oily and doughy.  And the soup we got was sparse and uneventful.  And the prices are not that cheap - there are many restaurants with the same prices who provide simply amazing food.
