Maybe they can get away with this in a different city and maybe if I lived in another place I'd be thrilled that there is a restaurant like this in town - but I live in San Francisco and my standards are high.  Service was not spectacular and atmosphere is a little cramped and really, really tepid food.
author: Heather K.

description: this is one of my favorite places for an easy, quick dinner.  their veggie spring rolls will have you completely hooked!  and their soups are perfect for this weather.
author: shirin a.

description: Excellent food! Very little seating so go early during the week. Try the lemon herbgrass chicken and some spring rolls or the shrimp. Total cost is about $10 per person. Slight inconsistency with the food which is another reason to get their early, so your chef puts a little more love into your dish.
author: H K.

description:
yummy.  cheap. convenient.

the pho is pretty good and like that the beef is REALLY lean.  they give it to you raw and it cooks in the steaming broth.

shaking beef is also very good

good stuff.
author: DJ N.

description: Not a bad restaurant, good prices, nice portions, nice staff and decent food.  Only complaint are the fried spring rolls could be a little more flavorful - if I am going to eat a 600 calorie appetizer it better taste good.  Beef was seasoned nice and flavorful.  Have to bring your own booze - hey its the mission, just go to the corner, grab a bottle of wild turkey or whatever :-) and save yourself a few bucks.
author: Josh W.

description:
I'm now completely convinced that there are two totally different Sunflowers, notwithstanding that they use the same kitchen.  This one, the 16th St. side, is a dingy but fun place, with a really friendly and attentive waiter (maybe the owner?) and decent food.  The pineapple soup is good, and fhe pho is also good.  They don't seem to put any mint or anything else in the goi cuon, so it's a bit bland.  The grilled beef is not so great, nowhere near that at Mai's.

Don't bother with the 16th St. side; it's really tiny and crowded, feels much more rushed, and I swear the food was not as good.  Maybe it's all psychological, but even if it is, listen to your psyche and not your powers of reason (same kitchen=same food).
author: Spaulding A.

description: Excellent food at very good prices.  I have eaten here many times and always get a good meal.
author: Tim H.

description: Not bad, but not great. The inside was so hot and sticky we were uncomfortable the whole time. But the food was pretty good.
author: D B.

description:
the food in this place is fantastic and cheap.!!!!

great "lunch specials"..., make you want to come back everyday

very small place though

friendly servers
author: d d.

description: I think the same two dudes work here every day of the week.  They're really nice.  Never have to ask for things twice.  service is very good.  Veggie pho is solid there.  Sorta plain, but its GOOD for you. a heap of vegetables and some broth with noodles.  So is most pho i guess.  It comes with a stack of sprouts, fresh basil and limes.  Grrr.
author: Benzo K.

description:
I love their spring rolls with the fish sauce (rather than peanut sauce).  Yum!  So fresh and crispy.

Their pho's not bad either.
author: Chiaraesemplice I.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood; we generally eat there every couple of weeks -- and usually have the same things: curry vegetables; veggie fried rice; and vermicelli with deep fried veggie egg rolls.  I also love the pot stickers.  

I've seen a few negative reviews of the service; we get great service every time.  The guy who brings the food and the bus boy are extraordinarily polite and friendly.  The waiter/host always recognizes us and is friendly.
author: Jeff H.

description: This place is very yummy.  it has my favorite dish in the city--steamed sea bass in ginger sause--holy poop!  very very intimate though, meaning you'll leave there smelling like the cooks.
author: jefferson h.

description:
i love sunflower!
it's cheap and tastes good, though the space is kinda cramped sometimes. 
the veg options are awesome and the dinner and lunch specials are a rad deal.
i have never had a bad experience at sunflower. try it.
author: Elizabeth O.

description: One my favourites. I always order the BBQ Chicken w/vermicelli noodles and imperial roll. Its so good. I also like the lemongrass beef. The staff is nice too. I highly recommend.
author: UT V.

description: After DJing a 4 hour set outside on Saturday in standard SF evening weather I was in the mood for a hot bowl of Pho. I always go to the Valencia street side, it seems a little more inviting. I am always very pleased by the cute attentive waiters and the tasty soups. The spring rolls are are a little gigantic, but I think the sauce they give you is one of the best I've had in the city. Once I had an appetizer omelet that was THE best thing ever - crispy fried egg awesome-ness. If I didn't have the tendency to get so full on the soup I would get it every time.
author: K T.

description:
yum!!!

i love the lunch specials, a wholly meal for the price of 8 bucks that includes salad, vietnamese-style sweet and sour soup (my favorite!), rice and choice of meat (can never go wrong with five-spice chicken or grilled beef here!)
author: binh l.

description: I'll be honest, I haven't eaten that much Vietnamese food in my day, but whatever they do here-- they need to keep on doing it.  Two words: garlic noodles.  It's reasonably priced --  not the cheapest, but I can afford to pay rent and eat here on occasion.
author: Lolee B.

description: The host/waiter was rude and service was non-existent.  My bf and I waited for a table and it was quite cold out, so we wanted to be seated away from the door.  We found a spot in the middle of the room, but the rude host demanded we sit and wait near the door since that spot was reserved.   We never saw reservations signs on the table, but we were fine with not being seated at that particular table.  We told him we would still wait at the table that was "reserved" until the people across from us were done with paying the check.  The host still demanded that we sit near the cold door.  What a deutsche bag!  It didn't make any sense, the people who made the reservations were not even there yet.  They could have served us at the "reserved table", and cleaned up the other table and have the reservation sit at the table they just cleaned up.  I'm never bringing my business here.  We decided to leave and have pizza across the street at Arinell Pizza, which was our original plan.  We only strayed away from the original plan because we wanted to give this Vietnamese place a shot.  Too bad for them.  Oh and by the way, we were soo offended by them we made it a point to join yelp today, just so we can express our discontent.  As Stephanie Tanner would say, "How rude!"
author: Yumi C.

description:
This is my all-time favorite place to eat. It's too bad that they don't deliver, but it's soooo in demand that I really don't blame them.
Definitely get the Pho Bo...or just get anything here.
It really is fast service, but I'm okay with that because it's inexpensive and delicious.
author: Elsa H.

description:
Their huge bowls of beef noodle soup are quite tasty. I can never finish it though. The host is really nice too. 

If you are sick or getting sick, go around the corner to the 16th street location & get the beef noodle soup to go.. Just be sure you have your own sriracha to add if you get it to go. mmm sriracha.
author: Willow B.

description:
I love this place and I must proclaim, their longtime server is the BEST server in the entire city.  He is ON it like Christmas is on December 25th.  He's also the nicest waiter I've ever had.  He is an angel.  
I wish that they still sold beer and wine, but otherwise.. this place is the joint.
author: Pearl A.

description: I love this place!! I have never had anything that I didn't like!! I love the curry chicken, the lemon chicken, the imperial rolls with vermicelli, the crispy noodles... Yummy!! I usually come for lunch and have a good experience...
author: martha s.

description:
Another night, another Mission eatery. Pretty decent Vietnamese food. We ordered Vermicelli Noodles and Curry Eggplant, and both of them were prepared well - spicy as we requested.
If you go there, give their Vietnamese iced coffee a try. My brother really liked it. They serve it in a very unique style - you get a small glass containing condensed milk, with hot coffee dripping from a filter placed on top of the glass. After the coffee is done dripping, you are supposed to stir it, and pour it into another glass over ice.
author: P G.

description: Sunflower is basically my default food in the neighborhood.  If I'm alone, I go to the boxy and slightly claustrophobic place on 16th.  If I'm with friends I go to the bigger and fancier side on Valencia.  Either way, I get the seafood noodle soup, which is my definition of the perfect food-- spicy, healthy, and wholesome.  The only thing I wish they did is give the radio a break in the section on 16th.  It is very annoying especially if you are reading the paper at the bar.  The service there is perfect-- efficient and quick.
author: karl m.

description: Would never eat there!  Called to get the telephone number for their new sister restaurant in potrero and they hung up on me.  Thought we got disconnected so I called back.  Asked again, and he said " I don't know you have to call them" and hung up on me again.   Good way to go out of business.
author: Michelle A.

description: If you have never experience Vietnamese food, this should be a first stop! Each time I come here I order what I call the bowl of happiness. It is a fish dish prepared in a clay pot with shrimp, scallows, sea bass, vegetables and other yummy goodness. This place is always packed, so you'll to get here early. There is also a sister store around the corner to check out if you don't have extra time to wait. Service is overly friendly and accommodating. From my experience in the industry, this place is ran well and serves great food!
author: Michael Y.

description: I just love this place.  The servers are so great, the food is consistently awesome, and did I mention the food is great?
author: C. M.

description: After a full day of city hiking up and down stairways in the Castro, Ashbury Heights, and Mt Sutro, Lila and I were in dire need of some serious sustenance. And since we were feeling especially poor, we were in search of a place disregarding the typical San Francisco standard of charging 2.5X what the food is actually worth. Luckily for us, we found Sunflower, a very unassuming "authentic" Vietnamese restaurant in the Mission. Now just how authentic this place actually is, I will not comment, however, the food was delicious, the service relatively friendly and quick. We ordered the fresh vegetarian spring rolls, two enormous rice paper wrapped parcels stuffed with sauted cabbage, mushrooms, tofu, carrots, lettuce, mint, and basil served with a delicately sweet, yet slightly spicy sauce. Two humongous rolls for $4.50. Not bad at all, in fact, I probably would have been full on that dish alone, but since we split it, we also ordered entrees. I went for the steamed chicken salad- lean strips of chicken breast atop a mound of shredded cabbage, carrots, and onions and topped with diced peanuts and mint. Lila ordered the fried beef noodles, a rather heavy dish with chow mien style noodles, broccoli, cabbage, onions, and beef. The chicken salad was light and crunchy. However, I was not even able to finish it, as the portions are huge. Lila's beef noodle dish was also quite good, although I am not sure how authentically Vietnamese it actually was. My salad was only $5.50, and it may well have been enough for two people. So, all in all come to Sunflower if you want some flavorful Vietnamese style food without emptying your bank account.
author: Kate A.

description:
it has been nearly four months since i have felt the desire to yelp anything. i am not going to try to be witty in this review. just simply tell the truth about sunflower. 
i have been here a total of three times now. the first two... the service was very slow. but food made up for it.
 but yesterday (my third, and last time) was absolutely ridiculous. so slow! and food was just OK too. they even got one of our dishes wrong. so the meal comes to an end... and we are deciding on tip. we had just enough in cash to pay the bill and leave two dollars more. very cheap-o i know... but fuck i was punk once. people have gotten much less out of me. so we factored in quality of service and quality of food... and our waiter came out of the situation with a $2.55 tip.  thats the way the dice rolls sometimes.
we exit the restaurant and stand in front for a moment to listen to a bum mooing like a cow and decide our next mission adventure. all of a sudden a waiter comes out (not even the guy that helped us) and starts to tell us we didn't tip enough, and the guy deserved more, but that he "didn't care"... "i didn't serve you!" 
so a calm argument between our group and this gentlemen starts. one of us says "tip is optional", one of us says "we gave what we had", i spout out "you are hassling us for something we don't have". oh no, the guy did not stop. the mooing bum and another passer-by got in on the argument. he would yell, we would yell, then he would yell at the end each argument "but i dont care". 
 we finally ended the argument after a full ten minutes, and had to just walk away. 

i am so PHOstrated!!!
its still pissing me off today.
author: alexis g.

description: Not a place for Pho, even if you live nearby and are in dire need... trek over to  TL or Clement. Service can be slow, but they try. Spring rolls are decent and yes the dipping sauce leaves something to be desired. The other food here seems to be the wiser choice.
author: Daniel C.

description: most of the time i love this place nice spring rolls great bowls of pho ga but to day they had a new waitress training and she seemed real nice but couldnt under stand english pretty much at all we placed our order and she gave it to the boss and he shook his head at us like it was our falt maybe they should hire people for minimum wage instead of proably alot less oh well every body wants to save a little money better to get english speaking and spend a little more on the help food is still good................yes i no i cant write properly but im not feeding you ciao
author: tommy b.

description: Great food, a little whole in tha wall gem for some authentic Vietnamese grub. Not fancy, but the food is delish!
author: RED L.

description: had delicious vegetarian pho with TONS of veggies inc all my favs: broccoli, coliflower, red pepper, pea pods and mushrooms (eww). my dining buddies also had various kinds of pho and all seemed to enjoy, the only complaints were regarding the size of the bowl (I certainly couldn't eat all mine though) and that the seafood pho wasn't seafoody enough. other than that, great! a little pricey for asian food but it's in the heart of the mission and it's very cute and the staff is really friendly.
author: Eva L.

description:
update: 7/12/2005
something has happened.  service is suddenly very bad:
rude, abrupt, sloppy.
author: Gordon S.

description: why did i wait so long to try this place? the prices are quite reasonable and the waitstaff friendly. we came by for a late lunch on sunday and it was still decently crowded (no wait though). ordered vermicelli with imperial rolls and grilled shrimp plus banh xeo (crepe). both were ginormous and delicious! the iced coffee was extra creamy and had me tweaking out the rest of the day - wee!
author: Angi C.

description: I don't know why I keep coming back here, expecting to have delicious noodle soup.  No flavor.  None.  Noodles in water with crunchy sprouts.  Even though it's local, I will skip the vietnamese unless I'm willing to drive to the richmond.
author: J E.

description: There are two of these on the corner of 16th and Valencia. Have the same waiter every time on Valencia side's Sunflower, such a pleasure! Service is great, food is good, and the price is right.
author: Elysha K.

description: Rude, rude, rude! These guys are so rude and have such lousy customer service; yelling at us after we complained about the fish not being fresh and telling us we stayed in their restaurant for 4 hours; try 1-1/2 hrs max! I guess this is why the fish was not fresh?? Please! Are you kidding me?We will never ever go back! Don't subject yourself to this place!
author: Stacey B.

description: this place is never very impressive, but its the only place in town that serves vegetarian noodle soup, and even offers seafood noodle soup without chicken broth. if only they could bump up the taste.
author: Renee L.

description: Not bad. About $7 for a rice or vermicelli plate. $8 for a combo. Nothing special. But the imperial spring roll is pretty good. I think they put a lot of garlic in it. I would go there again but its nothing special.
author: Dijon Y.

description: I was sick after eating here, twice. I do not get sick easily. My brother was also, um... well, had stomach problems as well after eating here. The food tasted great, the food poisoning keeps me away.
author: Jordana J.

description: Decent, if just plain pho.  The most fun was the crepes, which I've never known about before and was really unexpected.
author: e g.

description: i thought i liked it the first time, but that it was just my dish that was off.... but then i went back... neither of us liked our food it was SO GREASY and gave me a tummy ache. like the last time. so this is pretty fast foody. it is cheap. definitely you can eat a lot for a little $. which is why my friend nikoh liked it. but our second visit here and jesse and i decided we would not go back.
author: Merredith L.

description: me no like, i ordered a bun and they made the sauce with soy sauce instead of fish saunce, so it tasted more chinese than vietnamese
author: Dredge K.

description: my husband and i met there for lunch the other day. don't get confused like he did and accidentally go to the one on 16th or next to where yum yum's used to be. anyway, two of the seven lunch specials were vegetarian, so i picked one for each of us. they were plentiful, with a totally delicious soup, and other goodies. good prices, lots of food. the only problem was that they seemed in a large rush to shoo us out, and even brought the check before my husband arrived!
author: Theresa P.

description: the food is alright, but the service is some of the worst I have ever seen.
author: Rigo H.

description: I'm still recovering in bed from my bout with Sunflower.  However, let's start with the food... We had the Hot/Sour Soup, Vietnamese prawns and Basa fish... which was kind of bland going down but was very pungent coming up late last night.  In essence I got sick, granted I had kind of a stressful day  and maybe that was a contributing cause but I don't think i'll be going back any time soon.  As several Yelpers have mentioned the food is  a little bland and there are half a dozen comparable Vietnamese places in the area.
author: nick f.

description: how cute is this place??  although my expectations were admittedly low (from the outside the place looks like a hole in the wall that might be a little dark and crusty on the inside), i ended up loving this place. our waiter was this slight, middle aged asian man who felt the need to apologize profusely... totally endearing. and the food was stellar (i ordered the beef pho) and really cheap (for once, i could afford to spring for an appetizer). i totally recommend this place to anyone willing to battle it out for parking in the inner mission.
author: Angie Y.

description: great value for their lunch special! 8 dollars will get you a full plate of elegantly sauteed and spiced meat or veggies (or both), delicious hot and sour soup (with pineapples in the broth), a large crispy empanada, and a side of cabbage and jasmine rice. healthy, quality food at a nice price.
author: Nicky T.

description: I like the cheap noodles and the lunch specials. You can get a beer nearby while you wait for the food to be made. I tried to order takeout over the phone once from the online menu but its not the same as the menu they have at the store and the woman on the phone couldn't understand me.
author: Post R.

description: i dream about the shaken beef.  i used to live right down the street from here.  the food is good, fast, and a great value.  i don't know why, but i always prefer the 16th street side to the valencia side.  even though it's the same kitchen, i like the cozy hole in the wall feel of the 16th street side.  i wish i could eat the beef right now.
author: becky k.

description: First time visit. Delicious sea bass fillet, shrimp rolls, and veggie steamed dumpling pot stickers. Appreciated on a busy Sat night that they sat two of us at a 4 person table since we were next in line. Service v good and friendly. Would definitely go back. p.s. same kitchen but this review is for the Valencia side which is more of a restaurant vs the 16th side which is more of a quick eat cafe.
author: Greg M.

description: i recommend  the vietnamese potsticker( actually it looks more like a deep-fried meatball), the crepes and the garlic noodles.  unfriendly and unhelpful service though......do not like the ambiance at all....the dining room lacks fresh breathing air when the door is closed.
author: m c.

description: all of the vermacelli options are amazing - i have their number and menu in my dashboard so i can pick up this food whenever the urge strikes. prices are good, too - just don't try and park nearby.
author: Casey W.

description: food is okay and cheap. nothing to rave about. the restaurant is too small to actually eat at and feel comfortable. good for take-out.
author: Felicia H.

description: Solid meal, good price, good service. Not too greasy. The soups are big and come with basil, sprouts, peppers, and lime. Always go away happy even when I had to wait 20minutes for a table.
author: Shane H.

description: i love coming here, i hate parking! we have gotten it down to i get out of the car and wait for the table while my husband parks. unless we go with friends and then both of us are circling the mission. the food here is great, its simple and probably not totally authentic...but its good enough for me.  the guys that work there are really sweet. i recommend the crispy noodles, shaken beef, hot and sour soup and the fresh spring rolls....yum! the energy around the place is fantastic...always something going on.
author: Naureen H.

description: I just visited for the first time and ordered the BBQ Pork Vermicelli Plate with Imperial Rolls as take-out ($7.95).  I was impressed by the low price, and the inside of the restaurant looked cozy, if a bit loud.  However, I was a little disappointed by my food.  The Imperial Rolls were just big fried blah, not crispy or particularly flavorful, and with no sauce.  I guess I should have paid the $1 extra to get the fresh spring rolls instead.  The rice vermicelli and pork were okay, but not very warm (even though I ate less than 10 mins after picking up my food) and just not too flavorful.  I frequently order this dish at Vietnamese restaurants and this was definitely one of the lamer versions I've had. I felt like they were missing some of those amazing Vietnamese herbs/mint.  I can't really complain since the price was so low, but I don't think I'll go back, at least not for that dish...
author: Leah K.

description: On July 15, 2009, me and my family went to San Francisco to visit family and we all decided to have dinner at this restaurant, which was highly recommended. The food was ok, but the service was TERRIBLE!!!. I asked the waiter for some water and he gave me a whole pitcher of water and placed it near my plate and it almost spilled. I guess I had to serve my own water. Finally we got the check and we had a discrepancy on the check and we asked him for a brief explanation. The total came out to about $35.00, but for some reason we didnt get the right change. He rudely said, " I had to add tax, WHAT YOU DON'T PAY FOR TAX?" Instaed of politely telling me that he said it like we didnt know better. So I said F##K it and started to leave without giving him any tip, because of his poor service. He then opened the check book and realized their was no tip and angrily said,"What happened?" I told him, the service was terrible and he got upset. So overall the food was mediocre and the service was TERRIBLE!! I do not reccommend this restaurant to anyone. There are other restaurants out there with better service.
author: Mikey B.

description: Great food at a great price.  They have generous portions and the service is very friendly.  I recommend the garlic noodles with chicken and vegetables--so delicious.
author: A J.

description: first time having vietnamese place is small but service is very fast , first time havinf vietnamese i think i need some time to get used to it  but their chaken beef is the best , chicken curry not so bad as well
author: NAEL K.

description: There's nothing better than a friend showing up unexpectedly at your house with an arm full of yummy take out.  Lucky us, we feasted on garlic green beans, veggie potstickers, noodles with shrimp, fried rice, etc. Four of us ate for $50 and there's enough for tomorrow. Is 8 a.m. too early to bust out the leftovers?
author: Cher E.

description: there may be cheaper, or more hidden, or slicker vietnamese restaurants in the city, but this places remains a favorite.  there is one incredibly friendly guy who waits tables there (maybe the owner?), and he totally makes it for me.  i always get the vegetarian bun.  fried tofu, an assortment of fresh vegetables, heaping helping of vermicelli, and lots of bean sprouts and cilantro.  when you top it with a young coconut to drink from, that's a pretty perfect dinner!  when i lived in the hood, i'd get that to go, and have 2-3 lunchs out of it.  portions are ver generous!
author: nicole l.

description: the garlic noodles ain't no thanh long garlic noodles, but they WILL *sigh* do. the eggplant dish is really good. my valencia friends and i love it =)
author: T V.

description: This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Molly and I stopped in for a quick lunch on Monday around 1:30pm. They have the best lunch special in town, in my opinion. For $7.95 you get a cup of hot & sour soup, asian cabbage slaw, fresh spring rolls (usually comes with an imperial roll, but I substitute the fress roll for 50 cents), rice and entree. I got the lemongrass prawns, a heaping portion of sauteed green beans, onions, prawns, garlic, lemongrass and chilies. I absolutely love the soup, a tangy and slightly spicy broth with chunks of pineapple, tomatoes, tofu, mushrooms and bean sprouts. The fresh spring rolls, filled with vermicelli noodles, lettuce, mint, basil and shrimps, are one of my favorite food items ever. They serve it with a clear sauce, today a little heavy on the fish sauce, so I also asked for a side of peanut sauce for dipping. I can never eat the entire plate of 5 different items, so it usually makes a great second meal or afternoon snack. Molly ordered the vegetarian noodle soup, a giant bowl filled to the brim, overflowing with rice noodles, cabbage, mushrooms, tofu and a meriad of other vegetables. The portion is definitely enough for 2-3 people, so for $6, this is definitely a great bargain. I never get sick of Sunflower and especially reccommend the lunch special (though any meal there is usually great). I also like the full portion of the hot & sour soup and could probably eat that everyday.
author: Ariel D.

description: Great take out! Wish they delivered. Have eaten there and it was OK but a little slow. The lemon grass beef and lemon grass chicken rock! Great imperial rolls and also the fresh rolls. Tasty spicy good quality food for a reasonable price. This place stands ouf for good food for good value! I will continue to returna and order out from this place.
author: Bob J.

description: Food here is a bit overrated... I lived in Vietnam for 6 months and find this food to be authentic, but with poorly balanced flavores... their "goi cuon" or spring rolls are a winner, but still not nearly as good as what you'll find in Fremont or San Jose... and yes, I've driven to Fremont for the pho and spring rolls over this place. It is a good find in the mission, and as some say the best vietnamese in the mission (but there's not much competition!).
author: Michael H.

description: i usually stick with pho at vietnamese places but sunflower may have changed my mind about that.  got some sort of bbq lemongrass beef noodle thing that was the jam.  i'm not a large man, but its rare that i can't finish a plate of food anywhere.  sunflower's portions kick my ass.
author: Markus B.

description: it's itty bitty and i've had the same server here everytime i've been in. he's nice, and he likes to talk at the top of his high pitched voice/sort of yell to his co-workers throughout the restaurant. he kinda cracks me up all while grinding on my brain at the same time...i don't really understand, but whatevs cuz whenever i think about yummy spring rolls this spot always pops in my head.
author: Angie B.

description: giant plates of food! good place to share with people. great food!
author: Chelsea H.

description: For garlic noodles, you're better off going to PPQ Dungeness. For pho, you're better off going to PPQ on Irving. But this place is satisfying; you can't mess up twice-fried Imperial Rolls, and the huge portions are a plus.
author: A. T.

description: Great food and cheap, but lousy service. You won't mind having waited 15 minutes or so to get service once the food comes out. The ingredients were all quality and vegetables were super fresh. I would recommend trying some appetizers, pot stickers (veggie or pork). Noodles were a bit too sweet, beef looked awesome, good soups.
author: Brad Y.

description: I just had an incredible Ph ! The only thing I can complain about is the chopstick set made of plastic which are very slippery.
author: Emil T.

description: Sunflower is hands down one of our favorite restaurants in SFO.  They have the best Five Spice Chicken and I can eat their friend tofu app all freaking day.   Sunflower also has our most favorite (adorable) flaming ass gay waiter in all of San Francisco.  Go to Sunflower.
author: Tarina T.

description: this place is AMAZING. its cheap and NOT in quality.  the servers are really nice and FAST. I always feel VIP when i eat here.
author: Jenna R.

description: Excellent service, huge portions, great vietmanese food (and I am not usually a big fan of such food!), and great prices! All around excellent! Lunch menu is also GREAT!
author: Laura R.

description: Never had anything bad here.  OK, the truth is I haven't had much other than the Eggplant Curry.  It's amazing.  It is important to note that I douse it in that tasty sweet plum sauce.  Some people may believe if you have to put condiments of any sort on a dish that it can't be THAT good.  In this instance, I'd disagree.  Only because the moment I see that plum sauce I throw it in heaping piles on top of anything in front of me because I usually like it more than anything in front of me.  I guess I should make a Yelp review on the plum sauce.  I don't even know what it's officially called.  Back to Sunflower's review - it really has great, inexpensive food and you can bring friends, family or a hot date to this place.  Maybe I'm the only one who would bring a hot date to this place, but you should try it.
author: Cris O.

description: Passable but inconsistent food, but you can almost always get a table.  Just had a remarkably over-cooked seafood dish, worst shrimp I think I've ever chewed through.  Recently lost their beer & wine license, love to hear the story behind that :-)
author: Jeff P.

description: I'm a regular at this restaurant, meaning I've dined here an average of once a month for 20 years. It is one of the more satisfying Vietnamese places in the City, and for the price, an absolute bargain. That's why it'sbeen there for 3 decades, and is routinely SRO on weekends. I agree with Gregory C that there is better Pho to be found, especially in places that specialize. Happily, there are other options than usual to choose from, and while they're not all outstanding, many are standouts.  Their steamed sea bass melts in your mouth and can be addicting;  their clay pot special feeds two, with caramelized onions, chicken, sweet pork sausages and veggies heaped in a clay pot with a slightly sweet ginger sauce on stove toasted rice. Their Vietnamese crepe is the best I've sampled, with a large crispy crepe, filled with, jerk style chicken, shrimps, bean sprouts (or total veggie with tofu) that you wrap in fresh mint, green lettuce and  coriander - a light, refreshing meal in itself.  Imperial rolls, meat and vegetarian, are unfailingly crunchy and ready to be rolled in leaves with pickled daikon. My partner is a fan of their crispy noodles with veggie topping - not the most exotic dish, but refreshingly light as a side dish. Everyone works hard at this restaurant; it's frequently packed at lunch and dinner, and by the end, the cook and wait staff have been running around for hours, serving dishes that average less than $10.  Still, I find them to be warm and efficient at all times. It's amazing what comes out of the miniscule kitchen, which is on display on the 16th street side of the restaurant (the other entrance is on Valencia).
author: Mark T.

description: This is one of the best Vietnamese Restaurants in the city for a very cheap price.  The Sunflower Prawns over garlic noodles are to die for.   The staff is great and try the imperial rolls  - the ones where you get rice paper, beef, chicken, shrimp and other fixings to roll your own.
author: John M.

description: disclaimer: i've only ever gotten one dish here-- the vegetarian crepe. but it's so outstanding that i had to give 5 stars. crunchy like a dosa on the outside, soft inside and loaded with tofu, mung beans, and bean sprouts. plus it comes with beautiful red leafed lettuces, mint leaves, carrots and some kind of radish. outstanding! my favorite to-go in the whole city.

author: mon o.

description: This is a great place to take friends with ravenous appetites. You can eat plates and plates of food, have some Hue beers and still end up paying well under $20 each for dinner. It's cheap, tasty - a good casual place to meet up without reservations.   Now, about the food. Here are some of my favorite dishes:  Vietnamese crepe - No, this isn't their way of competing with Ti Couz across the street. This is a really tasty appetizer chock full of crispy fresh mung sprouts and shrimp, chicken, and other goodies. It's kind of like an omelet but filled with tasty goodies. It's pretty big, so something good to split with a few people.   Shaken beef - I think this is one of the best beef dishes anywhere. It's simple, but really flavorful. The meat is extremely tender, not fatty, and under $10 (I think). This is definitely a crowd favorite.   Chicken soup with egg noodles (not rice noodles) - Whenever I'm sick, I hobble down to Sunflower for this soup. Simple flavors that are the best thing for clearing up a cold.   One last thing to know about Sunflower is that there are 2 locations. So if you're ever meeting a friend there, specify the Valencia or 16th street entrances. The Valencia side has a touch more atmosphere, forgiving lighting, more seating, and a bathroom. But, the 16th St side is where you'd pick up takeout, get a quick lunch by yourself, or if you enjoy flourescent lighting.
author: J K.
